story:
Welcome!

First, I would like to thank you for visiting this site and for considering making a donation.

The Age of Maturity is a web series that was written to shed light on some of the issues that young adults face as we go out into the world and try to make it on our own. I feel that it is important to share these types of stories to let this group of people know that they are not alone. We all have issues dealing with family, relationships, education and finding the right career. I believe this series can be both inspirational and entertaining.

I was fortunate enough to have quite a few aspiring filmmakers come on board to help bring this vision to life. Now I ask that you help continue the process. A donation of any size would be helpful and all the proceeds would go into the production. The money would be used to post-production (video editing, color correction, sound design, graphic design, etc.) of the first season and pre-production (location scouting, makeup and wardrobe, etc.) for the second season.

If do not have the means to donate, you can also help us out by promoting our campaign to friends and family. We would greatly appreciate anything you can do for us.

For more updates like The Age of Maturity on Facebook, follow us on Instagram (@ageomaturity) and be sure to visit our website, which is currently under construction and will be up and running soon!

ageomaturity.wixsite.com/webseries

Thanks again for the consideration and your support!

Best,

Michael C. Anderson Jr.

Writer, Director & Producer

The Age of Maturity

Cast & Crew

A large amount of talented individuals all dedicated a great amount of time to bring this story to life. Donating to the series would also help to promote their brands and highlight their talent.

Cast

Shawn Lawrence

Isaiah Jimenez

Parnesha Ingram

Audrey White

Daja Walker

Sebastian Serra

Tashika J. Moore

Marcus Anthony Nieves

story:
Would you like to help people get jobs?

Ann Thomas founded Transgender Talent two years ago with a goal to provide jobs for transgender and gender non-conforming people.   This community has an excessively high unemployment rate, on average twice that of the population as a whole, and 4 times that for transgender people of color.  However, this community has an amazing amount of talent that flourishes when we live our genuine lives, they  also have stories of strength and resilience to tell. Actors, comedians, artists, singers and more, the Transgender community is just as diverse as their cisgender counterparts, and it was time for them to be represented. Ann saw that they weren't and started working to change that.

Transgender Talent provides a central point for people in the entertainment industry to find transgender people for acting (both in TV/films and on stage), singing, and other roles as needed.  As we are reached out to by writers, producers, directors, casting directors and other Hollywood entities, we educate them not only on what they should be looking for in regards to hiring transgender people, but how to respect this community's true identities when going on the search for them.

Currently, Transgender talent is engaged in booking actors, models, stand-up comedians, crew, composers, musicians, and more.  We help network people together who can help with writing, consulting and support regarding film, television and theater production.  For some trans people, just the opportunity to audition at a major studio fulfills a lifelong dream.  For others, they are looking to make a career in Hollywood, and the representation and networking that Transgender Talent gives them is invaluable.

Despite being almost entirely volunteer, this is what Transgender Talent does for its clients every day:

Actors:

Transgender Talent is frequently approached by production companies, as well as getting requests from the major studios and networks, as well as theater groups, for transgender actors to cast.  At this time, we are submitting actors only when specifically asked for transgender people to fill roles.  There have been unfortunately few of these compared with how many actors there are looking for work.  However, there has been an increased number of requests for transgender people to fill roles that do not specify gender identity.

For smaller trans roles, we request the sides (small section of the script that covers the lines for the role being cast.)  For larger roles, we request the entire script.  Our volunteer staff reads the script to make sure trans people are being respected and that the character is not the typical cliché that has been in film and TV for half a century (ie. prostitute with no depth, mass murderer, dead body, etc.)  If the script looks good, which they do in most cases, we submit people that fit the breakdown.  If the script is bad, or the production in general appears suspicious, we do not submit anyone.  That has happened on occasion since we started, and Ann--as well as the rest of the staff--fiercely advocates for Transgender Talent's clients. Cisgender agents will not provide that level of protection for the transgender community.

Comedians:

We have begun doing comedy shows on an ongoing basis. These shows are made up almost entirely of transgender comedians, though we have featured a duo of a transgender woman and her wife as well.

 -----------

Here is what we could do with proper funding:

Transgender Talent does what we can, but as of January 2017, it has been funded mostly out of our own meager personal day job earnings. The time spent submitting, reading, and advocating for our clients has been outside of and in addition to our full time day jobs.  With funding, we can hire the volunteer staff full-time.

The plans to get the company set up and running are not complicated, but costly. Transgender Talent is currently set up as a sole proprietorship LLC. In order to expand the company, Transgender Talent needs to be converted to a corporation sub S or sub Cinh, to either find investors or do an equity crowd funding campaign. In order to do this correctly, an attorney and/or accountant has to be retained, which incurs heavy fees. 

The $30,000 we are looking to raise should cover three months of salaries for Ann and at least one assistant, plus cover legal, accounting, and government filing fees for the incorporation process(es).

 These are our goals in the immediate future with proper funding:

Staff: 

Ann Thomas, the current owner, cannot devote her full attention to this as she has to work another day job to pay the bills. With funding, she can give all of her attention to Transgender Talent, and do so full time.  She needs at least one assistant who can take some of the load off of her shoulders and help work on the day-to-day details of casting. One of her current volunteers, who has talent agency training and has one an internship in a major agency, would step into this role and be able to turn it into his full time job as well. 

Actors: 

Not only would we continue to submit transgender actors for trans roles, but with the funding, we would be able to begin submitting actors for non-transgender roles.  This requires getting a Breakdown Express subscription, which is costly(at least $268 per month, plus other fees). Breakdown Express is the platform most Hollywood casting agencies and talent agencies use to find and connect projects with actors.  Instead of having to wait to be contacted, Ann needs to be available to attend industry networking meetings and events, which occur daily throughout the city.  She and/or Transgender Talent as a company need to join various industry organizations as well, many of which require funds for membership.

Web site updates: 

Our current web site is at transgendertalent.agency 

With proper funding, we would be able to have the site professionally updated and maintained, giving us an online presence, and making it easy for both transgender/gender non-conforming people and for casting directors etc to find and contact us. 
 

 -----------

Our goal:

In all of this, Transgender Talent is working to promote a more informed view of the transgender community through entertainment, comedy, and personal appearances at schools.  With that groundswell of information to the mainstream population, we can finally live our lives in peace with the productivity and creativity we want to show the world.

Thank you for taking the time to read this. If you'd like more details, please visit our website at transgendertalent.agency 

Please support us by donating today to Transgender Talent.

story:
About Us and Our Goals

     Hi, we are Everyone Smile Studio. We are a small art studio made up of five very talented artists, designers, and coders. We are starting our first big project "Francis" and need your help to make the first season. 

     What we love about Francis is that it's everything that we would want in a show that's different from what's already out there. It's funny, edgy, and over-the-top. The show is built on a story that provides several different platforms in which our creative directions can run, so the adventures and character-building aspects are essentially endless. Our biggest hope for this show is that it will inspire others to pursue their creative side and talents. 

     With you donations, we will be able to create the very many sets that are required for the show, the lighting and equipment needed to film, and to ensure that we can get the best quality of film for your enjoyment. Many different aspects go into a show such as this one, especially working with stop motion. There is a lot of storyboarding, voiceover work, set design, and time-consuming filming and editing. Your generous donations will go a long way in ensuring that things run smooth. Frequent updates on all the work and progress will be posted so you can be sure that your donations are being used wisely. 

Perks

     We have several perk options available as of right now. We have our Francis logo T-Shirt for a backing of $25. For a backing of $50 you will additionally receive a Francis poster and stickers along with the shirt. 

Note

     If we don't reach our goal, the funds will still all go to the show, we will just be tighter on funding and it will take more time than we wish. 

     Everyone Smile Studio would be greatly impacted and greatly appreciative of your donation because you are helping to ensure the success of the show, and build our reputation and audience so that we can continue projects like this, to entertain you and to do what we love. So thank you.

Risks & Challenges

     With a show like this, there will obviously be some risks and challenges but we can assure that our team will be working day and night to overcome these challenges and provide the best product we can produce. Any challenges we come across will be included in our updates. We will let you know when we come across them and also when we solve them. We have the drive and the passion to do everything that we do so we are always up for a good challenge and we never shy away from obstacles; they will only sharpen our skills further

Other Ways You Can Help

     We understand some people aren't able to contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

     If you cannot contribute financially but still want to help, just share our indiegogo project link and get our name out there. Any traffic we can get will be greatly helpful and appreciated. Let's get people talking about Francis! 

     You can find our studio on Instagram, Facebook, and Vimeo where we will be posting updates as well. 

Instagram: @everyonesmilestudio

Facebook: Everyone Smile

Vimeo: Everyone Smile

story:
Perhaps the most important documentary ever produced?

Imagine...you have just found a treasure unlike any ever found before.  

This treasure is not gold, rare jewels or incredible riches.  It is no more than an obscure book published in 1955.  But it is a book containing no less than...the very meaning of life and the history of the cosmos.  

Once you've read this amazing book, you find that it has answered every question you can possibly imagine to ask about who and what you are, why you even exist, and if there really is life after death.  And so very much more!

For it also answers your questions about angels and demons, aliens and other worlds, and even of...God. And it delivers a history of the universe and of our own earth, that only now, some 60+ years later, is science finally able and beginning to prove true. 

The name of this amazing treasure is...the Urantia Book. 

Could it possibly be true? We...intend to find out.  Do you?

 

For the past five years, we've been investigating the amazing origin, assertions and historic claims made in the Urantia Book, in as an objective or fair a manner as possible. 

And we are now producing this documentary series to present our amazing findings to the world, free of charge.  And YOU can help!

 

    Why is this documentary so important to us all?

    From who and WHAT we are, to our planetary history, our purpose in this lifetime and so very much more, the Urantia Book explains it all.  And if the Urantia Book is true, then our documentary can well have a major impact by helping us all better understand it.

    It's a bold claim that demands a clear and concise explanation and this is it: 

    • If the Urantia Book is even half true, it could have a profoundly beneficial effect on the entire world.  
    • If it is mostly true, then our world and our viewers directly, will be the beneficiaries of the most important knowledge the world has ever seen.  
    • If it is all true, then the benefits of this knowledge begin as soon as you fully comprehend the information the book itself contains and our program aims to illuminate...for the entire world.  
    • And while pondering those points, be advised that our (still incomplete) investigation to date, indicates that the Urantia Book is not just partially true, but probably all true.
    • Nevertheless, to articulate just our findings to date on the information contained in the Urantia Book, will take many, many episodes.
    • To continue our investigations and articulate those findings will entail at least a few more years to produce, simply because the details to examine are so numerous. 
    • Indeed, that is likely the single biggest reason (after science needing to catch up) that no other documentary about the Urantia Book has even been attempted before.  
    • It is simply too vast and too detailed to be properly articulated with a small budget or in just a few short episodes. 
    • And in an age of desired return-on-investment that investors rightfully seek, producing a huge project like this—for FREE, makes no economic sense to traditional film and documentary investors.  And we understand that. 
    • Therefore, grants and crowd-funding are the only possible way a potentially vital program like this will ever get started, let alone produced and freely distributed worldwide. And if that occurs, its impact may well be world-changing.
    • And YOU...can help make that happen.

     

    What We Hope to Achieve & What You Get 

    • To produce the first season of nine 1-hour episodes, we've assembled a great team of Stage32.com professionals spanning every continent and some 60-plus countries.  
    • From professional crews and actors, to animators and narrators, we have budgeted $375,000 CAD. 
    • The vast majority of the funded monies will be going into production and post-production, with limited marketing and distribution costs representing much smaller percentages of the budget.
    • All excess or remaining funding, as well as any potential future revenues, will be going straight back into the production of future seasons until it is finished and translations of the program into some 100+ major languages have been completed.  
    • And by setting up a trust account. we further intend to ensure that with whatever funds remain or in the future may be generated, our program will be forever available to watch on-line by anyone, for free.
    • However, to get started we need your help, so we've assembled some awesome perks for you.  
    • Indeed...as you can see, there's something kewl or wonderful for all funding levels!

     

    Risks & Challenges

    Are there risks? Yes. But not for you.  

    The biggest risks are to some of our production people who will be attempting to film in areas that are currently in or on the edge of a war-zone.  These are all key Urantia Book related locations like the Ukraine, Georgia, Turkey, Iraq, Syria, Lebanon, Iran, Afghanistan, Pakistan, Egypt, and Libya. 

    To minimize this risk, we intend to:

    • use stock video/film/image sources wherever possible. 
    • pay licencing fees for needed existing video/film or images
    • only use local cinematographers/actors that know the area well and can thereby eliminate the majority of the safety risks to themselves and others.

    As for challenges, the main one is to reach our funding goal.  To eliminate the risk of loss to you, we have chosen the "fixed funding" method for this project. This means that if we don't raise all of the money we are aiming for, then your contribution is returned to you in full. We are also choosing this method to ensure that we have all of the funds necessary to do it right...the first time.  And to also ensure that it's made available to the entire world, free of any charge, whatsoever. 

    What you may also not know is that our program is not meant to be a financial success, but an educational tool.  So its success ought not be measured by its return on investment, but its investment in our collective futures. 

    Under our "fixed funding" campaign, your risk is eliminated if we don't succeed in reaching our funding goal.  If we do, then you can be assured of an awesome program that YOU will have helped co-produce.  And your support will also result in some great perks coming your way. 

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We're discovering that many of you wish to help ensure the production of this amazing new program any and every way you can.  That is wonderful—thank you so very much!  And the fact is that you can be of immense help by also:

    • using our Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word about this amazing campaign.
    • promoting/sharing our funding campaign and our Coming Soon teaser video (below) on social media and by word-of-mouth, helping to get the word out and making some noise

    Thank you all for your support. It is "very much appreciated" and if our funding goal is achieved, we promise to make you proud of our efforts to produce what just may be the most important documentary series ever produced!  Peace.

This treasure is not gold, rare jewels or incredible riches.  It is no more than an obscure book published in 1955.  But it is a book containing no less than...the very meaning of life and the history of the cosmos.  
Once you've read this amazing book, you find that it has answered every question you can possibly imagine to ask about who and what you are, why you even exist, and if there really is life after death.  And so very much more!
For it also answers your questions about angels and demons, aliens and other worlds, and even of...God. And it delivers a history of the universe and of our own earth, that only now, some 60+ years later, is science finally able and beginning to prove true. 
The name of this amazing treasure is...the Urantia Book. 
Could it possibly be true? We...intend to find out.  Do you?

 
For the past five years, we've been investigating the amazing origin, assertions and historic claims made in the Urantia Book, in as an objective or fair a manner as possible. And we are now producing this documentary series to present our amazing findings to the world, free of charge.  And YOU can help! 
Why is this documentary so important to us all?
From who and WHAT we are, to our planetary history, our purpose in this lifetime and so very much more, the Urantia Book explains it all.  And if the Urantia Book is true, then our documentary can well have a major impact by helping us all better understand it.
It's a bold claim that demands a clear and concise explanation and this is it: 

If the Urantia Book is even half true, it could have a profoundly beneficial effect on the entire world.  
If it is mostly true, then our world and our viewers directly, will be the beneficiaries of the most important knowledge the world has ever seen.  
If it is all true, then the benefits of this knowledge begin as soon as you fully comprehend the information the book itself contains and our program aims to illuminate...for the entire world.  
And while pondering those points, be advised that our (still incomplete) investigation to date, indicates that the Urantia Book is not just partially true, but probably all true.
Nevertheless, to articulate just our findings to date on the information contained in the Urantia Book, will take many, many episodes.
To continue our investigations and articulate those findings will entail at least a few more years to produce, simply because the details to examine are so numerous. 
Indeed, that is likely the single biggest reason (after science needing to catch up) that no other documentary about the Urantia Book has even been attempted before.  
It is simply too vast and too detailed to be properly articulated with a small budget or in just a few short episodes. 
And in an age of desired return-on-investment that investors rightfully seek, producing a huge project like this—for FREE, makes no economic sense to traditional film and documentary investors.  And we understand that. 
Therefore, grants and crowd-funding are the only possible way a potentially vital program like this will ever get started, let alone produced and freely distributed worldwide. And if that occurs, its impact may well be world-changing.
And YOU...can help make that happen.


 
What We Hope to Achieve & What You Get 

To produce the first season of nine 1-hour episodes, we've assembled a great team of Stage32.com professionals spanning every continent and some 60-plus countries.  
From professional crews and actors, to animators and narrators, we have budgeted $375,000 CAD. 
The vast majority of the funded monies will be going into production and post-production, with limited marketing and distribution costs representing much smaller percentages of the budget.
All excess or remaining funding, as well as any potential future revenues, will be going straight back into the production of future seasons until it is finished and translations of the program into some 100+ major languages have been completed.  
And by setting up a trust account. we further intend to ensure that with whatever funds remain or in the future may be generated, our program will be forever available to watch on-line by anyone, for free.
However, to get started we need your help, so we've assembled some awesome perks for you.  
Indeed...as you can see, there's something kewl or wonderful for all funding levels!

 
Risks & Challenges
Are there risks? Yes. But not for you.  
The biggest risks are to some of our production people who will be attempting to film in areas that are currently in or on the edge of a war-zone.  These are all key Urantia Book related locations like the Ukraine, Georgia, Turkey, Iraq, Syria, Lebanon, Iran, Afghanistan, Pakistan, Egypt, and Libya. 
To minimize this risk, we intend to:

use stock video/film/image sources wherever possible. 
pay licencing fees for needed existing video/film or images
only use local cinematographers/actors that know the area well and can thereby eliminate the majority of the safety risks to themselves and others.

As for challenges, the main one is to reach our funding goal.  To eliminate the risk of loss to you, we have chosen the "fixed funding" method for this project. This means that if we don't raise all of the money we are aiming for, then your contribution is returned to you in full. We are also choosing this method to ensure that we have all of the funds necessary to do it right...the first time.  And to also ensure that it's made available to the entire world, free of any charge, whatsoever.  
What you may also not know is that our program is not meant to be a financial success, but an educational tool.  So its success ought not be measured by its return on investment, but its investment in our collective futures. 
Under our "fixed funding" campaign, your risk is eliminated if we don't succeed in reaching our funding goal.  If we do, then you can be assured of an awesome program that YOU will have helped co-produce.  And your support will also result in some great perks coming your way. 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
We're discovering that many of you wish to help ensure the production of this amazing new program any and every way you can.  That is wonderful—thank you so very much!  And the fact is that you can be of immense help by also:

using our Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word about this amazing campaign.
promoting/sharing our funding campaign and our Coming Soon teaser video (below) on social media and by word-of-mouth, helping to get the word out and making some noise

Thank you all for your support. It is "very much appreciated" and if our funding goal is achieved, we promise to make you proud of our efforts to produce what just may be the most important documentary series ever produced!  Peace.

story:
PRESS

CP24 Interview #1: 

CP24 Interview #2

Canadian Comedy Award
 

 

THE TEAM

Farid Yazdani: is best know for his role on Suits (NBC) as the recurring character, David Green. He is also the creator and star of Day Players where he won “Best Actor – Leading Role” at The Indifest Film Awards in Los Angeles & The Canadian Comedy Award for “Best Short”. Farid is a former alumnus of the Reelworld: Emerging 20 Program & Factory Theatre’s: Acting Conservatory. His latest work will include guest staring on Titans (DC/Warner Brothers), The Boys (Amazon) Killjoys (SYFY), Shadowhunters (Disney/ Netflix), The Boys (Sony) and the Ubisoft video game, Farcry 5. 

 

Aref Mahabadi: is a Canadian film director based out of Toronto, Ontario. His first short film Day Players won the Platinum Award at the International Independent Film Awards and his most recent short film “How to Fall” screened at the 2017 Reelworld film festival.

Chris D’alessandro: is a Canadian screenwriter and story editor.
He is a Vancouver Film School graduate from the Writing for Film and Television Program and winner of the Fenner Cup for Best Feature Script. During the day, Chris writes and markets content for SquareCrop, a digital media agency in Toronto.

Ali Mashayekhi: is a Canadian producer who grew up in Toronto, Ontario. During his university years, he pursued his passion for writing, creating cartoons for the local student paper. This experience fostered a long held fascination with film and its industry. In order to create opportunities, he formed the independent production company Landed Entertainments in 2003; he has been at the helm ever since. He has produced several short films, many music videos, feature films and documentaries.

 

THE CAST:

Farid Yazdani as Naveen Ghezzi:

See above bio

??? as Veronica Blackwell:

 

Brock Morgan as Blake Summers: is an actor located in Toronto, originally from Kingston Ontario. Brock moved to Toronto in 2009 to take the “Acting for Film and Television” program at Humber College and has been working in film and television since graduating in 2011. Early successes include landing a lead role on the Shaftesbury/YTV series “Totally Amp’d”, working on Kiefer and Donald Sutherland’s Western Feature “Forsaken” and a recurring role on CBC’s “Murdoch Mysteries” playing the iconic Canadian Painter Tom Thomson. He can most recently be seen in a supporting role on CTV’s “Cardinal” season 2, the upcoming 3rd season of CBC’s "Working Moms", Netflix’s original “October Faction” and the upcoming feature film “Daughter of the Wolf” Starring Gina Carano and Richard Dreyfuss.

Julian Robino as Vincent Adamo: is an actor from Toronto, Ontario. He graduated Humber College in the Acting for Film and Television Program, receiving the President’s Letter for highest academic standing in his final year. Julian also studied Lee Strasberg’s Method Acting through private coaching with renowned Canadian Actress; Jane Moffat. 
Julian has worked extensively in Canadian television and film since graduating in 2012. Notable credits include Rookie Blue, Murdoch Mysteries, Wayne, Man Seeking Woman and Population zero.
He produced, wrote and starred in the short horror film Songs My Mother Taught Me.

??? as Trinity Grace:

Brendan Jeffers as Devon Hayes: has featured in a number of films and television shows, including Frankie Drake Mysteries, Saving Hope, and Rupture, starring Noomi Rapace. He most notably played the malignant gang leader Vince Bell, on Degrassi. Brendan has also garnered attention and accolades for his writing and producing. Fowl Play made waves, appearing on Kevin Hart’s LOL Network, screening at Just For Laughs Comedy Festival and receiving a Canadian Comedy Award nomination for Best Short Film. Gnawed of Approval became a viral hit, and Clive Houston, We Have a Problem made a successful festival circuit run, which included winning Best Foreign Film at The Nevada Film Festival.

??? as Proffesor Peter Edmund 

FAQ:

When/Where will you be filming?

We will be filming during Spring 2019 in Toronto, Ontario (Canada). Currently the shoot is scheduled for 6 shooting days.

How do you expect to pull it off?

Simply put, crazier things have happened...our production team has built a reputation of being resourceful and innovative beyond people’s imagination and this will definitely be a challenge. However, over the 10+ years that we have been in the business, amongst other things, we have turned concert venues into lofts, offices into bedrooms and even converted the basement of our office into a cave.

With studio spaces, friend's apartments and creative use of space, we are confident that we can bring this project to life.

If you have other funding sources, why do you need Indiegogo?

Our two-funding sources are 2 sides of the same coin. Essentially we have a group of people who have committed to helping us out through cash investment and deferred salary. However, it is not enough to fund the entire project, so that is why we are looking outside as well. Vice versa, an Indiegogo campaign for the entire amount may be too ambitious and making the funding goal too high may be setting ourselves up for failure; so we're being realistic with the amount and using other connections and our own means as well.

Can I be in the Film?

If you're ACTRA...YES! Let us explain. Our movie is going to be under the ACTRA umbrella, meaning that only Canadian unionized Actors can be a part of the film. This means both leads and backgrounds, so unless you are part of the union, there isn’t much we can do due to union regulations.

I Purchased a perk to be in the film but I'm not ACTRA!

There is a lot of logistics involved in working with ACTRA, and we are able to offer this perk under special circumstances (which is also why it is limited in number). 

If you have purchased this perk, you will be required to attend a day of filming (which as yet to be determined) and sign applicable releases; but don't worry too much, we will walk you through everything.

Why ACTRA?

A lot of people have asked why we are going union, since it is generally more expensive. However, the cost difference is only a single factor.

Generally speaking, the talent pool under the union is accomplished, marketable and professional. It is essential to not only have a talented and experienced crew to make your project look good, but also have skilled actors to ensure the story plays the way you intended as well.

When will the project be done?

We will finish filming by November and after a quick break for the holidays will go into editing. Barring any unforeseen circumstances, we should be done the final cut in March 2020.

What happens after it's finished?

We take the project to distribution companies that have already shown interest in the project. Our goal give an amazing Season 1 with the goal of being picked up and developed for more seasons to come!

When will I receive my reward?

Once our campaign closes and the final dollars have been accounted for we will be reaching out to the recipients of each tier to gather all the pertinent information.

Some tiers will be easy to organize and deliver (ie: Swag) and some will take a bit of co-ordination (ie: set visits). However, we guarantee that you will get the reward as soon as possible without any avoidable delays.

I have chosen swag as my reward, how do you know my size?

Easy, we will ask! After the campaign closes, each tier will be contacted to gather all the information needed to deliver that particular reward; in the case of swag, we will get your size, color choice (where applicable) and delivery address.

How do set visits work?

So you have donated and want to know the logistics behind visiting the set. It’s not super complicated; once the final filming schedule has been locked, we will pick a couple of days that will be open for set visits (understandably there may be some hectic days which we won’t be able to accommodate).

Once these days have been selected, you will be contacted to choose a time for your visit. When you get on set, you will be assigned a wrangler (or in fancier terms, concierge) who will guide you through the maze that is film sets; they will also give you a rundown of set etiquette and be there for anything you may want to see or do.

story:
Story Time!

ThingzThatMakeUGoHmmm is a online game show created by WeAre1CHICAGO.

 

WeAre1CHICAGO United, NFP is an organization that focus on creating programs, activities and events that financially support the younger generation in Chicago. With all that is going on today, we feel it is extremely important to support our youth and create a bridge to help make their dreams a reality. Some of the current programs we have is "I Love The 90s Show Millennium Virtual Show", "ChiTown Movie Nite", and "ThingzThatMakeUGoHmmm".

ThingzThatMakeUGoHmmm, is a program that was specifically created to raise money for the younger comedians and entertainers in the Chicagoland area.This show will highlight the creativity, the humor and talents of our young Chicago natives, giving you 1 hour of pure entertainment!

 My name is Jae Davis, born and raised on the south side of the Chicagoland area.  I'm able to live out my passion everyday as a producer who curates her own content. I also work with artists who are looking for platforms to share their art. 

I see my city as something that has great potential and amazing creativity when it comes to our youth and young adults. In the past, our youth have been let down with our lack of involvement and consistency with helping to nourish and catapult their talents and gifts. It is important that we look past today’s and yesterday’s issues, and channel with them to future possibilities for their generation. COVID-19 will not slow us down. 

Our team decided that this game show will help our country to #stayhome and #staysafe. We created a way that we can support our youth and young adults with donations and more opportunities during this second wave of the coronavirus.

This game show will give great energy... like the youth of the
90’s era that stood for unity, justice and equality. I am excited and thrilled to share with you, ThingzThatMakeUGoHmmm!

Easy As 1-2-3 

  1. The game show will consist of 2 teams of 4 players on each team. Each team  will have special invited guests (influencers, celebrities, VIPs, etc.) and  random individuals from our youth community. There will be 5 games with 3 rounds each game.  Each round gives each team chance to win the cash prize for that game, allowing everyone to walk away a winner.
  2. Youth can watch the show with a chance of winning monetary prizes to invest in their craft/school supplies by summarizing the episode or answering the questions asked during the game. 
  3. This series will be live on a weekly basis available via, Twitch,  YouTube and Facebook.

What We Need & What You Get

The support from our community can come in many forms. The first phase to build the consistency that we want comes at a price. We are asking for the public to invest in their youth. Our overall goal is to raise over $300,000, with a goal to donate at least $10,000 each week for 30 weeks.  However, we are requesting $60K at a time, to allow us to continue the process of fundraising as we build the pot. The funding that is raised will be used for the following;

  • Recording, Editing, Techs (hired youth and young adults in the community)
  • Promotion (Social media, Bilboards, Radio)
  • Payment for Crew and Local Talent
  • Merch ( T-Shirts, Mugs, etc.)
  • Prizes for Youth watching (Money via Cashapp, Venmo, Paypal as well as School Supplies, Gift Cards...)
  • The winning pots for the games

All of contributors will receive the following: 

  • Thank You Letter
  • ThingzThatMakeUGoHmmm T-Shirt
  • Name Entered on the ThingzThatMakeUGoHmm Hall for Fame via website
  • Newsletter recognition of your business if the donation is on the behalf of a business
  • Shoutout during the game show from our official host
  • Tax exempt for your donation via emailed letter 

The Impact (?)

We know just about everyone in Chicago wants to see these better days ahead and would like to participate the best way they can. Well, we’ve created the platform and now we need your help to push for our city.

This is not our first attempt to create resources for our Youth in Chicago.  We did a live show, bringing all of the popular local acts together, creating unity, diversity and overall more opportunities.  However, we didn't have the monetary resources to promote it, therefore, majority of Chicago wasn't able to support because they didn't know that it was even happening.  That's why, this year, we need your support.  

Other Ways You Can Contribute

Every bit helps even if your donation isn't monetary. Other items you can donate are the following: 

  • Share the fundraiser on your social media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter...)
  • Gift Cards (Walmart, Best Buy, Target, Visa..) to give away to the youth community
  • School Supplies  ( Binders, Pencils, Backpacks...)
  • Dorm Life (Printers, Lamps, Bedsheets, Cleaning Supplies..)
  • Photo Shoot (to help offer professionalism to our youth)
  • Marketing (to help promote the youth goals, activities and or projects, etc...)
  • Videography (to assist the youth in creating content for their projects, etc...)

story:
Hello! Thanks for Visiting!

Severance stemmed from a fever dream about getting fired from my job. What resulted is (I hope) a fun and real look at being an artist in LA. Is it a brand new idea? You bet your ass it's not! But Anthony and I are very proud of it and hope you'll watch as we parse out our depression and anxieties on screen.

I won't spoil any season 1 stuff, but season 2 is going to focus much more heavily on the female lead, Nikki. I wrote season 1 for myself, but I think there've been enough dude storylines in Severance for the next century. We'd love it if you would help us tell Nikki's story next season.

What do we want from you?

Anthony and I funded the first season of Severance out of pocket, and we were very happy and fortunate to be able to make that happen! BUT, unfortunately, we are not yet made of money. All told the project cost around $7500 to put together, and that is with asking for a ton of freebies. Please help us pay our freakin' excellent artists for the work you've enjoyed watching them do! Here's where your money is going...

The Actors

There's this old saying in Hollywood. Not "there's no business like show business." Not "Lights! Camera! Action!" The one I'm thinking of is, "actors get paid last." Okay maybe it's not an official saying, but it's the crappy and unfortunate truth at an indie level. We're not doing a second season if we can't pay our actors. Period. So if you want to see more of their excellent performances, give us a hand!

My goal is to be able to pay every actor the SAG New Media daily rate ($125 daily).

Female Writers

As mentioned above, season 2 will be focusing on Nikki. I wrote the first season alone, which was a great exercise for me, but I'm obviously writing from a male perspective. I'm hoping to hire two female writers so that you're not watching a woman written by a dude in season 2.

Continued High Production Value

One of the things that sets Severance apart in the web series space is that Anthony has an insane skill set that allows for an extremely high overall production value. But it comes at a high cost to us. A good chunk of this money will go towards continuing to pay our awesome DPs, sound engineers, camera ops, and post production team.

Other Smaller but Necessary Stuff

In addition to all of these things we've got to feed everybody, pay for locations, hopefully distribute it at some point. Every lil dollar helps! So if you've got a few to spare, please help us tell this story that we've been enjoying so far.

If you can't give...

Please share! Share this Indie Go Go campaign, share the web series, share it all! We mostly just want people to watch. Getting the money to make a second season is just icing on top.

story:
What are we?

This is a labor of love. Love of country. Love of adventure. Love of people. Love of food, fashion, culture and history.  This is a love affair with Israel!
I want to share this affair with everybody and anybody who has ever wondered what it would be like to visit or live in Israel. Or with somebody who has never given Israel a second thought. Or with people who have visited here or who live here and want to know more about this amazing country.
Are you curious about this little strip of land in the Middle East? Then come join me on this adventure. See the country, feel the country, smell and taste it. Love it and live it with me. Come with me on my journey and let me share Israel with you through my eyes: her magnificence, her complexity, her stubbornness, her perfectness and imperfectness.

​

MEET US
 

MONA HENOCH

DIRECTOR/CREATOR


I moved to Israel in 2008 with my two young children (10 and 13 at the time) and my former spouse.  I was born in Canada, raised on Nantucket Island in Massachusetts and lived most of my adult life, 25 years, in New York City.  I was born a Christian but converted to Judaism before my marriage in 1991 and lived a very happy life in New York City. We had a full Jewish life, my children attended an egalitarian Jewish Day School and we attended synagogue regularly.  But there came a point where I understood that I wanted to live in another place, outside of New York City. A place that was new, exciting, challenging and more meaningful. And a place that Jews could live freely, however they chose. So of course Israel was the perfect choice. But…there was one problem!

I had never been to Israel!  I was raised with no connection to Israel and even though I had grown to appreciate Israel from afar it was quite a leap to think about moving there!  I had never traveled to any parts of the the Middle East so I really had no idea what to expect. There were so many different stories about Israel. I heard that it was a dangerous place.  That it was an amazing place. That it was a scary place. That it was a technological marvel. It was unsophisticated and provincial. The food was bad. The food was incredible. That it was like heaven on earth.  But all of those perceptions were made from the shores of the USA, having never stepped a foot there and formed from what I read in the paper, saw in the news or heard second-hand.

But once I was in the country, I knew that so much of what I had heard, good and bad, was wrong. I realized that it was just not possible to understand just how amazing this country was without experiencing it.  And I also realized that people would never understand that it was not as bad as they were told it was, without experiencing it. So I created this website to share Israel through my eyes. I wanted to share the Israel I know.  The Israel I have fallen in love with, flaws and all. I hope you enjoy watching these videos and that they have helped to show you and the world that ThisisIsrael.Today! And with your help we can keep these amazing adventures going for another year and even bigger and better!!!   

 

MALKY WANDEL

​FILMMAKER & DIRECTOR OF DIGITAL MEDIA

Malky Wandel, 28. Moved to Israel at age 12 from NY.
I have been an independent filmmaker since 2005. Years before graduating with a degree in Film from Ma'aleh School of Television, Film & the Arts, Jerusalem.
Over the last 4 years of this project, I have been exposed to stories, food and places that in the 16 years living in Israel I never thought I would experience.
I keep doing this project because I find it important to expose Israel to the world in ways that people don’t usually see or hear about.
With all my years of filming and editing, I love having the oppertunity to show the real Israel through the most powerful thing, the camera!

 

WHAT WE NEED

Over the last three years I have spent approximately $70,000 from my own pocket to create this amazing content. We have made over 100 videos and that means hundreds of hours of filming, editing and lots of other production costs.  But now I have run out of money and have to ask the community for help. I would like to raise $20,000 to keep ThisisIsrael.Today going for as long as possible.  Additionally, 10% of any proceeds I raise will be donated to my sister project, Play Matkot in Schools and Camps, a great new initiative to bring physical fitness back into schools and also camps.

 

NEW FUNDING

TEAM
Malky (the genius behind the camera, in the editing room and basically everywhere but in front of the camera! and other minor staff I have had ) have worked at very low wages. Far below what they are worth because they believe in the project.  I have worked hundreds of hours with no pay at all. I would like to pay the staff a decent, living wage. Living in Israel is expensive and it would be nice for the people who work on this project to be able to make a fair wage for creating this amazing content.  I would like to take a nominal salary so that I can give more focus to this project instead of trying earn money in other ways (as an interior designer, which is my actual profession!). I need to hire a part-time producer/social media manager and also translators in order to bring this project to the next level and get it the widest exposure as possible   

FILMING
We would  film approximately 6 days a month and therefore create at a minimum 6 new videos a month with a guarantee to film 9 months a year  thus creating a minimum of 54 videos for the year. It would most likely be more videos than that due to the way we film. Often we get 3-4 films from just one day of filming.  



 

PRODUCTION
Travel expenses, daily productions costs, post-productions costs (editing, sound etc).

EQUIPMENT
We need some basic upgrades to our equipment inventory so that the quality of our videos can get just that much better...I would really like some more microphones for different conditions, we need some proper lighting and also some image stabilization equipment. 

TRANSLATION
Continue to translate our current collection of over 100 videos into French, Spanish, Russian, Hebrew, Chinese and begin our Arabic translations so that we can reach the largest audience possible.

MARKETING
We would use some of the funds raised for marketing on social media and other ways in order to create exposure to the content and bring it to the as many people as possible.  

If we don’t reach our goal we will just keep the project going on a minimal level until the money runs out and we will close up shop and walk away knowing we did a job well done!  
BUT....I don’t think that will happen because being a great project for so many reasons and one well worth funding...the PERKS are great too!! Check them out!!

 

WHY ISRAEL?

Israel is probably one of the most written about, fought over, discussed, loved, hated and misunderstood places in the world.  This video journeys allow people to experience Israel as never before. First hand. In English. From the point of view of the who has lived in and explored the country for the last 10 years.

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

The  risk we face is not raising enough money to keep filming these fun, informative and we believe, important adventures for the next year,  but instead for only for 6 months or 3 months or 1 month. I will continue to take these trips and experience this amazing country, I just won’t film it and get it out the the world.  As I said above, I have self-funded this project for over 3 years and I just can't do it anymore.
So we will take whatever money we raise here and keep this project going for was long as we can.  Then, if we haven’t gained more funding or more exposure (and I am ALWAYS actively seeking funding and trying to meet anyone I can to help get exposure) we will use whatever funding we have raised and do the best job we can do until the funding runs out.  

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Thank you so much for taking the time to learn about this project! Any and all help is appreciated so if you can’t contribute financially to keep these adventures going, there are lots of other things you can do to help that are FREE!! But just as important and appreciated.

 

“Like” and “Follow” us on Facebook - this way you’ll see our new videos and get other updates right away!  

Follow us on Instagram  - get daily pictures of authentic life in Israel!

Share us!! Like what you see?  Share the adventures with your friends and family!  Help us get the word out that ThisisIsrael.Today!

Leave a comment! Give us some feedback! We love to hear what you think!

And lastly, but very important!  Please share our Indiegogo campaign with anyone you think would like it! We need all the help we can get!

story:
Short Summary

Senseless Spirits is a online horror documentary show/movie that follows three friends searching for paranormal experiences.  Mikeal Burgin, Jessica Hansen, and Kat Walsh will travel around the U.S. and participate in sensory deprived isolation sessions while exploring some of the most haunted locations in America overnight. 

Our first season locations include:

-Ashmore Estates
-Bellaire House
-Madison Seminary
-Randolph County Infirmary
-Whispers Estate


WHY ARE WE FUNDRAISING?
We have no film crew, we have no producers, we have no overall budget.  We are funding this production out of our own pockets, in order to entertain you with whatever it is that we find along the way. 

So what do we need your help with? Well, we have to eat, get hotel rooms, and fuel our vehicle for an entire week of travel.  We are hopeful that you'll be generous enough to help us with these expenses, so that we can stay safe and don't have to sleep in our vehicle along the way.

 

We have already purchased equipment (night vision cameras, digital recorders, UV lights, etc.) on our own dime.  All the equipment and rental fees are expensive, we are spending thousands of dollars of our own money in order to properly document our haunted expedition for you.  You will NOT be directly funding our investigation necessities in any way.


 

 

What We Need & What You Get

BUDGETING BREAKDOWN
$630 for per diem ($30 per day X 3people X 7 Days)
$280 for gasoline ($35 per day X 7 days)
$450 for motels ($75 per day X 6 days)
$300 for unpredictable expenses
________________________________
$1,660 Total

For your generosity, we have multiple Senseless Spirits swag items of varying sizes, colors, and prices for you to enjoy!  We would be happy to mail them to you directly, and even autograph them for you if deemed necessary.  We are also offering some executive producer credits, which will earn you early access to evidence collected while on our road trip.  Check out the perks along the side help us get spooked in 2022!
 

The Impact

Your financial support will ensure that our road trip is expedient, direct, efficient, and most importantly, safe! 

In addition, you'll assist us in building an audience with the promotional swag that you'll receive, and even join us virtually during our investigations.

 

Other Ways You Can Help?

If you're unable to contribute financially, we'd truly appreciate your support by doing these things...

1.)  Share this campaign far and wide across your social media networks
2.)  LIKE and share our posts on our Facebook page
3.)  Comment on our Facebook posts, and tag your friends/family
4.)  Invite your friends/family to LIKE our Facebook page
5.) Follow us on Instagram

The more people we reach the better our chances of hitting our goal, and that's all there is to it.

FACEBOOK:  https://www.facebook.com/senselessspiritshauntedroadtrip
INSTAGRAM:  http://www.instagram.com/senselessspirits/

story:
There are hundreds of shows for kids. Let's make one about mindfulness!

 

Hello, Humans is a TV show pilot that will give kids and their trusted adults practical tools and language they can use to introduce mindfulness and meditation into their everyday lives, in quiet moments or busy moments, in moments of anxiety, happiness, fear or excitement. We've received lots of early support suggesting a need for a show like this, and we're eager to get started.

 

Every episode will feature:

 

  • An exploration of complex themes like anger, loss, bullying, fear and many more
  • Original music and live performances
  • Original stories
  • A dive into the magical Mindful Toolbox, where abstract tools take shape in claymation
  • Visits with real kids to talk about what matters to them
  • Short, easy-to-follow meditation practices
  • Visits with neighborhood friends to bridge the generational gap between being a kid, and becoming an adult
  • Time in nature, exploring and caring for our world

 

     Mindfulness is a framework and a practice that can benefit everyone, in any setting. Studies show that mindfulness can:

     

    • Boost mood and self-esteem
    • Encourage positive behavior
    • Reduce anxiety and improves overall mental health
    • Encourage healthy conflict resolution
    • Improve attention and focus
    • Facilitate better cognitive development
    • Create changes in the brain that allow for better emotional regulation
    • Increase compassion for self and others

     

    Our children are growing up in a highly digital age with endless opportunities to consume content. This overload of stimuli has been proven to affect everything from social and emotional health, to a child’s patterns of movement, nourishment and sleep.

     

    We’ve organized an impressive team of experts to produce a show for children that teaches practical ways of incorporating mindfulness and meditation into everything that they do, to demystify these practices and make them playful and engaging, to unlock their benefits to better position our children to thrive socially, emotionally, physically and academically.

     

    We're setting out to make content that is simpler and deeply intentional, rooted in relationships and built on practices of self-awareness, compassion and mindfulness to better serve our children.

     

    Together we can actively create a kinder and more connected world for us all.

     

    Here's what we're doing with the funds we raise:

    • Paying a professional team of producers, writers, camera operators, set designers, musicians, gaffers, grips, audio technicians and guests to pull off an A+ pilot.
    • Consulting with experts in childhood development and mindfulness to create truly transformative, trauma informed content that speaks to children and their trusted adults, too.
    • If we don't raise our goal, our team is willing to complete the pilot on a tighter budget. But we're hopeful that we will be able to offer an equitable experience for everyone.

     

     

    Here's a look at the core team behind the project:

     

    Mark Williams - Creator, Executive Producer

     A gifted teacher, storyteller and songwriter, Mark has spent the majority of his career striving to make more space at the table of education for each student to be seen and valued and to be given the tools that they each need to live into their fullest potential. From his own childhood experiences of wrestling with his multiracial identity, coping with his parents’ divorce, navigating school and life with the gifts and struggles of ADHD, and walking through bouts of depression, he discovered that music and mindfulness were instrumental in paving his pathway to healing and wholeness. 

     

    These life experiences have shaped him as a teacher to understand that the skills of Social Emotional Learning are foundational for further academic, social and professional success in the stories of each of his students. His childlike joy and energy, and his almost instant rapport with children, have led him to invest his life’s work as a classroom teacher, mentor, and teacher trainer where he has committed to gently and mindfully working to tend seeds of kindness, compassion, curiosity, and resilience in the hearts of his students. 

     

    His playful and accessible mindfulness practices appeal to children and adults alike. His stories and teachings integrate his passion for mindfulness with his commitment for social and environmental justice to help students access practices and paradigms that make space for the fullness of all that mindfulness truly is. He holds a Masters of Education in Mindfulness for Educators from Antioch University. Find out more at Kinder Neighborhood.

     

    Michael Savisky - Showrunner, Executive Producer, Director

    Michael has spent 18 years in the film industry. As founder of Make Roots, he has produced hundreds of projects ranging from indie features, to documentaries to commercials for some of the world’s largest brands. With three small boys of his own, and a deep love for children’s programming that speaks to the heart, soul and mind, Michael has made a niche for his work as an insightful, observant, human-centered storyteller. His newest film, We Wear the Mask can be found exclusively on Amazon Prime.

     

    Anita Harnish - Producer

     For over 30 years Anita Harnish has worked as a producer/director in video and film productions, serving advertising agencies, universities, hospitals, corporations and philanthropic organizations. Anita’s passion for production, organization and quality have taken her to Haiti, Kenya, Tanzania, South Africa, Sierra Leone, Guatemala, Nicaragua and Vietnam. Her work has contributed to national campaigns for GNC, FedEx, Highmark, PNC and many others. We are thrilled to have her on this project to create an efficient, well-connected production process.

     

    Walter H. Smith, Jr., PhD - Childhood Trauma Expert

    A graduate of the University of Pittsburgh, Dr. Smith has a primary interest in applying Bowen theory to family violence, child abuse and organizational functioning. He is a licensed psychologist and a graduate of the Georgetown Family Center’s Post Graduate Program in Family Theory and Family Psychotherapy. Dr. Smith is a founder of Western PA Family Center. He maintains a small private practice. He is former executive director of Family Resources, a child abuse treatment and prevention organization in Pittsburgh, and is a frequent national and international lecturer.

     

    Stephanie Romero - Childhood Mindfulness Expert

    As executive director of Awaken Pittsburgh, Stephanie oversees the mission to promote personal and community well-being through mindfulness programs and compassionate actions. To this end: Awaken Pittsburgh offers mindfulness-based curricula to help youth develop social and emotional skills and increase attention. Awaken provides educators, guidance counselors, social workers, and other service providers with mindfulness-based courses to reduce stress, increase contentment and build resilience.

     

    Michelle King - Learning Instigator, Love Activist, Beloved Community-Architect

     

    Michelle King is a Learning Instigator and Love Activist. Her origin story is rooted in being an Army Brat, child of an Ethiopian immigrant, and teaching middle school for over 22 years in public schools in Southwestern PA. She learned and honed her craft in Mt. Lebanon for over 16 years plus five years at The Environmental Charter School. Her current interests are in game-based-learning, design, justice, equity, the environment and teacher empowerment. Currently through her varied partnerships, she is seeking to co-create dynamic learning experiences and opportunities that inspire wonder, discovery, contradictions, frustrations, and joy.

     

    Current Conundrums:  What do humans need to learn now? How might we create empathetic institutions that remind us of our humanity?  How might we re-design for equity and social justice in and out of school learning? How might we design learning institutions to build connections? How might we allow those connections to help us re-see the worlds we inhabit?  How might we embrace silence in our lives? How might we integrate our inner and outer environments as humans? How might we co-create the Beloved Community in this lifetime?

     

      Remember, if you can't contribute to our goal, please share this campaign on social media! Thank you for your support! You're awesome.
story_txt:
There are hundreds of shows for kids. Let's make one about mindfulness!
 
Hello, Humans is a TV show pilot that will give kids and their trusted adults practical tools and language they can use to introduce mindfulness and meditation into their everyday lives, in quiet moments or busy moments, in moments of anxiety, happiness, fear or excitement. We've received lots of early support suggesting a need for a show like this, and we're eager to get started.
 
Every episode will feature:
 

An exploration of complex themes like anger, loss, bullying, fear and many more
Original music and live performances
Original stories
A dive into the magical Mindful Toolbox, where abstract tools take shape in claymation
Visits with real kids to talk about what matters to them
Short, easy-to-follow meditation practices
Visits with neighborhood friends to bridge the generational gap between being a kid, and becoming an adult
Time in nature, exploring and caring for our world


 


 Mindfulness is a framework and a practice that can benefit everyone, in any setting. Studies show that mindfulness can:
 

Boost mood and self-esteem
Encourage positive behavior
Reduce anxiety and improves overall mental health
Encourage healthy conflict resolution
Improve attention and focus
Facilitate better cognitive development
Create changes in the brain that allow for better emotional regulation
Increase compassion for self and others

 

Our children are growing up in a highly digital age with endless opportunities to consume content. This overload of stimuli has been proven to affect everything from social and emotional health, to a child’s patterns of movement, nourishment and sleep. We’ve organized an impressive team of experts to produce a show for children that teaches practical ways of incorporating mindfulness and meditation into everything that they do, to demystify these practices and make them playful and engaging, to unlock their benefits to better position our children to thrive socially, emotionally, physically and academically. We're setting out to make content that is simpler and deeply intentional, rooted in relationships and built on practices of self-awareness, compassion and mindfulness to better serve our children.
 
Together we can actively create a kinder and more connected world for us all.
 


Here's what we're doing with the funds we raise:

Paying a professional team of producers, writers, camera operators, set designers, musicians, gaffers, grips, audio technicians and guests to pull off an A+ pilot.
Consulting with experts in childhood development and mindfulness to create truly transformative, trauma informed content that speaks to children and their trusted adults, too.
If we don't raise our goal, our team is willing to complete the pilot on a tighter budget. But we're hopeful that we will be able to offer an equitable experience for everyone.


 

 
Here's a look at the core team behind the project:
 
Mark Williams - Creator, Executive Producer
 A gifted teacher, storyteller and songwriter, Mark has spent the majority of his career striving to make more space at the table of education for each student to be seen and valued and to be given the tools that they each need to live into their fullest potential. From his own childhood experiences of wrestling with his multiracial identity, coping with his parents’ divorce, navigating school and life with the gifts and struggles of ADHD, and walking through bouts of depression, he discovered that music and mindfulness were instrumental in paving his pathway to healing and wholeness.  These life experiences have shaped him as a teacher to understand that the skills of Social Emotional Learning are foundational for further academic, social and professional success in the stories of each of his students. His childlike joy and energy, and his almost instant rapport with children, have led him to invest his life’s work as a classroom teacher, mentor, and teacher trainer where he has committed to gently and mindfully working to tend seeds of kindness, compassion, curiosity, and resilience in the hearts of his students.  His playful and accessible mindfulness practices appeal to children and adults alike. His stories and teachings integrate his passion for mindfulness with his commitment for social and environmental justice to help students access practices and paradigms that make space for the fullness of all that mindfulness truly is. He holds a Masters of Education in Mindfulness for Educators from Antioch University. Find out more at Kinder Neighborhood. Michael Savisky - Showrunner, Executive Producer, Director
Michael has spent 18 years in the film industry. As founder of Make Roots, he has produced hundreds of projects ranging from indie features, to documentaries to commercials for some of the world’s largest brands. With three small boys of his own, and a deep love for children’s programming that speaks to the heart, soul and mind, Michael has made a niche for his work as an insightful, observant, human-centered storyteller. His newest film, We Wear the Mask can be found exclusively on Amazon Prime. Anita Harnish - Producer
 For over 30 years Anita Harnish has worked as a producer/director in video and film productions, serving advertising agencies, universities, hospitals, corporations and philanthropic organizations. Anita’s passion for production, organization and quality have taken her to Haiti, Kenya, Tanzania, South Africa, Sierra Leone, Guatemala, Nicaragua and Vietnam. Her work has contributed to national campaigns for GNC, FedEx, Highmark, PNC and many others. We are thrilled to have her on this project to create an efficient, well-connected production process. Walter H. Smith, Jr., PhD - Childhood Trauma Expert
A graduate of the University of Pittsburgh, Dr. Smith has a primary interest in applying Bowen theory to family violence, child abuse and organizational functioning. He is a licensed psychologist and a graduate of the Georgetown Family Center’s Post Graduate Program in Family Theory and Family Psychotherapy. Dr. Smith is a founder of Western PA Family Center. He maintains a small private practice. He is former executive director of Family Resources, a child abuse treatment and prevention organization in Pittsburgh, and is a frequent national and international lecturer. Stephanie Romero - Childhood Mindfulness Expert
As executive director of Awaken Pittsburgh, Stephanie oversees the mission to promote personal and community well-being through mindfulness programs and compassionate actions. To this end: Awaken Pittsburgh offers mindfulness-based curricula to help youth develop social and emotional skills and increase attention. Awaken provides educators, guidance counselors, social workers, and other service providers with mindfulness-based courses to reduce stress, increase contentment and build resilience. Michelle King - Learning Instigator, Love Activist, Beloved Community-Architect
 
Michelle King is a Learning Instigator and Love Activist. Her origin story is rooted in being an Army Brat, child of an Ethiopian immigrant, and teaching middle school for over 22 years in public schools in Southwestern PA. She learned and honed her craft in Mt. Lebanon for over 16 years plus five years at The Environmental Charter School. Her current interests are in game-based-learning, design, justice, equity, the environment and teacher empowerment. Currently through her varied partnerships, she is seeking to co-create dynamic learning experiences and opportunities that inspire wonder, discovery, contradictions, frustrations, and joy.
 
Current Conundrums:  What do humans need to learn now? How might we create empathetic institutions that remind us of our humanity?  How might we re-design for equity and social justice in and out of school learning? How might we design learning institutions to build connections? How might we allow those connections to help us re-see the worlds we inhabit?  How might we embrace silence in our lives? How might we integrate our inner and outer environments as humans? How might we co-create the Beloved Community in this lifetime?
 

Remember, if you can't contribute to our goal, please share this campaign on social media! Thank you for your support! You're awesome.

story:
If you have any questions, please email newpeterwendy@gmail.com

The last day to buy any of this cool stuff is May 9th (JM Barrie's Birthday AND the 3-year PANiversary of our first episode)

THE NEW ADVENTURES OF PETER AND WENDY is an award-winning, fan-favorite retelling of J.M. Barrie's classic novel PETER AND WENDY in the style of a romantic comedy.  You can watch all three seasons on our youtube channel EpicRobotTV or learn more about the show at www.newpeterwendy.com.  

Taking place in Neverland Ohio, a town with a mix of small town America and magic, Peter Pan, a late 20's man child, clings to his youthful ways while watching the people around him, especially his long time crush and best friend Wendy Darling, starting to move on with their lives. It's a tale of love and friendship that explores all the different definitions of "growing up" in today's society and how with faith, trust, and pixie dust anything is possible.

Kyle Walters (Welcome to Sanditon, Miss Guidance) as Peter Pan
Paula Rhodes (The League, Monster High) as Wendy Darling
Percy Daggs III (Veronica Mars, iZombie) as Jas Hook
Brennan Murray (VGHS, Cougar Town) as Michael Darling
Graham Kurtz (Glee, 30 Rock) as John Darling
Lovlee Carroll (Grey’s Anatomy, The Mindy Project) as Lily Bagha
Satya Bhabha (New Girl, Scott Pilgrim) as Smee
and Jim Beaver (Supernatural, Deadwood) as George Darling

Oh, yeah, there's also that scoundrel fairy, Tinker Bell.

THE CREW

Kyle Walters & Shawn deLoache - creators
Shawn deLoache - writer
Matthew Breault - director
Jenni Powell (Emmy winner for The Lizzie Bennet Diaries and Emma Approved) - producer & casting director
Paula Rhodes - producer
Emmett Furey (IAWTV winner, co-creator of the Twin Peaks transmedia sequel Enter The Lodge) - transmedia producer
Katie Moest (IAWTV winner, The Lizzie Bennet Diaries, Frankenstein MD) - production design

For more info on cast & crew, visit our website.

So you're hooked, right?  But you're feeling a little lost? BOY, do we have some cool perks for you.  Check them out on the right... or look at this visual cheat-sheet of gloriousness! 

For new perks, we've made a Season Three DVD, a series Soundtrack, T-Shirts, Prints, and more!  If you want to get them all at a magical price, check out the "Ultimate S3 Fan Pack!"  If you want those goodies AND some official props... check out the Official Prop Perks!

* artwork and product photos are not final... but they're close!

This will be the only guaranteed chance to buy any of these items!

Some of the "Official Props"

All of these perk packages come with the "Ultimate S3 Fan Pack" - so that means not only will you be getting a one-of-a-kind Prop... you'll also be getting the DVD, CD, Shirts, Prints, and more!

PIRATE STUFF
The Pirate hat and hook-hand from Season One's Peter Pan and Wendy Darling ScavengARRR Hunt date - and the actual Treasure Map!

Peter's Stuff - SOLD!

Hook's Stuff
Include's Hook's childhood Croc Watch (worn in Seasons 2 and 3!) along with his Hook Lapel Pin.  Also now comes with Hook's J.M. Barrie painting (not framed).  Dimensions: 24.5 inches wide by 31 inches tall on Canvas (as seen in Season Two!)

Wendy's Jewelry Stuff - SOLD!

Smarling Stuff - SOLD!

Peter's JM Barrie Bust
This one of a kind JM Barrie bust was made by Kyle Walters himself!  As seen in Season Three.  Acrylic painting, over a sturdy-but-lightweight-papermache sculpture with a protective coating.  It sits at a height of 16 inches tall. 

Peter's JM Barrie Painting
As seen in Seasons One and Three of the show, this one of a kind painting was painted by Kyle Walters himself!  Painted in acrylic with a protective coating, it measures 30"x30"x0.75".  stretched on wood for easy hanging.

Check them out in the sidebar to the right!

Limited-Quantity Items

These perks are items from previous sales.  There are only so many of each left... so get them while you still can!  Once they are sold out... they are gone forever!  These are all Standalone items.  If you want one of these and something from Season Three, you will have to make an additional purchase.

and now some grown up stuff!

The goal of $3,333 while not only being way-too-many 3's (it's Season Three after all, y'all) is what we would need to cover any minimum orders for DVDs and CDs.  So that's why that's there.  Anything above and beyond that will help us pay off deferred payments to some of the crew - and then help us afford submitting the show to festivals and spreading the magic!

We understand that not everyone can buy stuff.  BUT we could also use the help getting the word out about the show itself.  And that is free!

Here are a couple of ideas:

  1. Share this Indiegogo campaign.... why not?  I mean, it is awesome.  Just scroll back up to the top and click those social links!  We suggest doing this daily, it'll help keep the doctor away.
  2. OR Share our brand-new Trailer with people you think might like the show.
    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EYUOi0zQTdQ
  3. OR OR Share the very-first episode, where all of the magic began.
    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_XbD_IYYMVk
  4. Spread "#FinalFlight" Socially: Below are some images that you can send out into the world.  Change your profile pics, post them on tumblr, print and put on your mother's fridge.
  5. Tweet to @TheEllenShow: Tell Ellen that you love our show and you'd love it if she retweeted our Indiegogo campaign. (here's her twitter handle:  @TheEllenShow)

Profile Pics

here is a profile pic if you'd like to use it and share it. right-click and "Save As"

OR A BANNER

right-click and "Save As"
