Your funding will help us complete Season 1:

We are fundraising for $2500.00. This  helps us cover filming costs ranging from locations, craft services, travel, props, costuming, and other general expenses.
To support this we are offering some great perks ranging from logo stickers, the ability to name an NPC (non-player character) the player characters will encounter, associate producer perks with IMDB credit, IMDB special thanks and other unique benefits.
If we don't raise the full amount, funds raised will go directly to cast/crew support.


The Impact
Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

This production is largely funded out of pocket of our producers because we believe in what this series can become and do for the promotion of Montana-based business, actors, and crews.
Your generosity allows us to make Season 1 filming bigger and better, plain and simple. 


Risks & Challenges
There are always risks and challenges in a project like this. Cast/crew illnesses, travel difficulties, equipment failure, and much more can always happen. This is Montana, and trying to travel in the fall can sometimes be just as hazardous as traveling in the depths of winter.

All challenges will be met head-on and discussed openly with our cast and crew, and with our donors. Every effort will be made to overcome such challenges as easily and quickly as possible.


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Helping us get the word out and making some noise about our campaign can be just as helpful as a contribution. You may help us reach a donor that would not have otherwise found us!
When sharing, please make sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

Chicago Success, Soul & Blues Documentary is a combined live-streamed videos of DocuSeries produced by Ari'ze Women Network profiling Chicago residents who faced challenges growing up in urban, ghetto communities in Chicago. Success stories, tragedies. Soul and Blues artists who are from Chicago, performed in Chicago, challenges, success and losses of the music industry, as an entrepreneur, business owner. Artifacts, buildings, restaurants. From Annie Malone to The Staple Singers, The Emotions, people, music artists and monuments that put Chicago on the map.

  • I am a daughter of the Blues. Looking back I have 13 years of experience in digital marketing. Before digital marketing, I was a publisher, writer, editor, CEO of a local Chicago newspaper, African-American Woman. I have helped other businesses to expand their net worth by giving them online presence in the global community. I became a Chicago Access Network CANTV producer in 2000, Community access Producer in Wisconsin 13 years. Facebook music group owner, and CEO of Ari'ze Women Network.
  • Your contributions will help us achieve our goal of showing the people, places, challenges and triumphal journey of others that made others lives and Chicago great.
  • Fundraising goal is $5,000.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $5,000 in funding to be able to have a great documentary with music and artists who will share their story, challenges and triumphs. 
  • Music licensing can run in the thousands. We want to be able to pay for usage of images and music to make the documentary great entertainment as well as educate our audience/viewers.
  • We will be transparent and reach out to potential sponsor for their support. We know this can be challenging so we are asking that each one of you donate what you are able to donate to ensure we are successful in our fundraiser.
  • Our goal is to have our documentary streamed on Amazon Originals or Tubi TV. As well, we want to provide DVD copies to libraries and schools in the Chicago and surrounding cities. The pride of Chicago is what's missing with the youths/teens. If you don't know your history you are lost. The young people need positive role models and education on how to succeed in life. Although many of our guests, artist come from the ghetto, urban communities of Chicago, they succeeded and want to share their stories.
  • Not Chiraq but Chitown!! From the Chicago Blues to Soul, Chicago has brought forth many artists that have traveled the world, sharing our culture, food and entertainment with the world. Putting smiles on faces all while we faced oppressive challenges. The opportunities, the challenges, the pitfalls all must be shared with our viewers so they may know from where they come, the strength needed to succeed and the greatness that lies within them. We would like to be able to provide the educational, and entertainment vehicle to other urban communities outside of Chicago in our cities.
  • WHAT YOU GET:  Our unique Perks include personal, digital Thank you from producers, Collectors item music CD "That's Alright" from the last recording of Chicago Blues pioneer Big Smokey Smothers, cd produced by Paul Barry. Honorable mentions of your name or business name in promotional videos, on our website, on our Youtube channel. From Contributing Sponsors to Gold and Platinum Sponsors, we need your support. We will update you on where we are in our fundraiser and news of where we are in obtaining sponsors. Sponsorship and Producers receive personalized glossy awards, and listed as producers in the Chicago Success Soul & Blues Documentary.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, funds will go towards the production of the documentary and further fundraiser outreach to potential sponsors.

We look forward to the success of the Chicago Success Soul & Blues Documentary. With your donation we can all share in making an impact in bringing positive entertainment content that is so much needed now. We want to share the Chicago gems, people, places and the music that make Chicago and the world happy and great! With your contribution, we can make it happen.

Thank you for your contribution!!

Crystal QNef Smothers, Creator, Producer

https://youtu.be/4jXU22Fdt_4

story:
The Pack is a 10-13 episode drama/fantasy series written for TV. So far, the pilot itself has won multiple awards including Best Short Script In the Royal Wolf and Pinnacle Film Awards, but sometimes it takes a bit more than a great script to get it in front of the right .

Noel Summerford wants nothing more than to be a normal college student, which isn’t easy considering his family name and genetic makeup. Ten years prior, a popular DNA kit revealed that ten percent of the population held a mutation, one that linked them to the mythological werewolves of old.. When his mother, the Alpha of the pack, mysteriously vanishes, his life takes a twist as clues begin to surface that put him and his trouble prone brother and sister right in the middle of an ongoing conspiracy that goes back decades.

Pitching to executives can be fun, and while they can get you in a lot of doors, there's times when you need visuals. 

We've been working on The Pack series for almost two years, with rewrites, touchups, edits, and upping... or lowering... the page count, but we've found that now it’s the perfect time to take things in a different direction.

It's time to start filming.

That's where you come in. 

By investing in the project, you get some cool perks and if you've ever wanted to see your name on screen, that's definitely one of them. We're also inviting those who chose the "Executive Producer" perk to any film festivals.

story:
"Open Ethnicity"

UPDATE: Subscribe to our YouTube channel for exclusive content!

"Open ethnicity" refers to the ethnicity of characters in film and TV. Some characters are specifically written to be open gender, and open ethnicity, like cashiers, or bartenders, so non-white actors have an equal chance of auditioning for these roles. It's definitely a way to break into the industry.

The pilot is written and will be directed by yours truly. I'm also the producer with Libra Sun Productions, my production company, which I am CEO of :P I got tons of hats on, and I look great in all of them, I know. But, help, I need money to feed my family (crew & cast)! I also need to rent a couple items: a Ronin 2 gimbal, and 2 CFast cards. The other equipment has been generously donated by Mike Li (www.imdb.com/name/nm3870289) and Dominic Chan (www.dcheadshots.ca). The location for Day 1 is generously donated by Katrin Braga (www.katrinbraga.com).

Check out all the artists working on this project (in no particular order): Julie Tao, Justyna Bania, Dominic Chan, Jenny Lee-Gilmore, Virgo Velasquez, Nikki Chohan, Mika Deneige, Emily Lee, Amanda Sulistio, Courtney Raham, Lan Zhao, Sam Lin, Mike Li, and Nathan Yan (THIS IS JUST CREW). Our wonderful cast includes: Julie Tao, Justyna Bania, Jacq Ainsworth, Justin Lacey (we only cast actors with J-names) (JK), Nikki Chohan, Ariel Slack, Stephanie Cho, Emily Lee, Vanessa Prasad, and Jessica Freebairn.

What We Need & What You Get

If any or all these people above are your friends, do YOU WANT THEM TO STARVE???

I would never starve my beautiful, talented, hardworking colleagues, but my credit card is gonna be REAL full, if you know what I mean. That's why we need you to donate what you can to help me lessen that load. C'mon, we're making groundbreaking art here.

  • Ronin 2 gimbal - $250 + taxes

  • 2 x CFast card to shoot RAW footage - 2 x $45 = $90

  • Front Row insurance for Ronin 2 - $90

  • gas money to transport equipment & crew - $45

  • craft services - $85

  • meals - $120

  • Accident on Set insurance for union actors - $50

  • fee to use Indiegogo - $25 + 5%/donation

You'll get the satisfaction of doing a good deed, and also karma will smile upon you, and also, you will always have my support in anything you ever want to venture into.

The Impact

Good stuff that will come from this pilot:

  • Opportunities for female filmmakers and filmmakers of colour
  • Opportunities for actors and actresses of colour to collaborate
  • Happy, well-fed cast and crew
  • World peace
  • Knowledge of my secret life as an actress
  • Knowledge of the Vancouver film industry
  • Knowledge of how women of colour actually are

Risks & Challenges

  • None whatsoever, c'mon Indiegogo, what a weird section

Other Ways You Can Help

Please follow the official Instagram (www.instagram.com/openethnicity). If you have questions or concerns, our email is openethnicityseries@gmail.com :)

story:
Demi & Ace - aromantic comedy

Demi & Ace is an upcoming webseries that focuses on two friends going through the mishaps of the rom-coms you know and love, with one twist: they are both on the asexual spectrum. The show breaks stereotypes assigned to asexuality and offers much needed representation of the asexual-aromantic spectrum.

The rare cases of asexual representation in entertainment often portray it as a whimsical character quirk or even as a trait signaling coldness and emotional unavailability. As a response to these harmful misrepresentations, our team is creating a show in which its main characters are on the asexuality spectrum AND are fully characterised, realistic people outside of their sexual identities.

The vision

Did you grow up loving shows like H2O: Just Add Water or W.i.t.c.h.? Are you a fan of the colourful and stylised heightened reality of many Korean dramas?

If so, you will most surely enjoy the captivating and immersive world of Demi & Ace. Our show will stylistically and aesthetically emulate your nostalgic favourites, while updating the content and message to be more inclusive and diverse.

Demi & Ace will make you giggle regardless of your identity, but also aims to empower our target audience, the community of wonderful people on the ace-spectrum. Through the show, we want to create a platform for horizontal communication to truly connect with our viewers. In doing so, we wish to enable all the ace and aro people to find a safe space and open community within the Demi & Ace social platforms.

About the production

The series is an original idea by our brilliant screenwriter and showrunner Laura Eklund Nhaga, who has previously written and starred in the literature inspired web-series Project Green Gables.

The show will be produced and filmed in Finland, primarily in Helsinki, during Autumn 2021, covid-19 restrictions considered, and the post-production and editing will continue until the release in February 2022. While the production team and parts of the cast are Finnish, the show itself will be entirely in English. We will also provide subtitles in at least 3 languages (Finnish, English and Swedish) to make the show as accessible as possible.

Why we need your help

Our full aim is to make Demi & Ace a valuable addition in representation of asexual identities, as well as a fun, enjoyable show. In order to fully realise our vision, we are crowdfunding to cater the minimum budget we need to make the series into reality. We have also applied for a grant, but as the results will be unsure, the Indiegogo campaign will help us stay on schedule with the production. As a team, we firmly believe in transparency and accountability, and thus will announce the results of the grant application when we have them.

If we are unable to meet our goal within the established time frame, all your donations will be refunded by Indiegogo within 5-7 business days. We started the campaign because we wanted to have a realistic and achievable goal in order to be able to pay our cast and crew at least a little for their valuable time. However, both of our avenues in funding are targeted at the lower end for media productions. Our highest priority is to make the series happen.

With our prior experience with web-series, we will in all likelihood be able to complete this project regardless of extensive funding. Our producer Mimosa has mapped out three alternative budgets we can follow depending on the extent of the funding we manage to gather. With this in mind, if you see the importance of this project but cannot afford to donate, worry not! Please stay tuned to enjoy our final product, we will do our very best to deliver the show within the current timeline.

Cast & Crew

Showrunner & Screenwriter / Demi
Laura Eklund Nhaga (she/her)

Laura is the showrunner and screenwriter of Demi & Ace. She will also be playing the titular Demi! Laura is a 24-year-old actress, writer and spoken word artist that you might recognise from projects such as Project Green Gables and Hotel Swan Helsinki. Or maybe you've seen her in the many Open Mics of Helsinki.

Ace
Katri Swan (she/her)

Katri is an actress and currently studying screenwriting. She believes that storytelling is central to human existence and as it exists in every culture around the world she wanted to explore it. After traveling around the world for almost 2 years, mind full of stories she wanted to solely focus on the craft of cinema and acting. Katri studied in Los Angeles for 5 years at the University of California and at the Actor's Academy. Since then she has returned to Europe and has worked in Finnish TV-series, films and short films.

Producer
Mimosa Linnea (she/her)

Mimosa Linnea was a part of the original core team of Project Green Gables from its beginnings. She holds her undergraduate degree in film studies from King’s College London, and has experience on a variety of media works in the production department. Now back in Finland, she’s finishing her master’s degree in media studies while dreaming of adopting a puppy.

Co-Producer
Tuulia Heiskanen (she/her)

Tuulia was an integral part of the team creating Project Green Gables. She has a BA in law and is currently working at a law firm. Her hobbies include writing poetry and learning k-pop dances.

Assistant Producer
Jutta Majava (she/her)

Jutta is an assistant producer working alongside Mimosa and Tuulia. Knowing most of the crew from high school, you may recognise her as Diana Barry from their previous production, Project Green Gables. She currently works as a barista and is saving up to continue her post grad studies in social sciences.

Publicist
Tiina Peltonen (she/her)

Tiina is a content creator for social media and has gained experience in communications through an internship and involvement in different projects. She has a master of arts degree in literature, and she loves writing, movies and yoga.

Our team is growing, so stay tuned to learn more!

Alternative ways to join us

You can join our Discord server where you can connect with us and others interested in our show. Our goal is to create a community and a safe space for like-minded people.

We also have an exclusive premium channel which is accessible for a 5 € fee donation. There we will post exclusive behind the scenes content and you will have a chance to hang out with our cast later on. Introductions on how to claim the perk are on the server.

You can also follow us on:

Instagram: @demiandaceshow
Twitter: @DemiAndAceShow
Tumblr: demiandaceshow
Discord: https://discord.gg/QhnbnkYQQU

story:
OK..SO WHAT IS THE ACTUAL HOW ABOUT?

Set in upstate New York in a small military town which experiences a communications blackout and orders to immediately fire a nuclear missile on Washington DC... We watch the story unfold as what appears to be an attack of Alien nature grips the small town (and perhaps the world).  

Each episode runs at the same time but a different location, giving the audience a greater perspective of what's happening (with the random cut to the White House and spoiling the War of the Worlds style experience).  

WILL IT AIR ON TV?

Well yes... we certainly hope... and you'll be relieved to know that we have more than hope on our side here. We recently produced and delivered TV show AGE OF THE LIVING DEAD, currently airing on FOX.  Not similar in genre, but very similar in production style - and we're pleased to say that this show is getting a season 2! Take a look at some of the Promo's: 

As you can see, it's not the first time we've done this kind of thing, so we know the pitfalls to avoid when trying to get these type of things to air.

THIS DOESN'T SOUND LIKE ENOUGH MONEY TO SHOOT EPISODE 2?

Well in short, it's not... but it helps us gather budget and support from fellow filmmakers and we combine this with support we already have to try and push for greater production value and more prep time (which in logistical nightmare like this one is really needed!). So aswell as backing the campaign it would be really helpful if you would; 

Spread the word about the production

Tell us if you can support the show in another fashion (help on set, props, costume locations...anything and everything you could bring to the table which may help us)

Support us by spreading the campaign

HOW DID THE PILOT SHOOT GO

Good... but it was new ground for everyone... even the very established crew and cast had to adapt their approach on the production. Here's some screenshots from the pilot;

KEY PEOPLE

Paul Tanter serves as Director and Producer on the show, having executed 20+ features and TV shows in just ten years in the industry. 

Simon Phillips as show runner and Producer.

Jamie Bailey as Producer and Cinematographer for the show.

 

CAST 

We've assembled a great cast for the show and still have some exciting additions to announce as we progress. 

Jason Faunt (Click for Previous credits via IMDb)

Al Sapienza (Click for previous credits via IMDb)

Deji Laray (Click for previous credits via IMDb)

Kate Schroder (Click for previous credits via IMDb)

Keegan Chambers  (Click for previous credits via IMDb)

Simon Phillips (Click for previous credits via IMDb)

Ron Cobert (Click for previous credits via IMDb)

Ben lloyd Holmes. (Click for previous credits via IMDb)

Yana Gold (Click for previous credits via IMDb)

Michael Copon (Click for previous credits via IMDb)

Andrew Brittle as Associate Producer. 

 

OK, SO I CAN BE IN THE SHOW? IS THAT RIGHT??

Yes, it is! We have a very special, but limited reward, whereby you can actually get yourself in the show but you musty be available to attend shooting in May 2019 in the GTA area. More details available upon selecting the reward and us assigning you a suitable speaking role in the appropriate episode. This will involve a discussion with the director and producers with you on the phone/skype upon selecting the reward.

WHY CROWD FUNDING?

We have planned this show for years. The success of the execution of our pilot episode means we'd like to push forward to do the whole series now. We came here for 3 reasons:

1. Vision - we had a vision, we've been true to it thus far, and we wish to maintain that vision as a driving force. To do that, we need to remain independent - crowd funding  allows us to do this.

2.  Human drama often drives the success of television programming, and we've got plenty of it here, but we want the individual human drama and the big-picture drama of the future of humanity hanging in the balance, to work together truthfully. Undoubtedly the show is dark, but it's far from depressing. Essentially, this is the story of the extremes of human nature when the lives of those we love are at stake.

3. Collaboration - we welcome input and recognize that we are dealing with a subject people are fascinated with, so why not allow others to be part of it?

About the Rewards

A few notes:

Streams of the full season become available a single episode at a time.

Any questions and/or comments at all - hit us up, we are happy to engage and discuss.

Risks and challenges

Every project has a certain amount of risk, no matter what. Film and television (normally) has a lot of risk. But there are two very mitigating factors here:

First, we've already shot the Pilot and established the team for the whole series.

Second, it's not our first rodeo. We have a long list of credits on commercial features, TV shows, and the like. We understand contingency.

Yes, we are in discussions about where it would air and when, but we are bound by non-disclosure on this and can say no more. But it will air.

Whereas many projects involve concept and ventures much earlier in the production cycle, this one has passed the point where there is question. The risks and challenges we may face - and there is always the unexpected - will be overcome. The project, being at such a late stage in the production life cycle, has very minimal risk and none to backers.
story_txt: OK..SO WHAT IS THE ACTUAL HOW ABOUT?Set in upstate New York in a small military town which experiences a communications blackout and orders to immediately fire a nuclear missile on Washington DC... We watch the story unfold as what appears to be an attack of Alien nature grips the small town (and perhaps the world).  Each episode runs at the same time but a different location, giving the audience a greater perspective of what's happening (with the random cut to the White House and spoiling the War of the Worlds style experience).  WILL IT AIR ON TV?Well yes... we certainly hope... and you'll be relieved to know that we have more than hope on our side here. We recently produced and delivered TV show AGE OF THE LIVING DEAD, currently airing on FOX.  Not similar in genre, but very similar in production style - and we're pleased to say that this show is getting a season 2! Take a look at some of the Promo's: As you can see, it's not the first time we've done this kind of thing, so we know the pitfalls to avoid when trying to get these type of things to air.THIS DOESN'T SOUND LIKE ENOUGH MONEY TO SHOOT EPISODE 2?Well in short, it's not... but it helps us gather budget and support from fellow filmmakers and we combine this with support we already have to try and push for greater production value and more prep time (which in logistical nightmare like this one is really needed!). So aswell as backing the campaign it would be really helpful if you would; Spread the word about the productionTell us if you can support the show in another fashion (help on set, props, costume locations...anything and everything you could bring to the table which may help us)Support us by spreading the campaignHOW DID THE PILOT SHOOT GOGood... but it was new ground for everyone... even the very established crew and cast had to adapt their approach on the production. story:
*****Update*****
​You can now access some of our limited edition rewards by visiting our website here where we now accept a variety of payments including PayPal.
*****Update*****

          

RHINELAND 45 – DECISION IN THE WEST

The Battle of the Rhineland was one of the largest WW2 battles the Allies fought on German soil and part of the critical final campaign against Nazi Germany on the western front.


U.S. soldiers crossing the Rhine under enemy fire at Sankt Goar, Germany, March 1945.
89th Infantry Division

The Battle for the Rhineland was a series of operations in early 1945, the dramatic finale of the Allied advance from the coast of Normandy to the borders of the Reich. The desperate German forces had managed to form a last line of defence with their backs to the Rhine – the famous river that stood between the Allies and the heart of the German Reich.


British soldiers crossing the Roer river during Operation Veritable.

FEATURED IN

"YouTube Channel Uses Crowd Funding To Produce Epic World War II Documentary"


Today the Rhineland campaign (Operations Veritable, Grenade and Plunder/Varsity) is often overlooked when we remember the last weeks of World War 2. The operation and its results were already hotly debated among the Allied generals while the war was still raging. In popular memory, the Rhine crossing is mostly associated with the Bridge at Remagen the popularized narrative we know from the movie with the same name – though the brunt of the fighting happened further to the North in the Rhineland region.


German Sturmgeschütz III moving to the Western Front in December 1944.

75 years after this battle, its history needs to be preserved and retold for a new generation. This kind of documentary can only be made through crowdfunding. Neither the traditional broadcast companies, TV stations nor YouTube would be suitable for our vision. We want to tell the story of this battle as accurately as possible without any interference or content restrictions.

Origin of the Project


Jesse's grandfather served with the Cameron Highlanders of Ottawa during the Rhineland campaign.

When we worked on our Battle of Berlin documentary (16 Days in Berlin), everyone in the team got a little curious: What did our family do in the late phase of the war? We all have family members who served in World War 2. Jesse, our resident historian, knew that his grandfather James served in a machine-gun team with the Cameron Highlanders of Ottawa in France and Netherlands. But then we realised he also fought in the Rhineland campaign in February and March 1945, even though he didn’t talk much about it. This was a campaign we also didn’t know much about before and when we understood the scale and the significance of it, the idea for this project was born. Jesse’s grandfather’s unit will be a part of the documentary of course.

Meet the Team


That's us: Jesse, Flo & Toni

We are Real Time History, the team behind the successful YouTube channel The Great War and the groundbreaking documentary series 16 Days in Berlin. We have produced well over 100 hours of high quality history documentaries over the past years and over 218 million views!



Host and researcher Jesse has an MA in history and has been studying early 20th-century history for years. Additional support comes from our international network of scholars and experts that will provide insights into complex topics such as combined arms warfare or the last efforts of the Nazi regime to stay in power.
 

Documentary Partners
 


David Willey, curator of The Tank Museum

The Tank Museum in Bovington, United Kingdom, houses one of the best collections of tanks in the world, with of over 300 tanks and armoured vehicles that tell the story of more than 100 years of tank warfare. As a British museum their collection features some of the types of vehicles that fought in the Rhineland 1945 such as the M22 Locust or the Comet tank. Their vast collections and archives include not just tanks, but diaries, photos, firearms and equipment that was used in World War 2. With their expertise and resident production crew, they will support Rhineland 45 – and your contribution will also support our work here at the Tank Museum during a year where the support for museums is more important than ever.


Christoph Bergs, aviation historian and YouTube creator, stands in front of a German Me262.

Christoph Bergs is a military aviation historian and has his own YouTube channel where he climbs into the cockpit of legendary aeroplanes. Chris will lend his expertise about aerial warfare. The battle for the Rhineland included extensive strategic bombing and one of the biggest airborne operations in history.


Matthew Moss is a firearms historian and will explore how and with what the soldiers in the Rhineland campaign fought.

Matthew Moss is a military historian and author. He has written several books and runs historicalfirearms.info and the YouTube channel The Armourer's Bench, both projects look at the history, development and use of weapons in war. Understanding the weapons and equipment soldiers' used is instrumental in understanding how they fought, Matthew's expertise will help us explore the weapons that shaped the Battle for the Rhineland.

Rewards 

Each reward includes digital access to the documentary. You will be able to watch it on any internet connected screen, from your smart phone, tablet, laptop and smart TV.

The Ultimate Companion Book


Our Official  Companion Book will be the ultimate companion to the documentary and will contain maps, notes, photos and complementary material to the documentary. This book will help you discover the battlefield for yourself.

Virtual Production Team

Join the Real Time History production team and get exclusive access to production live streams, behind the scenes footage, and archive material. This is like watching the DVD extras while the documentary is being made! Watch day-to-day progress and interact with the crew. Gain insight into the creation process and contribute ideas

Battlefield Virtual Tour

In a year where travelling is a bigger challenge than usual, we're offering an exciting interactive virtual battlefield tour of the Rhineland battlefield with Jesse Alexander. In this streamed and guided tour we will show you the actual battlefield and its intricacies. Also includes streaming the documentary and behind the scenes access.

Double Feature

Stream Rhineland 45 once it's available AND get access to our previous documentary series 16 Days in Berlin - an 18 part, 5 hour long documentary about the Soviet attack on Berlin in April 1945 (unlocks after the campaign ends).

Commission a Documentary

Preserve the memory of a loved one for future generations of your family. This is your chance to commission and help develop a short documentary to be filmed and produced by the team behind The Great War about a relative who fought in WW1 or WW2. As part of the team you’ll be involved in the research and development of the film and receive Executive Producer credit for your role in the production.

What our community says

Every Pledge Counts

We've created rewards we think you're really going to love: digital access passes, behind the scenes access so you can see how the documentary production process works and contribute ideas, special virtual tours of the battlefield, our Official Companion Book, and you can even commission us to make a documentary about a relative of your who fought in WW1 or WW2.

  • Be part of the production team and get behind the scenes access​
  • Watch the documentary online
  • Enjoy and virtual battlefield tour  
  • See your name in the credits

Stretch Goals

To tell the story of RHINELAND 45, we needed at least €25,000. But as with  Now, as with every part of history, there are always more facets, more details we want to talk about. With every contribution, we have the opportunity to invest more in maps, animations, historical footage and original research. Our stretch goals illustrate what we could do with that extra support.

€100,000

We'll have a higher budget for maps, animations and finding more authentic combat footage – all of which helps bringing the history to live while making it easier to understand.

€250,000

This will enable us to produce a proper documentary series again, with 5 one hour long episodes that detail the different phases of the battle. With this budget we wouldn’t be limited to retelling the events but could spend time with deeper analysis of the battles, zoom in to the tactical scale of the battles and really upgrade our graphical capabilities to the next level - 3D!

€500,000

Historical Footage is expensive and with with level of funding will enable to colorise and also release the documentary in 4K. With new AI technology we can colorize the black and white footage from the battle. To  but to recreate the colors accurately, this extra funding will give us the manpower, but the to produce results that will bring you closer to the battle than ever before.|

Auf Deutsch & En Français

Wir sind ein Team aus Deutschland und würden unsere Dokumentation gern auch komplett lokalisiert anbieten, das heißt nicht nur mit deutschen Untertiteln, sondern komplett in Deutsch vertont und mit deutschen Grafiken. Um für dieses Unterfangen zu werben, werden wir später auch eine kleine Extra-Kampagne auf einer deutschen Crowdfunding-Seite durchführen.

Notre équipe est bien consciente que notre projet serait d’intérêt pour un publique francophone aussi, surtout mais pas seulement au Canada. On aimerait bien offrir non seulement des sous-titres en français, mais une version intégrale du film en français - y compris la modération et les éléments visuels. Pour réaliser cette ambition nous allons aussi lancer une modeste campagne de levée de fonds sur un site francophone.

Why Crowdfunding?

This campaign is very much a response to YouTube's moves against hate speech which inadvertently hit genuine, high quality educational content.  These topics are not advertising friendly. And that's why we're seeking funding via this campaign.
 

 

Meet the Team

FLO WITTIG


CEO & Executive Producer

Before founding Real Time History with Toni Steller, Florian produced The Great War YouTube channel since its inception. Flo is a native Berliner and responsible for content planning and community management, both vital to the success of the The Great War. Flo has an MA as Creative Producer from the Zurich University of Arts and a BA as Online-Editor from the University of Applied Sciences Cologne.

 

TONI STELLER


Director & Production Manager

Toni Steller has been working in the TV and online video industries in Berlin for over ten years. As a trained and state-approved audio-visual media designer, he worked for popular TV productions in Germany as producer and director. Toni has been behind the look and feel of The Great War since the very beginning. Beyond the studio, he successfully transferred the show's characteristics to the outside world when The Great War was filmed in museums or former battlefields.

 

JESSE ALEXANDER


Historian & Broadcaster

 Jesse Alexander is a historian, educator and higher education professional based in Vienna, Austria. He holds a BA in History from the University of Ottawa and an MA in Modern History from the University of Vienna. His focus is conflict in the first half of the 20th century. He has worked as a researcher and educator with Canada's Cold War Museum, the Canadian Museum of Civilization, the Canadian War Museum, the National Research Council of Canada, le Centre Juno Beach, le Mémorial national du Canada à Vimy, the Library of Parliament of Canada and more. With his passion for presenting history to a diverse audience, he recently joined The Great War as the new host and lead writer and with his ability to speak English, French, German and Russian, he brings an international perspective to the project.

 

DAN MORELLE


Crowdfunding Producer

Dan is a creative entrepreneur, producer, and qualified teacher. Dan has produced several hit podcasts including 'You're Dead to Me! for the BBC, and his shows have had 10 million downloads combined. Dan has organised events at Downing Street, raised £1M with crowdfunding, and was a co-founder of History Hit with Broadcaster, Dan Snow. In 2017 Dan headed Crowdfunding and Community at Dig Hill 80 - an archaeological excavation of a WW1 battlefield in Wijtschate, Belgium that recovered the remains of 135 soldiers. He has a BA in Communications & Audio Visual Production from London Metropolitan University, a Post Graduate Certificate in Education.

 

Get Involved

Whether or not you can make a financial pledge at the moment, we'd still really appreciate your help in spreading the word about the Rhineland 45. You can do this by sharing this page via social media, or mentioning the documentary and book to your friends. Thank you!

Contact Us

You can reach us at support@realtimehistory.net or on Messenger here. We'll get back to you within 48 hours.

Thank you!Contact UsYou can reach us at support@realtimehistory.net or on Messenger here. We'll get back to you within 48 hours.

story:
MARKETING POSTER PERK
 
Prior to successfully reaching our crowdfunding campaign stretch goal to commission Neil Fraser to create our marketing poster, we set up a fresh campaign at https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/origins-of-the-laoich-poster-commission/x/23587284 which will be running until the end of August. If you'd like one of our 100 signed A4 copies of our poster, head over there and grab the perk!
 
We'll be prepping our physical perks over the next few months and shipping them out to you all!
 

"The Origins of the Laoich" is a brand new, ambitious mythological fantasy series set in the Highlands of Scotland. And with your help, we can get it off the ground.

Upon returning home to Scotland after 14 years in America Effie Dwyer’s destiny catches up with her when her Highland village is attacked by ancient Scottish mythological creatures. Can Effie discover the secrets of the well, embrace her identity and save her family and friends?

 
STRETCH GOALS
 
Thank you SO much to every single person who has pledged to our campaign so far. We cannot believe we've reached over £13,000 on IndieGoGo. Because of you we are able to commission freelance artists, actors, TV crew, visual effects animators, sound designers, composers, fight directors, costume designers, hair and makeup artists, prop designers, art department, producers, a director, a writer, a script editor, runners and more - the life force of any TV or film production.
 
We've reached our stretch goal of £13,700 and now we can commission poster artist Neil Fraser to create our original marketing poster, that we'll use when pitching the series to distributors, streamers, financiers, production companies etc. 
 
We've set up the Origins of the Laoich Poster Perk for £10 which will see you receive an A4 signed copy of the final poster design with 100 available.
 
The more we raise the more content we can produce to package as our pitch to the likes of Netflix, Amazon Prime, Disney+, Hulu, etc. We will present our series to distributors, producers and streamers in the hope we'll get picked up and developed, creating a new and exciting mythological series set in the Highlands of Scotland. With your help we can make this a reality! 
 
WHERE ARE WE UP TO
 
We will be ending our successful crowdfunding campaign on the 1st of August. The 10 planned scenes are nearly finished and once they are we will have our sizzle reel ready to send out. From there we'll cut together our trailer - using the best scenes to pitch our series, our characters, our setting and our story. We'll take it to as many production companies, broadcasters and streamers as possible. 
 
In a time when artists and creatives are being told to re-train, to give up their goals and careers, YOU are keeping the hope alive for us all. 
 
So grab a perk: our original prequel comic, concept art, stage combat training, zombie monster training, an IMDb Associate Producer, Producer or Executive Producer perk, a sponsorship perk, a thank you video from our team and much, much more. 
 
The more we raise, the more materials we can produce when we pitch our series to production companies, streamers and broadcasters!
 
 

"The Origins of Laoich" is a brand new, ambitious mythological fantasy series set in the Highlands of Scotland. And with your help, we can get it off the ground.

Upon returning home to Scotland after 14 years in America Effie Dwyer’s destiny catches up with her when her Highland village is attacked by ancient Scottish mythological creatures. Can Effie discover the secrets of the well, embrace her identity and save her family and friends?

     

       

      The purpose of a presentation reel (or sizzle reel) is to show potential producers, production companies, sales agents, distributors and streaming services what your series is about and its marketable potential. 
       

      We are able to shoot some of the intimate moments of our story, showcasing our diverse characters but the more money we raise from this campaign, the more elements we can add to the overall reel including one of our Scottish monsters and two fight scenes!

      We are delighted to announce that Scottish actress Innes Anderson will be playing the role of Effie Dwyer in our sizzle reel. Innes studied at the Dance School of Scotland and the Academy of the Live and Recorded Arts and has starred as conflicted werewolf Alexis Smith in the award winning Amazon Prime web-series, "Cops and Monsters". We can't possibly imagine anyone else playing Effie and we are delighted Innes has joined our cast.

      Holly Jack will be playing Alia Kelton - our 18th century warrior! Holly's credits include "River City", "Waterloo Road", "Burnistoun" and "Footballers United". Holly is excited to be a part of our team! 

      Scottish actress Ellen Patterson will be playing Effie's best friend, Avril Campbell. Avril is a driven and fun character, tasked with keeping Effie calm leading up to her wedding day, whilst having to balance her work life at her Dad's hotel and her new relationship with Carwen. Ellen has appeared in the award winning Amazon Prime web-series "Cops and Monsters" and "Christmas in the Highlands".

      Rebecca Turner is playing our Bean-Nighe! Rebecca graduated from the university of Highlands and Islands with a BA(hons) in Drama and Performance, and has been performing with Scarescotland since 2016. 

      She has studied a number of performing arts over the years, from ballet and tap dancing, to more niche techniques such as the Japanese dance theatre form Butoh. 

      Rebecca hopes to use Butoh techniques to bring the eerie/dark side of Bean Nighe to life for our sizzle reel.

      Stage and screen actor SIMON WEIR is best known for his television work on PATRICK MELROSE, MONARCH OF THE GLEN, RIVER CITY, EMMERDALE, HOW NOT TO LIVE YOUR LIFE, HOPE SPRINGS, TAGGART, GLASGOW KISS, ARMCHAIR DETECTIVES, TRUST ME, IN PLAIN SIGHT, DOCTORS, WATERLOO ROAD, CASE HISTORIES and as series regular Paul Lafferty in HIGH ROAD. His film roles include THE ACID HOUSE, THE FOOTBALL FACTORY, 90 MINUTES, A SPANKING IN PARADISE, POSTMORTEM and T2 TRAINSPOTTING. Simon also appears in the Silly Wee Films produced COPS & MONSTERS and feature film NIGHT IS DAY and is delighted to be joining the cast of ORIGINS.

      Edinburgh-based actor Gordon J Millar built a reputation across the UK and USA as the founder of Scot Street Style. His creative journey led him on to the set of Outlaw King, which ignited his passion for acting, and he’s never looked back.

      He enrolled at the Acting Out Drama School, and continued his studies across Scotland, at Unsub Actors in Glasgow, The Acting Lab in Dundee, and the Edinburgh Acting School. He recently gained a Distinction on an Acting Diploma through Trinity College London.

      Gordon was cast as the lead antagonist in Episode 2 of BBC Scotland’s Rise of the Clans, which was broadcast around the globe.

      He is thrilled to be cast as Gregor Dwyer in the sizzle reel for Origins, and cannot wait to work with the director, cast & crew.

      Jamie-Richard Stewart has joined our sizzle reel cast, playing the role of Cromwell. Jamie trained at Birmingham School of Acting, but for many years was doing other things than acting. Returned to his first love in 2017 and have been steadily building up steadily. 2 Edinburgh Fringe shows, animation voice work, online Shakespeare during lockdown, and playing my 16th century name sake in BBC Rise of the Clans in 2018. Jamie is looking to work more in TV, film, and voice, having worked for BBC Radio Drama in the past.

      In return for your support of our pre-production development you'll get:

      • Regular update videos on our progress
      • Access to watch the teaser before anyone else
      • Visit our set when we are filming our presentation reel
      • Credited on our end titles and IMDb. 
      • The satisfaction of knowing that you were a part of the film from the beginning! 
      • A "Origins" Promotional T-Shirt
      • Zombie training from Scare Scotland
      • Original "Origins" artwork from David Fergusson
      • Hand-to-Hand and weapons training from Strike Team Scotland
      • Associate Producers will have a private link of our 90 second teaser trailer based on our sizzle reel footage sent to them prior to the video going live on social media
      • Producers and Executive Producers will have access to ALL of the sizzle reel scenes that we film, sent as a private link.

      Original Promo Art by David Fergusson

       

      To help us really sell the series and the story, we'd like to include a scene including one of our creatures from Scottish mythology - the Bean-Nighe aka The Scottish Banshee.

       Gibbet FX, an Edinburgh-based special effects company, can create this creature for us, with Scare Scotland providing us with one of their performers to embody the role. Gibbet FX have offered us this creature for £1500. We are offering 10 places on our SPONSOR A MONSTER perk, at £150 each, you will be an official sponsor of our Bean-Nighe, with the chance to come to location (when it is safe to do so) as we film the scene in which our creature will appear. You can watch filming take place and get your photo with the monster! 

      Strike Fight Company have also offered to be involved in our production; providing us with rehearsals and their skills to create TWO fights in our presentation reel. These will be a mixture of hand-to-hand combat and a sword fight. You can visit their website to get a feel of the level of work they can offer our presentation reel. The cost to bring the Strike Fight Company on board is £1000.

      Strike Fight Company are also offering a limited amount of places to train YOU and your friend either hand-to-hand combat or weapon combat. These are available as perks on our campaign. These classes will take place when it is safe to do so.

      And finally we'll need costumes. Our presentation reel is likely to feature 8 characters. Two of which are from 16th century Scotland and so it's important that we hire the best person for the job, who can use their skills and experiences to bring our characters to life through costume and design. Most contemporary costumes are easier to source and put together, but our historical costumes will obviously cost us more and take more time to put together. 

      The quotes we have been receiving, including the designer's time, is roughly £1000. We could technically find some cheap costumes and hire them, and ask our actors to bring their own clothing to create the costumes, but as we will be pitching this sizzle reel to producers from around the world and production companies, we want to put our best foot forward and make this series a hot commodity. We don't want to give them any reasons to say no to us.

      Progressive Broadcast Scotland are sponsoring our sizzle reel and providing us with an Arri Alexa package to shoot our taster on.

      Hair and Makeup mood board for Alia by Nefi Noufal.

      Some of our potential locations for filming our sizzle reel. Photo by Beth M Cameron.

      Set designs mood boards by Meghan Grieve and Paige Smith.

      Written by award winning filmmaker Fraser Coull, the film will be made by the creative team behind "Night is Day", "One Year Later" and "Cops and Monsters". Fraser has been writing, directing and producing short films, web series and a feature film since 2005. Fraser is proud to be Scottish and wishes to tell more stories about the country and her people, but with more monsters, action and adventure. 

      Drew Dougall joins us as our Sizzle Reel Producer. Drew Dougall is a film enthusiast who studied Drama & Theatre Arts in the mid-1990s. Drew worked as a background artist in High Road, MacCallum and feature films Hold Back the Night and The Little Vampire. While running a small production company Drew produced and directed the short film Pinstripe with Lee Crompton, and in 2010 Drew worked alongside producers Lindsay Dowell & Gavin Orr in Fraser Coull’s Night is Day feature film.

      Kate Stone joins the team as our Sizzle Reel Assistant Producer. Kate is studying Film and Media at the University of Stirling. After being part of a choir and doing musicals the last 16 years, she decided to switch to the film industry and follow my passion to be part of film productions. Kate is still finding her way and exploring all kinds of jobs that are part of the industry. Beside doing student short films in her free time, she also worked on a German TV series last summer. Additionally Kate did work placements with Blazing Griffin and shadowed Freakworks. Kate is very excited to be part of this new project and can't wait to put it on the screen!

      Lindsay Dowell joins the sizzle reel team as producer. Lindsay worked on "Night is Day" and "Copsa and Monsters" previously. She studied Drama and Theatre Arts & Media and is the current Director of Big Bad Wolf Theatre Company. Lindsay has worked as a Producer at M8 Media Glasgow and is the owner of Goldray Productions and Goldray Performers.

      Gwendolyn Jones will be helping Vivienne with the costumes for Origins. Originally from Wales, Gwen moved to Edinburgh two years ago to study Costume Design and Construction at Queen Margaret University. She loves making garments and working hands on in the costume industry. Gwen has worked on a few shows, working with Edinburgh Napier, Brunton Threatre, Kings Theatre and also Queen Margaret University’s end of year costume shows. She's really excited to get started working on Origins.

      Isaac Baker will be scoring our sizzle and here's what he had to say:

      "I've always connected strongly to film through music, ever since I first saw A Fistful of Dollars on Saturday morning TV as a kid. There's something magical about the music that transports you from reality to being in the world of the film itself.

      That magic, the kind that lurks around unseen in our everyday lives, has always inspired me and is one of the many reasons why I'm so excited to be a part of Origins."

      Ewan Stewart joins our sizzle reel as our director of photography. Ewan is a Lighting Camera Operator based in Central Scotland. He has over 15 years experience across documentary, drama, lifestyle, corporate productions, and commercials. Ewan has a passion and enthusiasm for creating beautiful impactful films.

      For the last 10 years the creative team has been creating exciting and original films and web series in Scotland and the UK. As fans of "Doctor Who", "Star Wars", "Torchwood", and "Being Human", we feel there's plenty of room for a splash of colour, monsters and action in the TV and film market. 

      Leila Dean is our visual effects animator and is currently working on our 60 second trailer. Leila graduated from the University of South Wales, Atrium in Cardiff in 2016 where she obtained my BA (Hons) degree in Visual Effects and Motion Graphics, prior to this she studied Diploma in Creative Media Production, with a Subsidiary in Art and Design, Interactive Media. 

      Leila is passionate about creativity and realism in art, she love the satisfaction of creating something that looks good and knowing that she did that herself. She is very proud to be working in the creative industries, although it can be hard work, it is very rewarding. 

      Gemma McAdam is all things audio. Having recently changed career from music teacher to sound recordist / designer, she has managed to achieve a fair amount in a short space of time. She completed her first feature film as sound mixer in 2018, ‘Christmas in The Highlands’ which was aired on the ‘Christmas 24’ channel in December 2019. Gemma’s work as a sound designer for the short film ‘Piano Man’ (Written and Directed by Lee Cooper) was nominated for ‘Best Sound’ at the HB Film Festival in 2019. She loves how much sound affects a story line and is probably the worst person to sit next to in the cinema as she will explain why the music is so important. 

      Meet our Costume Designer Vivienne Low! Over the years she has worked on a wild variety of Films, Short films, Music videos, TV commercials and Stills Shoots working with actors including Kevin McKidd and Gerald Butler. She likes to support local small businesses and Scottish companies and she works with a number of charities to make her Costume Department as ethical and sustainable as possible.  She is also a coordinator for Fashion Revolution Scotland and she's a volunteer stylist at Smartworks Edinburgh. 

      Àdhamh Ó Broin is a Gael of mixed Highland and Irish descent and grew up in Cowal, Argyll, Scotland.

      He is a writer, musician and language activist specialising in the revival of endangered Gaelic dialects as well as working as a cultural consultant for film & TV - probably best known for his role over the last seven years as Scottish Gaelic Consultant to Sony Pictures “Outlander” for which he won the International Contribution to Gaelic Award in 2016.

      Àdhamh is keen to ensure that our take on Gaelic language, lore and lifeway are as authentic as possible on “Origins” and has already been in the thick of some fascinating discussions with our writers and producers.

      We are absolutely thrilled to welcome him on board as our Gaelic Consultant and can’t wait to see the fruits of this collaboration as we bring to life the denizens of the Otherworld!

      “The more I hear about the Origins universe, the more excited I become. This series not only has real potential as superb entertainment for audiences worldwide; it could also serve as a fantastic portal for young Scots keen to find out more about the language, culture and mythology of the land they call home.”

      Meghan Grieve joins the team in the art department. Meghan is a graduate from the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland where she obtained a BA in Production Arts and Design specialising in Set and Costume Design in 2018. Since then she has freelanced within the Film and Tv Industry working for companies BBC, SFTN, In a Big Country Films and BarryCrerar working on all kinds of big and small productions as an Art Department Assistant, Art Director and Production Designer. 

      For our 60 second teaser trailer we hired Scottish actresses Karen Bartke, Shannon Davidson and Helen Cuinn to provide their vocal talent, combined with Leila's visual effects design, Gemma's sound design and Isaac's thumping score, to produce a quality teaser to help build support and an audience for our series.

      Right now entertainment has never been more important. A reason for all of us to get together, remotely or in person. Something to celebrate, to talk about, to enjoy and be a part of. With your help we can hire some amazingly talented freelance creatives to work on a project when their current work has all but disappeared because of the situation we find ourselves in. 

      With this pre-production development phase we can get the ball well and truly rolling on "Origins", to present it to the world and have a real chance of finding the right people to invest in our story and series. 

      There's no guarantee we'll be able to reach our goal and without support and funding, we can't hire our team to do their job. A project like this is a gigantic undertaken and you can't put a pin on how long things will take but right now we can write the pilot episode, start the pre-production process and get it in the right shape to present it to investors. Without you, there is no series. 

      Just spread the word, let the world know what we're doing. Share our IndieGoGo campaign on social media, with your friends and family. The more people who know what we're trying to do, the more chance we have of hitting our goal.

      Thank you.

      Alia Kelton concept art by David Fergusson

      The Nuckelavee monster design by David Fergusson

She loves making garments and working hands on in the costume industry. Gwen has worked on a few shows, working with Edinburgh Napier, Brunton Threatre, Kings Theatre and also Queen Margaret University’s end of year costume shows. She's really excited to get started working on Origins.Isaac Baker will be scoring our sizzle and here's what he had to say:"I've always connected strongly to film through music, ever since I first saw A Fistful of Dollars on Saturday morning TV as a kid. There's something magical about the music that transports you from reality to being in the world of the film itself.That magic, the kind that lurks around unseen in our everyday lives, has always inspired me and is one of the many reasons why I'm so excited to be a part of Origins."Ewan Stewart joins our sizzle reel as our director of photography. Ewan is a Lighting Camera Operator based in Central Scotland. He has over 15 years experience across documentary, drama, lifestyle, corporate productions, and commercials. Ewan has a passion and enthusiasm for creating beautiful impactful films.For the last 10 years the creative team has been creating exciting and original films and web series in Scotland and the UK. As fans of "Doctor Who", "Star Wars", "Torchwood", and "Being Human", we feel there's plenty of room for a splash of colour, monsters and action in the TV and film market. Leila Dean is our visual effects animator and is currently working on our 60 second trailer. Leila graduated from the University of South Wales, Atrium in Cardiff in 2016 where she obtained my BA (Hons) degree in Visual Effects and Motion Graphics, prior to this she studied Diploma in Creative Media Production, with a Subsidiary in Art and Design, Interactive Media. Leila is passionate about creativity and realism in art, she love the satisfaction of creating something that looks good and knowing that she did that herself. She is very proud to be working in the creative industries, although it can be hard work, it is very rewarding. Gemma McAdam is all things audio. Having recently changed career from music teacher to sound recordist / designer, she has managed to achieve a fair amount in a short space of time. She completed her first feature film as sound mixer in 2018, ‘Christmas in The Highlands’ which was aired on the ‘Christmas 24’ channel in December 2019. Gemma’s work as a sound designer for the short film ‘Piano Man’ (Written and Directed by Lee Cooper) was nominated for ‘Best Sound’ at the HB Film Festival in 2019. She loves how much sound affects a story line and is probably the worst person to sit next to in the cinema as she will explain why the music is so important. Meet our Costume Designer Vivienne Low! Over the years she has worked on a wild variety of Films, Short films, Music videos, TV commercials and Stills Shoots working with actors including Kevin McKidd and Gerald Butler. She likes to support local small businesses and Scottish companies and she works with a number of charities to make her Costume Department as ethical and sustainable as possible.  She is also a coordinator for Fashion Revolution Scotland and she's a volunteer stylist at Smartworks Edinburgh. Àdhamh Ó Broin is a Gael of mixed Highland and Irish descent and grew up in Cowal, Argyll, Scotland.He is a writer, musician and language activist specialising in the revival of endangered Gaelic dialects as well as working as a cultural consultant for film & TV - probably best known for his role over the last seven years as Scottish Gaelic Consultant to Sony Pictures “Outlander” for which he won the International Contribution to Gaelic Award in 2016.Àdhamh is keen to ensure that our take on Gaelic language, lore and lifeway are as authentic as possible on “Origins” and has already been in the thick of some fascinating discussions with our writers and producers.We are absolutely thrilled to welcome him on board as our Gaelic Consultant and can’t wait to see the fruits of this collaboration as we bring to life the denizens of the Otherworld!“The more I hear about the Origins universe, the more excited I become. This series not only has real potential as superb entertainment for audiences worldwide; it could also serve as a fantastic portal for young Scots keen to find out more about the language, culture and mythology of the land they call home.”Meghan Grieve joins the team in the art department. Meghan is a graduate from the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland where she obtained a BA in Production Arts and Design specialising in Set and Costume Design in 2018. Since then she has freelanced within the Film and Tv Industry working for companies BBC, SFTN, In a Big Country Films and BarryCrerar working on all kinds of big and small productions as an Art Department Assistant, Art Director and Production Designer. For our 60 second teaser trailer we hired Scottish actresses Karen Bartke, Shannon Davidson and Helen Cuinn to provide their vocal talent, combined with Leila's visual effects design, Gemma's sound design and Isaac's thumping score, to produce a quality teaser to help build support and an audience for our series.Right now entertainment has never been more important. A reason for all of us to get together, remotely or in person. Something to celebrate, to talk about, to enjoy and be a part of. With your help we can hire some amazingly talented freelance creatives to work on a project when their current work has all but disappeared because of the situation we find ourselves in. With this pre-production development phase we can get the ball well and truly rolling on "Origins", to present it to the world and have a real chance of finding the right people to invest in our story and series. There's no guarantee we'll be able to reach our goal and without support and funding, we can't hire our team to do their job. A project like this is a gigantic undertaken and you can't put a pin on how long things will take but right now we can write the pilot episode, start the pre-production process and get it in the right shape to present it to investors. Without you, there is no series. Just spread the word, let the world know what we're doing. Share our IndieGoGo campaign on social media, with your friends and family. The more people who know what we're trying to do, the more chance we have of hitting our goal.Thank you.Alia Kelton concept art by David FergussonThe Nuckelavee monster design by David Fergusson

story:
What is The GLORY HOLE? 

The GLORY HOLE is a gleefully twisted, often raunchy and completely irreverent experimental late night cable access "comedy" television series from the mind of controversial and award-winning San Francisco independent filmmaker, artist and author Dave O'Shea, best known for his disturbing and acclaimed 2012 cult-horror feature DAY JOB.  And while The GLORY HOLE is technically a comedy program, there are plenty of horrific themes and imagery throughout--and for those paying close attention, you'll find timely (and timeless..?) social commentary sprinkled in throughout the madness. . . but we try our best not to get too heavy-handed with it.

In The Beginning . . .

The GLORY HOLE began in the Spring of 2017 as a create a 20 minute talk show project for a college television production course that creator O'Shea was enrolled in.  After taking some creative liberties with the format, said assignment became the Pilot Episode for the series and eventually led to the gang producing 12 additional and increasingly adventurous episodes, and it has now been on the air for over 2 years in the San Francisco Bay Area (and counting!)

PS-When you have some time to burn, you can watch the Pilot Episode below.  The DVD will feature the Uncensored  version for your perving, I mean, VIEWING Pleasure.  Enjoy!

WHO is The GLORY HOLE?

Led from behind and sometimes in front of the camera by the aforementioned O'Shea-who writes, produces, directs, animates and edits the series, The GLORY HOLE stars the hilariously deadpan Philip Richardson (a favorite of DAY JOB fans) as a cynical but lovable talk show host and his substance-abusing, telepathic & occasionally homicidal mannequin cohost Ruttegar.  And once in a while the show's ever-aggravated director Tim TruGee and Ruttegar's ex Rebecca show up, when they're not too tired or hungover. 

Ruttegar, Phil and Rebecca give each other some encouragement on set while the crew sets up the next shot

Each episode is Enthusiastically introduced by another key player, our voluptuous and versatile Announcer Ed Gory as Wink Woolery--a down on his luck former 1980s game show host trying desperately to claw his way back from of obscurity.  Some notable guest stars from Season One include genuine '90s Scream Queen Debra Lamb(!!), future superstar Jazmine Carter, Daniel "DJ Danny Delorean" Imani, fellow San Francisco independent filmmaker Cassandra Sechler and some old friends from local campy horror show Creepy Kofy Movietime, Balrok Del Cavo, Victoria Privates and Melissa LaRoue among many others!

There are a handful of lovable and unlovable recurring characters who pop up every now and then to keep viewers on their toes, too, like the show-within-the-show's sexy and incredibly unstable (to put it politely) producer Monkey Girl, then there's washed up/fed up wrestling superstar Dick Biter and a mysterious Superhero character known only as the Running Man who embarks on a 12-episode long adventure running full speed All across the globe.. but WHY?  You'll have to keep your eyes on the clues all the way through until the Explosive Season Finale!  Talk about a climax!!

Monkey Girl keeps an eye on things from The GLORY HOLE control room in Episode 2

Bringing the show to life on the production side has involved a revolving door of underpaid but over-loved college students, friends and production assistants, most consistently in ever-loyal DAY JOB alumni Dell Manantan and resident technical wizard Daniel Sannebeck. 

It's a small but dedicated group who together have put in countless hours, days, weeks and months into helping bring the series to life!  And with YOUR HELP, all involved who haven't moved away or been murdered yet, will return for a bigger and BETTER Season 2 with LOTS of returning AND New guest stars, plus some Crazy next-level storylines!

'90s cartoon heartthrobs Run & Stumpy sit down for an Enlightening interview, Summer 2018

And Now Some "FUN" FACTS!

What The GLORY HOLE is:

  • Satirical and unapologetically subversive (look it up) sketch-comedy mixed with subtle to not-so-subtle social commentary and unforgettably bizarre regulars and guests, plus inappropriate Adults-Only animated segments, low-rent superheroes and a heavy dose of gleeful chaos sprinkled in for good measure 
  • Unpredictable, constantly evolving episode to episode and Always Uncensored
  • Low, and we mean LOW Budget, so don't expect blockbuster production values. But we'd like to think we make up for it with originality, wit, beauty and charm
  • Similar in tone to what you might stumble across at 4am on ADULT SWIM with the spirit of early SNL or MR. SHOW w/ Bob and David, just with none of the TV network budget. And with more monkeys in bikinis and mannequin sex.
  • A surprisingly intelligent and thought-provoking comedy program disguised as an incredibly stupid comedy program.  And sometimes it can feel like a fever-dream 

What THE GLORY HOLE is NOT:

  • An actual glory hole
  • For the closed-minded, the pretentious or the hypersensitive
  • Recommended for children under 17 years of age due to the sometimes naughty subject matter, nudity and occasional foul language/violence
  • Meant to be taken seriously or personally (the title or the show) 

Creator Dave O'Shea calls The GLORY HOLE "the most creatively satisfying project I've worked on thus far," adding, "I wasn't really looking to make a television series, but once I knew I had the freedom to make it whatever I wanted with no censorship and no rules, no one to impress or need approval from, it just clicked and I ran with it.  Luckily, I have some amazing friends and performer acquaintances who've been brave enough to help bring it all to life with me.  Hopefully we'll get to make another season because it's a hell of a lot of fun."

(L-R) O'Shea, Philip Richardson, Ruttegar in the back, Daniel Imani (aka-DJ Danny Delorean), Scream Queen Debra Lamb and Tim TruGee after shooting the Pilot Episode in front of the television production class.  Fun Fact: The 'Best Of..' Episode #7 was also filmed in front of the class, keep your ears dialed in to occasionally hear Actual studio audience reactions.

The PLAN(s)

We're hoping to raise a MINIMUM of $5000 to cover both the Season One 2-DVD production and manufacturing costs (which will take up the first $1000-1500) AND to fund even the most bare-bones 2nd Season!  Officially, we're asking for $5000 but IDEALLY we're hoping to raise $10,000 or More to help us truly UP our Game and make the 2nd season as AMAZING as it possibly can be!! YOU can help make this happen.  Yes, YOU!!

Chris Reynolds first hearing about The GLORY HOLE on Chabot College TV in 2017.  Soon after, he came on board to play the voice of Rebecca and later, The Artist

Why We Need YOUR Help

Believe it or not, we're not exactly what you'd call independently wealthy (we know, we know.. Shocking!).  Miraculously, we were able to pull off a pretty impressive first season using only the pocket change we dug out from between O'Shea's couch cushions, but in order to produce the DVDs and get back into production, we do need an actual budget. 

Not to pull the curtain back too far, but as all truly independent filmmakers know, this style of self-funded guerrilla filmmaking, even with some of the amazing performers and resources we have had access to, does quickly become financially crippling.  So rather than pull the plug on it all, we're hoping YOU'll help us afford to get on life support long enough to crank out some more of the unique Glory Hole magic you've come to expect! 

How Will the Funds be Used?

To be clear, EVERY DOLLAR raised will go directly into the show.  We're not trying to get you to pay our rent or anything, we have actual day jobs for that, don't worry.

After the DVDs are manufactured, funds will go towards paying the actors and crew who have had to work for less than peanuts in the past (bless their hearts) but that cannot go on; some of our equipment is on the brink of death and will need to be repaired and/or replaced before we can properly return to full-on production; equipment rentals are needed on occasion as well, plus costumes/wardrobe, art supplies, paying 'professionals' to assist from time to time, renting locations when necessary, all these things require money, so the reality is . . .

As always, host Phil  hits us with the wisdom

What If the Goal isn't Met?

This is always the risk in crowdfunding, but we will definitely make it worth EVERY contributor's while.  If you order the DVDs, you're going to get DVDs.  Worst case, they may not end up having as fancy a packaging as we'd hoped, but you will get them. Order a T-Shirt or coloring books or anything else on our perks list, you'll get them as well. 

The reality is we are going to make the best of whatever fate has in store for us, if that means all we get to do is produce the Season 1 DVDs, that's okay!  If we raise an amount that surpasses the DVD production costs but doesn't necessarily warrant us shooting a full 2nd season of the show, then we'll take whatever we raise and use it all on the upcoming Bonus Episode. 

We're the eternal optimists over here and just want to create the best possible product for you fans and supporters (and for US), so we assure you every dollar raised will go directly into making sure that happens!!  All that said, we truly WOULD like to meet at least our minimum goal so everyone can get the most bang for their BUCK! 

Our Track Record

The GLORY HOLE's creator Dave O'Shea has over 15 years experience in underground/independent filmmaking.  His first project, the self-funded microbudget 2012 horror film DAY JOB took well over four years to shoot, eventually screening at multiple film festivals, earning overwhelmingly positive reviews and winning multiple awards.  

(photo credit: Blossom McCoy) O'Shea in his fancy Sunday Best

He also wrote and illustrated a controversial ADULT coloring book called Billy and the Easter Bunny's Adventures Through the Alphabet which was briefly co-distributed by the mighty Last Gasp Books--It's one of the Contributor Perks on here as well!  When there's time, he dabbles in fine art/painting, has produced numerous short films and his work has aired on local television and has had numerous film festival and other screenings.

The point is, he knows how to create something out of nothing and can stretch a dollar like few others can.  The struggle and the creativity go hand in hand but if you've followed his 'career' at all, one thing is undeniable: he refuses to compromise or repeat himself, and The GLORY HOLE is a testament to this.  The last 'new' episode wrapped nearly a full year ago, so with all this time away from production, his pent-up creative juices are ready to EXPLODE ALL OVER YOUR FACES! 

In other words, STAY TUNED and as always, Expect the Unexpected . . . and BRING A TOWEL!!

Our own Crackhead Princess and Super Scary Witch (Cassandra Sechler) get ready for their close-ups at Dream For Dead Cats Productions Headquarters, 2017 

The Contributor PERKS

We really tried to give you as many options as possible with these contributor perk packages. You can simply pre-order the DVDs or add on a plethora of additional goodies, ranging from PROPS used in the show, Personalized Original ARTWORK, T-Shirts, naughty pictures of Monkey Girl, Posters, and even Producer packages where you'll receive an IMDB credit and get invited to come watch us record the studio portion of the Bonus Episode! **NOTE: We cannot pay for your travel  or hotel arrangements, you'll have to get yourself here on your own

Ruttegar outside San Francisco's gorgeous Palace of Fine Arts posing with some of his biggest fans from the Philippines! He can't wait to meet you!!

Also, everyone who donates $20 or more will see their name in the SPECIAL THANKS credits at the end of the upcoming Bonus Episode. PLUS you'll receive a link to watch that episode BEFORE it Airs!  And ALL contributors, big or small, will get a one time SHOUT OUT on our official Social Media pages (instagram & twitter @diabloshea, facebook.com/GloryHoleTV).  And you can always let us know if you'd like to remain anonymous, too. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have spare money laying around to donate right now?  We COMPLETELY understand, and Below are a handful of easy and 100% FREE ways you can still help us reach our goal(s)!! 

  • SHARE this Campaign with Anyone and EVERYONE you think might be into what we're doing! Email it, Text it, anyway you you can help us get the word out! 
  • POST the link to this campaign on All your social media, use the hashtags #GloryHoleTV and #SupportIndieFilm to help direct others to our cause!
  • Follow @diabloshea on instagram & twitter, 'Like' facebook.com/GloryHoleTV and Subscribe to youtube.com/diabloshea! 
  • Like, Comment and Share posts and Campaign Videos, Retweet related tweets, follow and Like posts/tweets using the hashtag #GloryHoleTV! 
  • For a low-visibility project like The GLORY HOLE, your Word of Mouth could make a HUGE impact. And it'll cost you NOTHING!! The price is Right!

While, admittedly, The GLORY HOLE is a supremely sarcastic show, we'd like to SINCERELY thank each and every one of you who even bothered to read through this.  We truly hope you'll consider donating whatever you feel comfortable with, hopefully there's a Contributor Perk package that feels right for YOU! WE APPRECIATE YOU!!

Ruttegar and Phil rehearsing their synchronized dance routines before the studio audience arrives

PS - Feel free to message us with any questions or concerns you may have at theGloryHoleTV@gmail.com and we'll get back to you ASAP

THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU!!!
