Thanks, 
Gen
 
Le partage, c'est primordial ! 

Wow ! Tu trouves que la série a l'air géniale ? T'as envie de m'encourager ? Le problème c'est que t'as pas d'argent à donner ? Je te comprends donc ! Ma devise : c'est avec des PARTAGE qu'on aide à financer une série web. Je le prendrais comme une chaleureuse et très encourageante tape dans le dos ! Merci à toi !
Au plaisir !
Geneviève
 
LE PROJET
 

Credit photo : https://www.pinterest.ca/pin/129900770489622804
 
 
DESCRIPTION DES PERSONNAGES
 
ALEXANDRA MARTEL
Qu’on l’aime ou on la déteste, Alexandra ne laisse personne indifférent.
Alexandra ne cherche pas l'attention, mais l'attire grâce à son charisme qu'elle ne contrôle pas. Elle cherche le consensus puis s'adapte à la majorité. Le jugement des autres et le conflit sont les choses qui la terrorisent le plus. Elle aimerait parfois disparaître, mais la flamboyance de sa personnalité l'en empêche. Après son agression, Alexandra se met des brassières de sport, porte des jeans coupe homme ou des shorts de basket et des hoodies qui couvrent ses formes. Lorsqu'elle s'entraîne avec Gugu ou qu'elle fait face à Sam, Alexandra est forte, confiante dans son regard comme dans sa démarche. Elle parle peu, mais lorsqu'elle le fait, c'est pour affirmer ses opinions ou se faire comprendre clairement.
 
DEREK PAIEMENT
Le loup sous des airs de biche
Derek est très intelligent. C’est un fils à maman, il a toujours obtenu ce qu’il voulait en usant de ses charmes. C’est pourquoi il trouve particulièrement difficile qu’Alexandra lui résiste. Il accorde beaucoup d’attention à ce que pensent les autres de lui et s’inquiète de sa réputation sur les réseaux sociaux. Il poursuit ses études en biologie médicale pour obtenir l’approbation et l’amour de son père médecin, mais ses attitudes de playboy à tatoo l’empêchent d’arriver à ses fins.
 
SAM McARTHUR
C'est un rock, une force tranquille
Sam Sugiyama est d'origine japonaise, il n'a que quelques amis, tous triés sur le volet. Il est la stabilité même. Il aime que les choses soient bien faites et dans l'ordre. Il est économe et peut sembler rigide, mais, en réalité, tous ses actes sont réfléchis. C'est un homme doux et patient qui aime son prochain. Il est d'une grande force morale et un grand sensible. Sa relation avec Alexandra est très compliquée étant donné qu'il est policier et que malgré tout l'amour qu'il porte à sa colocataire, elle ne cesse de défier la loi pour laquelle il a beaucoup de respect.
 
GABRIELLA PELLETIER
Un cliché à réinventer
Gabriella est une vlogueuse très populaire pour ses tutos de maquillage. Elle est excellente dans ses études, en PR et dans tout ce qu'elle entreprend. Elle a une apparence soignée et passe beaucoup de temps à parfaire son image sur les réseaux sociaux. Malgré tout, son estime d'elle reste fragile et elle n'est jamais à l'abris de décevoir son entourage qui est particulièrement exigeant envers elle. Elle n'aime pas le côté désinvolte et libéré d'Alexandra et devient particulièrement compétitive lorsque son amoureux Derek démontre de l'intérêt envers elle. 
 
GUSTAVE LAROUCHE-DUBOIS (Gugu)
Une main de velour dans un gant de fer
On appelle Gustave Larouche-Dubois « Gugu », mais il déteste ça. Il est propriétaire du gymnase « Le Ring des Géants » depuis que son père, boxeur de profession, lui ait laissé la business après sa mort. Ouvertement homosexuel, il a souvent été victime d'intimidation. Il en porte encore les traces. Il n'a pas d'amoureux mais fait beaucoup de rencontres à caractère uniquement sexuel. Il a une tendance à la mélancolie et emprunte des véhicules de fuite (alcool, drogues, sexe, etc.) pour faire taire ses angoisses. Il tente de convaincre Alexandra de cesser de se battre ou de vouloir se venger... mais il a lui aussi un secret.
 
LE TRAITEMENT CINÉMATOGRAPHIQUE
 
LA PHOTOGRAPHIE
Je veux illustrer l'univers des démons qui hantent le coeur d'Alexandra par des scènes aux couleurs chaudes, avec des néons, des closes up et une caméra majoritairement à l'épaule. Je veux ensuite opposer cet univers sombre avec ses scènes calmes aux couleurs neutres et aux plans fixes. 

Credit photo : https://www.pinterest.ca/pin/129900770488662392
 
L’UNIVERS DES 4 F | Fear | Fight | Flight | Fuck
Pour se débarrasser de ses angoisses en suivant la prescription des 4F, Alexandra fréquentera plusieurs lieux et personnes louches, dont le « Ring des Géants », un centre d'entraînement de boxe dans un sous-sol sombre dont les murs sont éclairés par des néons de couleurs chaudes. La bâtisse historique est située près de l'université d'Alexandra. Sa clientèle est composée majoritairement de réfugiés de différents pays et de membres de groupes aux activités illégales.

Credit photo : https://www.pinterest.ca/pin/129900770488662432/
 
L'APPARTEMENT D'ALEXANDRA
C'est un coquet petit 4 1/2 sur le plateau Mont-Royal où Alexandra habite avec Gilles depuis le CEGEP. La chambre d'Alexandra est toujours en bordel tandis que le reste de l'appartement est rangé et gardé d'une propreté impeccable par son colocataire. 

 
L'UNIVERSITÉ
Comme c'est le cas à l'université de Montréal, l'environnement extérieur vert et luxuriant fait contraste avec le beige triste des salles de classe.

 
LES EFFETS VISUELS
Pour se rapprocher du personnage d'Alexandra particulièrement lors de ses moments d'angoisses, je veux, par moment, accrocher une caméra sur elle comme dans le vidéoclip de To Lo - Habits (Stay High) : https://youtu.be/oh2LWWORoiM

 
COSTUMES AND ACCESSORIES 
Grâce au département artistique, je veux créer des archétypes. Des personnages à la fois crédibles, mais fascinants par leur côté légèrement décalé ou excentrique.

Credit photo : https://www.pinterest.ca/pin/129900770488685552
 
LE RYTHME ET LE MONTAGE
Pour mieux confronter les univers du film et pour créer autant de surprises que d'émotions vives, je veux alterner entre le rythme rapide (jump cut) de la comédie et des moments poignants au ralenti.

Credit photo https://blogsofalek.wordpress.com/2014/09/27/fe...
 
LE TRAITEMENT SONORE
Tout en laissant des moments de calme, parfois habillés seulement de drones d'ambiance, je veux suivre les différents « moods » d'Alexandra avec des chansons aux mélodies parfois techno, parfois mélodramatique, calquées sur celles qu'elle pourrait écouter presqu'en permanence dans ses écouteurs lorsqu'elle s'entraîne, se déplace ou plane sur une substance. 
 
 
LA SCÉNARISTE & RÉALISATRICE
Geneviève Sauvé | www.lilithfilms.com
La force de Geneviève réside dans sa capacité à créer du contenu autant humoristique que bouleversant grâce sa manière unique de générer de l’émotion en combinant les sons et les images de manière innovante. Ses deux derniers films « Le service » et « Dire » ont reçu plusieurs distinctions dont un Award of Excellence du Scandinavian International Film Festival et un Award of Excellence dans la catégorie Best Woman Filmaker de la Best Short Competition en Californie. Geneviève a aussi complété la formation de L’inis en Réalisation Télévision et a reçu récemment une bourse du Conseil des Arts du Canada pour la production du court métrage « Still Untitled / Encore sans titre ».

story:
When Sydney finds her mother's old diary filled with clues about her biological father, she decides to run away from home to find something that she has always been missing.

Easy Street is a coming of age story, that deals with themes like: finding your identity, and what are you willing to leave behind for an idea.

Along the story, we follow Sydney's journey as well as other character's journeys. We meet her little sister Sam, her classmate Aiden and her music teacher Mr. Berry, and how their stories are tangled with Sydney's.

DIRECTOR, Associate producer - Jeffrey Schimmer

Jeffrey Schimmer is a director and producer based in New York. He has worked on various projects, from web series like Antwand Pearman Vs The Interview to short films like Love 77 and The Breakup. He was educated in New York, holding a Bachelors in Film and Media Studies from Hunter College. He is excited to join the team behind Easy Street as the director and associate producer.

 

DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY - Michael Jonson

Born on Camp Pendleton and raised in Denver, Toronto, London, Abilene, and Thumrait; Michael has always been inspired by stories found when traveling around the world. An avid reader and cat lover, he currently freelances as a cinematographer in Southern California.

 

ART DIRECTOR, Associate producer - Seera Rytkölä

Seera Rytkölä is a multidisciplinary designer. She has over 10years of experience working in professional feature film, TV and social media advertising projects as a freelance visual creative. Her favourite project so far has been designing and creating a visual identity (an opening sequence and motion graphics) for a reality TV series Adoption Stories produced by Warner Bros / Eyeworks Finland.

Fav road trip: From Brisbane to Blue Mountains via Sydney in Australia.

 

"SYDNEY", Producer, Writer - Eevi Rola

I am a fine arts student at the New York Film Academy (NYFA) and currently based in Los Angeles. My homeland of Finland has provided me with the utmost love and admiration for all things artistic, as both of my parents are artists themselves. I have a passion towards story telling in all forms, like writing and acting. 

 

Aiden (Mar Sudac), Sydney (Eevi Rola), Sam (Helena Claussen), Mr. Berry (Chris Arellano)

All the money that we fundraise by crowdfunding will be used in the production. Most of our budget goes to locations, but also on permits and insurance since everyone's safety is the most important thing what comes to working on a film set. 

Other parts of the money will be used on the following:

 

We have amazing perks for all kinds of supporters. You can pick them based on how much you wish to help. All kind of help is very much appreciated.

Our perks include:

- Ceramic artist Johanna Rytkölä's (www.rytkola.fi) art work

- Digital poster signed by the cast and crew

- Digital copy of original pilot score

- Early bird link to the pilot episode

and other small goodies! mmm...

Sharing is caring! Go check out our Facebook page and spread the word about our project. Use the hashtag #easystreetseries to find out more about us.

If you have any questions, I promise to answer them personally! Just email easystreet.series@gmail.com.

Thank you!

 

Eevi's website: www.eevir.com

Eevi's instagram: @eevi.r

story:
After becoming pregnant and engaged, a drug cartel heiress plans to leave the game as the DEA and a psychotic hitman closes in on her. As the drama of everything begins to unravel around her, she realizes that her family will do anything to take the fortune that she inherited. This drama is a compelling coming of age story that shows how evil people can become for the love of money. 

The actors on this project are very talented and just as passionate about taking this story from paper to screen as I am. We have already completed one episode, it be watched on our Youtube Channel (Peculiar Productions Films). With a three-season run in mind, we have 20 plus more episodes to film.

We need your help to make this series a reality! Below is a breakdown of where contributions will go and more information about who we are and how you can help out. Every little bit counts!

Why donate?

This project provides opportunity for upcoming actors and actresses in Mississippi and other Southeast states to exercise their craft and network among other likeminded creators. With your contributions, we can make this series a reality and encourage other young Mississippians to keep pursuing their dreams.

Campaign Goal: $25,000

·       30 Shoot days

·       15 + locations

·       24 episodes

Funds will go to:

Pre-Production:  Props/Wardrobe,  Location Securing

Production: Food, Equipment Rentals, COVID-19 Safety Procedures and supplies

Postproduction: Marketing, Graphics, Festival Fees, Editing, Sound, Mixing, and Soundtrack

Other Ways You Can Help

·       Subscribe to our YouTube Channel and Share! Peculiar Productions Films

·       Spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, Instagrm, and Pintrest.

·       Use the Indiegogo share tools and let your friends know about this project!

Meet the Cast & Crew

Vanesha Chanta "Harris" (MiMi, Writer & Director)

Vanesha Harris, stage name, Vanesha Chanta is 26 years old and a native of Beauregard, MS. She has been a creative since she can remember. She has been writing since she could read and write. She creates her own beats and writes her own songs. She loves video editing and writing scripts. Her goal as a writer is to create compelling stories with strong female lead characters. Her passion is to provide acting opportunities to actors and build a community of creatives in Mississippi. She has been acting professionally for 4 years in plays, commercials, and short films. Her most notable role was being cast as Janelle Monae's stunt double in the thriller film "Antebellum", that is currently streaming on most platforms.  You can follow her on Facebook (Vanesha Chanta) & Instagram (@VaneshaChanta).

Avery Herron (Director of Photography, Assistant Director)

Avery Herron is a native of Jackson, MS. There he is a Master Artist, perfecting his craft in photography, graphic design, and videography. He has been the Director of Photography of numerous short films and music videos that can be found on YouTube (Peculiar Productions Films).  You can follow him on Instagram (@textuallyactive).

 

Fred Davis (Kevin)

 Fred Davis is a native of Jackson, MS. He is the youngest of three siblings which all have graduated in the JPS school system. Fred recently was lead male actor in a short film titled "Smile", that was written and directed by Julia Dent in Madison, MS. Another lead role is in a short film, "Men Too: A domestic violence story" where he portrayed a husband who is being abused by his wife. He can also be seen on NCIS: New Orleans Season 6 Episode 13. He has worked on many commercials, as well. You can follow him on Instagram (@fred_partee_davis).

Avery Xavier (Roger)

Avery Xavier is an occasional actor. He has performed in many plays, such as Well Worth The Wait, Diamond in a Rough and the First Star.  He has also done small roles in shorts films and films such as Men too, Betting the Overlay, Get it on Jones, Women of the Movement and is currently a background for A Day To Die that’s in production. Avery is a actor that adapts to his environment and roles he play. You can follow him on Instagram (@officially_a.p).

Cassius Wade (Ice)

 Cassius Wade is from Jackson, Mississippi. He is 6’3 230 lbs, an active actor, model, and Personal Trainer. He loves to create and be a part of stories by portraying characters to the best of his ability to help the project reach its greatest potential. Acting has always been a passion of his  and he is ready to reach the highest level that he can possibly reach. You can follow him on Instagram (@man_of_steelcw) and subscribe to his YouTube channel (Cassius Wade),

Kobe Singleton (Freight)

Kobe Singleton's music journey began during his early childhood in his Mississippi church where he impressively performed solos and directed ensembles. He began studying various genres of music, such as R&B and Jazz and writing songs that combined both with gospel. He developed a love and respect for greats such as: Marvin Gay, Nina Simone, Donnie Hathaway, John Coltrane, and Miles Davis.Following graduation from Tougaloo, Kobe traveled to Japan, where he lived for some years focusing solely on his music. Kobe departed Japan and made Los Angeles, California his home.  Shortly after relocating, he released the Love Is project. Kobe Singleton's most recently released songs are "When I Lie" and "The Struggle" both co-produced by Singleton and Ric "Rude" Lewis. "The Struggle" appears on the movie soundtrack Soul Damage to be released in 2017.  Both "When I Lie" and "The Struggle" are available on iTunes. You can follow him on Instagram (@kobekdsingleton).

Lohn Lenoir (Jay)

Lohn Lenoir has always been attached to the entertainment world. It is his first love and will be his last. Be consistent, be focused, and be ready. You can follow him on Instagram (@actorlohn).

Lewis Hines (Money)

Lewis Hines is a Jackson, Mississippi native and a 2019 graduate of  Belhaven University in Jackson, Mississippi where he earned his Bachelor of Arts in Theatre. He is an actor, a dancer, and a member of the Alpha Psi Omega Theatre Honor Society. Throughout his career, he has acted in plays, musicals, and in front of the camera;  a dancer, he is familiar with hip-hop, jazz, ballet, waltz, swing, and tap. You can follow him on Instagram (@southside_misfit).

Derrick Jones (Myron)

Derrick "Joaon Keyesa" Jones is 27 years old married with one child from Greenwood, Mississippi. He is the baby on his mom's side of the family and the second oldest on his dad's side of the family. He graduated from Hinds Community College in 2012 with a Welding and Fabricating Certificate with a 4.0 GPA . He is currently pursuing an acting career earning his first acting role with Writer Director and Producer Vanesha Chanta in a series "Blood Thicker Than Water”. You can follow him on Instagram (@derrickjonesofficial_).

Other ways you can contribute

Are you able to donate or lend equipment, locations, or a special skill? Are you an actor? Are you a video editor? Musician? Amazing animator? Talented cinematographer or gaffer? Hair and makeup artist? Love operating boom mics or cameras? Can donate food and/or volunteer to cook? We would love for you to join our team! Send us an email at peculiarproductions12@gmail.com.

Thank you so much for your support!
story_txt: After becoming pregnant and engaged, a drug cartel heiress plans to leave the game as the DEA and a psychotic hitman closes in on her. As the drama of everything begins to unravel around her, she realizes that her family will do anything to take the fortune that she inherited. This drama is a compelling coming of age story that shows how evil people can become for the love of money. The actors on this project are very talented and just as passionate about taking this story from paper to screen as I am. We have already completed one episode, it be watched on our Youtube Channel (Peculiar Productions Films). With a three-season run in mind, we have 20 plus more episodes to film.We need your help to make this series a reality! Below is a breakdown of where contributions will go and more information about who we are and how you can help out. Every little bit counts!Why donate?This project provides opportunity for upcoming actors and actresses in Mississippi and other Southeast states to exercise their craft and network among other likeminded creators. With your contributions, we can make this series a reality and encourage other young Mississippians to keep pursuing their dreams.Campaign Goal: $25,000·       30 Shoot days·       15 + locations·       24 episodesFunds will go to:Pre-Production:  Props/Wardrobe,  Location SecuringProduction: Food, Equipment Rentals, COVID-19 Safety Procedures and suppliesPostproduction: Marketing, Graphics, Festival Fees, Editing, Sound, Mixing, and SoundtrackOther Ways You Can Help·       Subscribe to our YouTube Channel and Share! Peculiar Productions Films·       Spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, Instagrm, and Pintrest.·       Use the Indiegogo share tools and let your friends know about this project!Meet the Cast & CrewVanesha Chanta "Harris" (MiMi, Writer & Director)Vanesha Harris, stage name, Vanesha Chanta is 26 years old and a native of Beauregard, MS. She has been a creative since she can remember. She has been writing since she could read and write. She creates her own beats and writes her own songs. She loves video editing and writing scripts. Her goal as a writer is to create compelling stories with strong female lead characters. Her passion is to provide acting opportunities to actors and build a community of creatives in Mississippi. She has been acting professionally for 4 years in plays, commercials, and short films. Her most notable role was being cast as Janelle Monae's stunt double in the thriller film "Antebellum", that is currently streaming on most platforms.  You can follow her on Facebook (Vanesha Chanta) & Instagram (@VaneshaChanta).Avery Herron (Director of Photography, Assistant Director)Avery Herron is a native of Jackson, MS. There he is a Master Artist, perfecting his craft in photography, graphic design, and videography. He has been the Director of Photography of numerous short films and music videos that can be found on YouTube (Peculiar Productions Films).  You can follow him on Instagram (@textuallyactive). Fred Davis (Kevin) Fred Davis is a native of Jackson, MS. He is the youngest of three siblings which all have graduated in the JPS school system. Fred recently was lead male actor in a short film titled "Smile", that was written and directed by Julia Dent in Madison, MS. Another lead role is in a short film, "Men Too: A domestic violence story" where he portrayed a husband who is being abused by his wife. He can also be seen on NCIS: New Orleans Season 6 Episode 13. He has worked on many commercials, as well. You can follow him on Instagram (@fred_partee_davis).Avery Xavier (Roger)Avery Xavier is an occasional actor. He has performed in many plays, such as Well Worth The Wait, Diamond in a Rough and the First Star.  He has also done small roles in shorts films and films such as Men too, Betting the Overlay, Get it on Jones, Women of the Movement and is currently a background for A Day To Die that’s in production. Avery is a actor that adapts to his environment and roles he play. You can follow him on Instagram (@officially_a.p).Cassius Wade (Ice) Cassius Wade is from Jackson, Mississippi. He is 6’3 230 lbs, an active actor, model, and Personal Trainer. He loves to create and be a part of stories by portraying characters to the best of his ability to help the project reach its greatest potential. Acting has always been a passion of his  and he is ready to reach the highest level that he can possibly reach. You can follow him on Instagram (@man_of_steelcw) and subscribe to his YouTube channel (Cassius Wade),Kobe Singleton (Freight)Kobe Singleton's music journey began during his early childhood in his Mississippi church where he impressively performed solos and directed ensembles. He began studying various genres of music, such as R&B and Jazz and writing songs that combined both with gospel. He developed a love and respect for greats such as: Marvin Gay, Nina Simone, Donnie Hathaway, John Coltrane, and Miles Davis.Following graduation from Tougaloo, Kobe traveled to Japan, where he lived for some years focusing solely on his music. Kobe departed Japan and made Los Angeles, California his home.  Shortly after relocating, he released the Love Is project. Kobe Singleton's most recently released songs are "When I Lie" and "The Struggle" both co-produced by Singleton and Ric "Rude" Lewis. "The Struggle" appears on the movie soundtrack Soul Damage to be released in 2017.  Both "When I Lie" and "The Struggle" are available on iTunes. You can follow him on Instagram (@kobekdsingleton).Lohn Lenoir (Jay)Lohn Lenoir has always been attached to the entertainment world. It is his first love and will be his last. Be consistent, be focused, and be ready. You can follow him on Instagram (@actorlohn).Lewis Hines (Money)Lewis Hines is a Jackson, Mississippi native and a 2019 graduate of  Belhaven University in Jackson, Mississippi where he earned his Bachelor of Arts in Theatre. He is an actor, a dancer, and a member of the Alpha Psi Omega Theatre Honor Society. Throughout his career, he has acted in plays, musicals, and in front of the camera;  a dancer, he is familiar with hip-hop, jazz, ballet, waltz, swing, and tap. You can follow him on Instagram (@southside_misfit).Derrick Jones (Myron)Derrick "Joaon Keyesa" Jones is 27 years old married with one child from Greenwood, Mississippi. He is the baby on his mom's side of the family and the second oldest on his dad's side of the family. He graduated from Hinds Community College in 2012 with a Welding and Fabricating Certificate with a 4.0 GPA . He is currently pursuing an acting career earning his first acting role with Writer Director and Producer Vanesha Chanta in a series "Blood Thicker Than Water”. You can follow him on Instagram (@derrickjonesofficial_).Other ways you can contributeAre you able to donate or lend equipment, locations, or a special skill? Are you an actor? Are you a video editor? Musician? Amazing animator? Talented cinematographer or gaffer? Hair and makeup artist? Love operating boom mics or cameras? Can donate food and/or volunteer to cook? We would love for you to join our team! Send us an email at peculiarproductions12@gmail.com.Thank you so much for your support!

story:
SYNOPSIS

Winston Prey has garnered the support from citizens of Detroit as the city's District Attorney, and now is in the race to become the next Mayor. As he gets deeper into the world of politics, he realizes he has the support of the elite, who can almost guarantee a victory; but that comes with some strings attached. He finds that the ills devastating urban communities are seeded from the top, a world where you must PREY or be PREYED upon. He’s awakened to this new world where even his wife and close associates may not be who he thought they were in the name of greed. He falls prey to a few unsuspecting events, affording him a ticket to his new reality of deception, corruption, polluted water, organ trafficking, murder, and more. His goal to clean up the city may be immeasurable, especially since he's become a part of the problem.

TIMELINE:

Prey's 4 episodes for the season crowdfunding campaign will run for 60 days. During this time we'll be in pre-production. We're looking to roll out the newest episodes in the fall/winter of 2017. The first four episodes can be seen on Anthony Cuffie's youtube channel, and or visit www.anthonycuffie.com.

Where does the money go!

Risks & Challenges

  • We're competing against a saturated market of shows, some with big budgets (the machine)
  • Independent companies/projects have to take on the the arduous chores that big production houses  are able to budget accordingly

We're entering the first phase of crowdfunding to complete season one, but we intend to initiate a second phase ($50,000), which would incorporate a stronger marketing campaign, and be able to hire in more experienced personnel to assist in combating all risk and hazards. Our immediate plan is to continue to send out press releases for more press, utilizing social media, and to submit the web series to various film festivals to promote the series.  

Updates for Contributers:

We will periodically post pre and post production updates. If it's possible, we'd like you to send us a picture of you with one of the perks, so we can highlight and brag on our contributors. Our entire camp would like to thank you in advance.

What We Need & What You Get 

We need a minimum of $25,000 to ensure season one is productive. The primary objective is to be syndicated by a nationally acclaimed network. If not, the secondary notion will be to establish a major presence on the web, producing commercials, and place client products throughout episodes as a means to establish financial independence to pay all of the personnel involved in the production. 

With your contributions,  you can receive a range of nice gifts and opportunities ranging from an autographed romance novel titled Retraced, written and autographed by Anthony Cuffie to autograph posters. You may also receive t-shirts highlighting the web series' poster, series credit,  plaques, and more.

Retraced (fiction novel) by Anthony Cuffie

The Creator

Executive Producer/Writer/Director/Editor

After completing his first novel in 2004, Anthony Cuffie received major acclaim and was featured in the national magazine 'Rolling Out,' along with his music partner, Wilmonie Page. The two produced an accompanying soulful soundtrack. The soundtrack was produced to give readers a movie experience through literature and music, because making movies was always his end goal. His friend, a former member of Puff Daddy's Bad Boy regime, Loon, advised him to forget the traditional means of entering the film industry and to just write and produce his own movie in spite of limited funds. It was this advice that led him to complete feature and short films on micro budgets in 2009 and 2010, which unfortunately fostered many roadblocks. Cuffie is a self taught artist who graduated in Business from Ferris State University, later completed the Dov S-S Simens Film School and Detroit Film Center to polish his filmmaking skills. Since his inception into the world of movies, he's worked on many movie sets, and local productions. Cuffie has recently been interviewed for his first drama series title Prey, which is gaining national attention. He currently has several productions in pre-production, preparing for his next move in becoming a nationally acclaimed filmmaker.

 

PRODUCERS:

MARVIN MUHAMMAD (Producer and Co-Writer)..began his writing career in 2001 as a songwriter for a local Detroit Music Production team called “The Foes” along with Lorenzo “Lowekey” Woods and Joshua Woods AKA Ashton Woods of Get Right Recording Studio. As a producer and songwriter, Marvin collaborated and worked with numerous local rappers, singers, and musicians from Hip-Hop, R& B, Neo-Soul, Jazz and more. Some of his most intriguing song productions were recorded with local Detroit Neo-Soul and R&B artist Wilmonie, Hip-hop duo Ken Lowe “Cardier” and Cassanova and also Hip-Hop solo artist OMB with whom they formed the short lived rap duo “Grumpy Old Men”. In 2010, Marvin left the music scene and entered the film and television field. He then joined forces with the renowned author and director Anthony Cuffie as co-writer of a short film called “Five Loaves of Bread”. After completion of their first film, they both began working on separate projects. In 2016, they rejoined forces again to work on Anthony Cuffie’s web series project that is currently appearing on You-Tube called Prey. Marvin serves as co-writer and co-producer of Prey.

Arthur Cartwright is an actor and producer, known for roles in Gran Torino (2008), Vanishing on 7th Street (2010) and Scars (2015).

 

Darrin Christopher Cuffie, affectionately called "CC", was raised in the capital of the "Motown Sound" Detroit, MI.  In the early part of January 2002 he embarked on forming his own production company called BeatHouse Music Group. Fate, destiny or whatever you would like to call it came knocking and he began to pursue music as a passion. To date he has toured as one of the lead singers for the national award winning Gospel group Brent Jones & TP Mobb. He has sang and performed on various stages from the BET Live stage with the MObb to the Tonight Show with various national recording acts such as Enrique Iglesias, Coolio and others.

With Cuffie's growing desire to learn more about our political system due to systemic issues that are perpetual within urban areas all over America, it prompted him to want to write about the particulars like who benefited? Why? Conspiracy theories were ignited and became the seed for him to write a series concerning those very issues, thus the birth of PREY, this exciting new drama series.

 
Even if you can't squeeze a few pennies for a donation, you can still help us spread the word! Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, anywhere you hang online. Every bit makes a difference!
 

Promotional Pictures:

story:
Short Summary

"You're Doing Great!" is a dramatization of the events surrounding the death of Sharon Spell's parents. It evolved from being a one-person live show to writing a fully realized pilot. Earlier this year, Sharon and her producing team took the next step by filming pages from the pilot to turn into a sizzle reel for pitching to networks and media outlets.

What does "You're Doing Great!" mean?

While Sharon and her siblings faced their parents end of life care, they began to use this catch phrase with one another, "You're doing great!" In reality, they were not doing so great. Saying this was an ironic way to call out their misery, which made them laugh. It was that humor they shared that gave them all comfort during the most challenging of emotional times.

This is a personal story that a lot of people can relate to: feelings of not fitting in, dreams deferred, personal loss and grief. But no matter what, always know that You're Doing Great!

 

CAST

Sharon Steele: Sharon Spell (Adam Ruins Everything [truTV], Moth StorySLAM Winner, Carolines on Broadway, UCB Theatre). @sharonspell

Stuart Steele: Jonathan Gregg (High Maintenance [HBO], Ray Donovan [SHOWTIME]). @jgregg_jonathan

Samuel Steele: Brian Faas (Broad City [Comedy Central], Best Week Ever [vh1], UCB Theatre, Page Six). @brian_faas

Susan Steele: Kendall Ketcham (Nationally touring comedian, opener for Darrell Hammond). @kendallketchum

The Auditioner: Ray Cordova (Astronomy Club, UCB Theatre, Sad Mariage). @rayciist

Toni Brashton: Sandi Marx (The Moth, RISK!, The Fableist). @sandimarx

Reece Barr: Garry N. Hannon (Mysteries at the Museum [Travel Channel], The Real Queens of Kings County, Bears of Comedy). @garry2rs

Druncan Hinds: Darell J. Hunt (@noontnoont)

Amorie Gerald: Tahlia Robinson (Piccolo Spoleto Festival, NY Comedy Music Festival, Hidden Fences, All Female Reboot, Dirty Little Secrets Improv NYC, Gas Station Horror Improv). @tahliasworld

Gerald Gerald: Jed Resnik (BATSU! No Sleep ’til Madison). @jedresnik

With special appearances by:
Benjamin Jones & Marian Rosin

CREW

Director: Jorja Hudson (Low Budget Sketch Show, CH2, Funny or Die, Elite Daily, Bustle, Internet Action Force and Jomey Productions). @jorjasmic

Director of Photography: Andy Zou (www.andyzou.com). @yoandyzou

Producer: Ashley Sather (Myrtle & Willoughby, UCB Digital, Gingham). @ashleysather

Assistant Director: Brittany Tomkin (Myrtle & Willoughby). @brittacus

Sound: Keaton Hild, Nico Osborne.

Art Director: Emily Hoffman (SNL, Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt, The Americans, Myrtle & Willoughby, Low Budget Sketch Show). @emilyhughston

Video Editor: Carina Jollie (Funny or Die, Mas Major, The Chris Gethard Show, IFC Comedy Crib, UCB Digital). @cjollie11

Filmed on location at Metropolitan Bar in Williamsburg, FOU Studios in Astoria and Major World Service Department in Astoria. @metropolitanBK, @foustudios, @majorworld

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are asking for $8,200 .  This number is made up of a variety of needs from throughout the pre- and post-production process of this project.  This includes things like:  Crew, Transportation, craft services, and editing and color correcting of our awesome sizzle reel.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, the funding collected will be put toward the total costs. Every little bit helps.

 

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • In early 2019 I began this project- from writing the spec script to sourcing cast and finally through filming and post-production. While I have invested several thousand dollars into this project, your contribution will get us over the finish-line. Film making is a multi-step process and we have completed two thirds of this project in pre-production and filming. What is left is the post-production and launch of the sizzle reel onto the main stage.  This funding will offset the additional out-of-pocket costs and, more importantly, create the ability to fine-tune the details- for example, color correcting, sound mixing, number of edits and the number of festivals we can submit to.  

Risks & Challenges

  • The biggest risk is funding comes short and we are not able to properly execute the finishing of this project.  While we have begun the editing process, we would have to cut out some steps to the reel.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share this campaign and get it trending!  Share on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter.
  • Do an old-fashioned email share to your network- every eyeball that sees the campaign increases our success!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

You're Doing Great! #YDGSpell

story:
What is Conrad?

The judicial system is damaged. The incarceration rate has skyrocketed astronomically in the past four decades, while women still fight for equal pay. The perception of "fairness" is skewed and often based on money or political power - many times not based on skill, generally discrediting women based on gender has led to the pay gap and political disadvantage.

Told from a raw standpoint, this is a television pilot is seen from the perspective of Katy Conrad, daughter of late detective Michael Conrad of River Oaks Police Department. 

Katy finds herself struggling in a fight with the judicial system to prove her father's case, in a male dominant police department, making waves little by little, becoming a symbol for Women Empowerment. 

The reason behind Michael's death becomes the centerfold of an emotional dark journey of whether or not the former Chief was killed or if, in fact, his death was a suicide. However, during her investigation, Katy begins to discover some unknown truths about herself and what really happened in her past.

What We Need & What You Get

We are almost done with our pilot but there is so much more to do. 

Funding is crucial and in the long run can make or break the production which is why we are asking, YOU, the consumer, to help us out on the unique story of Woman empowerment.  With your donations we have some exciting perks that you are able to win.  Some of these perks include:

  • Shirts and hats for the entire family!
  • Dinner with the Directors
  • MUCH MUCH MORE!

What makes "Conrad" different?

As opposed to making 'just another crime/drama', the creative team wanted to tell the story through the eyes of our main character, Katy Conrad. During her journey, we see how gender inequalities affect the workplace, especially in a police department, where 'fairness' and 'justice' SHOULD prevail. We aim to create awareness for the gender and judicial inequalities that still exist today and are constantly in our news feeds and news papers. 

However, given the challenges described, we've created a unique story that our audience can relate to. Katy endures some difficult situations, but it pushes her character to be more relatable, and possibly more mysterious.

"Conrad" was built from the ground up and we wanted to feature a city which is near and dear to our hearts - Chicago, because of it's reputation for being "the working city". 

 

Meet the Team

Ryan Atkins is an independent Cinematographer & Editor with eleven years of experience in the field. He holds an Associate of Applied Science in Digital Media, with a focus in Digital Film and Video Production from Virginia Marti College of Art & Design in Lakewood, Ohio. Previously he took coursework in Television Production from Ashland University and took on several key roles during his time there.  His work is in education, corporate, government agencies, small businesses, and independent motion picture productions, and music videos. Recent clients include Northwestern University, The University of Chicago, Ashland University, Sarpino's Pizzeria, Chicago Fire Dept, Make-a-Wish, and others. He currently serves as Director of Photography & Editor for the 'Conrad' pilot. His guidelines for cinematography, editing, color are very simple: create an image/experience that is memorable, can connect with audiences, and helps advance the story. He is also one of the founders of CONRAD SERIES, LLC.

Jennifer Karum Goodman launched her interest as an actress and spent most of her childhood an adulthood performing in stage plays, musical theatre, commercials and film. She auditioned for Conrad when it was known as "Veronica" an was a 2 page script written by Ryan Atkins. She was cast as Lead Detective, and offered to utilize her writing in effort to expand the script. Within 72 hours she had a full season bible written, a full script for the pilot, and offered to help initiate casting to make the script into a full show. Ryan and Jennifer teamed up in bringing the pilot episode creating what is now, CONRAD. Jennifer is known for a few commercials, a few independent films, including "Samson" (2016), featured scenes in The Break Up (2006), is recognized for her role of "Traci" in the Exchange Series (2016), and played a lawyer in Chicago Fire (2017). She brings strong visions, creativity and passion to Conrad and in effort to help springboard production, she has brought her networks from various sales roles she has, to help create and bring a strong production.  She is also one of the founders of the CONRAD SERIES, LLC. 

Our main cast:

  • Jennifer Goodman
  • John Prosky
  • Shannon Brown
  • Harold Dennis
  • Walt Sloan
  • Brian Barber
  • Trey Waldman

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot donate a monetary amount, there are still other ways you can help our efforts.

  • Sharing our campaign on Facebook and Twitter in groups and on your wall
  • Spreading our campaign via word of mouth to your friends and family
story_txt:
What is Conrad?
The judicial system is damaged. The incarceration rate has skyrocketed astronomically in the past four decades, while women still fight for equal pay. The perception of "fairness" is skewed and often based on money or political power - many times not based on skill, generally discrediting women based on gender has led to the pay gap and political disadvantage.

Told from a raw standpoint, this is a television pilot is seen from the perspective of Katy Conrad, daughter of late detective Michael Conrad of River Oaks Police Department. 
Katy finds herself struggling in a fight with the judicial system to prove her father's case, in a male dominant police department, making waves little by little, becoming a symbol for Women Empowerment. 
The reason behind Michael's death becomes the centerfold of an emotional dark journey of whether or not the former Chief was killed or if, in fact, his death was a suicide. However, during her investigation, Katy begins to discover some unknown truths about herself and what really happened in her past.


What We Need & What You Get
We are almost done with our pilot but there is so much more to do. 
Funding is crucial and in the long run can make or break the production which is why we are asking, YOU, the consumer, to help us out on the unique story of Woman empowerment.  With your donations we have some exciting perks that you are able to win.  Some of these perks include:

Shirts and hats for the entire family!
Dinner with the Directors
MUCH MUCH MORE!

story:
The following teasers will give you a sense of the vision of the project. If it's something you feel connected to, or if you just want to help a friend, peer or family member, please consider a donation of any amount.

Talent from across the country (New Jersey, Washington D.C., Los Angeles, New York, Chicago and more) have signed up to be a part of this project.

Why?

Here are a few reasons why they believe in Broken and you should too:

  • The script for Broken has ranked Top 20 and Top 50 in the nation in separate TV pilot screenwriting contests.
  • The characters challenge the actors to portray them and will challenge you to watch. Fearlessness was a prerequisite for the talent.
  • Broken passes the Bechdel Test (a litmus test for gender equality in film).
  • We strove for and achieved a racially and gender-diverse cast and crew.
  • Broken will showcase spectacular Indiana dunes scenery that most people have never seen.
  • Our script has LGBT characters that are treated just like anyone else.
  • Broken uses an untraditional storytelling model that mixes faux documentary with dramatic scenes.

What they've told us:

  • "It just spoke to me."
  • "One of the best scripts I've read in a long time."
  • "I immediately knew I had to play that role."
  • "I couldn't pass this up."

Why we need your support:

  • TRAVEL/LODGING: Our biggest expense is travel and lodging for our amazing talent. They're worth it!
  • POST PRODUCTION SOUND: Getting a TV-quality sound mix requires experts in that field.
  • MARKETING: Pitching the project to distributors will require some travel and entry fees into special events such as American Film Market and others.

 

The Team

Our principal team members have all worked on feature films, TV commercials, documentaries and more. They are bringing experience to Broken with the goal of generating enough profit to fund future episodes and new projects as well as to provide opportunity for next-generation filmmakers in northwest Indiana. Your donation is taken seriously.

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to funding, we can always use your help to spread the word. Join us on social media to share the journey with your friends, family and peers. We need followers, so like, follow, share, retweet, tag, etc

https://www.facebook.com/brokenepisodic/

https://twitter.com/brokenepisodic

https://www.instagram.com/brokenepisodic/

https://vimeo.com/channels/1244255

@brokenepisodic

#brokenepisodic

brokenepisodic.com

 

Interested in investing with potential ROI instead of donating? Contact us directly at info@brokenepisodic.com.

story:
The Primary Goal

Hey Everyone! My name is Ashley Parchment. I'm from Florida and I moved to Los Angeles four years ago to pursue acting and I'm still trying to get my foot in the door. Not much has happened. This can be really depressing at times.

I decided to stop feeling sorry for myself and get proactive. We creatives can not simply wait for someone to call us in hopes of a booking. We must create our own content and practice our craft on a consistent basis. So, 2019 is the right time to start filming these short scenes.

With your help, I will be able to invest into these weekly scenes all throughout 2019. Without you, I wouldn't be able to afford to film these scenes and they simply would not be possible to make. I truly need your support and I'm forever grateful for whatever you can donate.

Why $5K & What You Get

The $5,000 is for a year of weekly scenes throughout 2019. The money will go towards paying the cinematographers, the editors, renting filming locations, props, etc. With your donation you will see the quality in the filming and the editing.

The cinematographers and editors I will work with all went to college for film. So, not only will you be entertained by the acting scenes every week but the scenes will also look polished because of your donation.

The Impact

The short scenes allow all the creatives on set the chance to consistently practice their craft. This gives us the chance to fine tune our skills and get better! The short scenes will also be used as reel footage for the creatives.

A strong scene in a reel can lead to better representation or lead to one booking a job. Plus, with this going online it may help grow our exposure. Maybe a casting director or agent loves one of the scenes and calls one of the creatives into an audition!

Challenges

This was challenging to make happen because in the beginning of 2018 I didn't have a team to make this happen. So, I was just going to do the scenes with one friend every week using my iPhone. It would have gotten boring very fast. Plus, the filming and editing would've been done by me, which I have no experience in those fields, so it would've looked very rough.

It is still a challenge since I have to coordinate everyone's schedules, choose locations, rehearse multiple times before filming, buy everyone lunch, choose wardrobe, create a shot list, etc. With your donation you will allow the planning/filming process to go much smoother and literally make these scenes come to life!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate at this time (trust me, I'm a struggling actor) I get it. You can help by subscribing to my YouTube channel. My goal is to have 1,000 subscribers. I currently have 85. Also feel free to share this campaign with your friends and family who can donate.

YouTube: https://m.youtube.com/channel/UCYrQor45Jls7ak03...

Thank you for your time! - Ashley Parchment

story:
My Name is MARCUS FOLMAR and I've been acting and writing in Los Angeles for over 20 years (more on me below).  I've had some success as a writer and some success as a actor but this web series is the first time I've ever had a chance to bring my two loves together.  I wanted the show to be DIVERSE and RELATABLE and above all FUNNY but in a way that felt essentially grounded in TRUTH.  When I produced Season 1 of the show and saw how positively people responded to the content I knew that I was on to something and started making plans right away for a second season.   It took some time but we've got season 2 in the can.  We've brought back all your favorite characters and introduced some new ones.   We just need a little help to carry us over the finish line.  

I self financed Alley Way Season 1.  This time around however, I’m not in a position to cover the cost of production in it's entirety on my own.   Nevertheless,  with a personal investment of $5000 and generous donations from a couple close friends and family members totaling the same,  we've already completed principal photography on the entire 10 episode second season!  That’s twelve days of shooting already in the can.  Comic gold.  Now we just need  to raise the funds to cover POST-PRODUCTION and MARKETING. 

WHAT WE NEED - our fundraising goal is $10,000 with which we will...

•PAY OUR EDITOR - editing is a very long, painstaking process.  We shot 92 pages.  That's the equivalent of a feature film!  Sorting all that out requires patience and great attention to detail.  Our editor is a friend of the show and not charging us nearly what he should be.  AND he's already started working on cutting the show between other projects even though I don't yet have anything to give him (the man is a saint).  Once we raise this money,  he'll be able to turn his full attention to Alley Way and we can start cranking out these episodes.  

•PAY OUR COLORIST - We're not shooting on the  fanciest most high tech cameras, but if you look back at Season 1 you'll agree that our show looks pretty damn good.  A lot of the credit for that goes to our COLORIST.  After the show is cut together someone sits down and goes shot by shot making adjustments to  the video to make sure colors and skins tones and lighting looks the best and most consistent as it can.  (Think of how many filters you go through just to post a selfie and multiply that by 100 and that's the workload of a colorist).  Another friend of the show...but he doesn't take monopoly money.  

•PAY OUR COMPOSER -  One of my favorite parts of the creative process during season 1 was developing the sound for ALLEY WAY with our composer Jongnic Bontemps who by the way has composed music for movies like CREED 2 and THE LAND.  I can't express how important music is to giving each episode the punch and the polish that it needs.  

•PROMOTE THE SHOW - One important thing I learned doing Season 1 is how important it is to think about promotion from the beginning of the process versus waiting until the show is done.  To that end, we've shot some things with the intent of cutting them into short promotions for Instagram or Twitter...but the editing and production of these are separate from the post-production budget.  I'd also like to do a launch event/screening to which we can invite social media bloggers and other influencers that can help give the show a nice push out the gate.  Finally, Facebook Ads and Google Ads are a great way to grow your audience...but they add up fast.

WHAT YOU GET... 

I think the best of what you'll get by supporting this campaign is knowing that you've helped manifest something that was crafted with love, joy and passion and by doing so garnered my unyielding gratitude.  Nevertheless, here's a couple things we have planned as tangible expressions of our appreciation... 

NEW PERKS JUST ADDED (Check Perks Side Bar For Details ) ------------------->>

ALLEY CATS (donors of $25 or more) in appreciation of you rocking with us we'll let the world know we rock with you via a ShoutOut on all our Social Media platforms and you will receive a preview link to the first episode a week before it goes live to the public! 

BERNIE'S BOOSTERS (donors of $100 or more) Come celebrate with us! You and a guest are invited to attend our Launch Party and Screening which will be held in Los Angeles on a TBD date in July.  Drinks and hors d’oeuvres will be provided. Invite will be sent at least two weeks prior to the event to the email  provided with this donation.  For those not in Los Angeles, or unable to attend our premiere event, you will receive a private link so that like our party attendees, you'll get an advanced peek at our first three episodes before they go live to the public!

ALLEY WAY BLOCK CLUB (donors of $500 or more) get the Party Invite and the ShoutOut as well our season 2 movie poster autographed by the cast.  

ALLEY WAY RIDE or DIES ($1000 or more) we'll honor your generous donation with all the other perks in addition to an on screen credit of Co-Executive Producer for one of our season 2 episodes.  

MORE ON MARCUS...

Marcus started his career in entertainment  thirty years ago as a child in Denver, CO where he booked his first network television role on NBC’s Father Dowling Mysteries. Marcus attended Northwestern University in Evanston, IL where he majored in Radio, Television and Film Production and Acting.  In addition to his honors production degree, he received a certificate for the successful completion of The School of Communication’s Writing for the Media program.

A working actor in Los Angeles since ’99 and a private audition coach since ’05 (www.bookingroomLA.com) Marcus is Co-President of the NUEA, West an affinity group of Northwestern University that works to bring together NU alumni in entertainment here in Southern California. Upon his arrival in L.A., roles on shows such as Frasier, Malcolm in the Middle, ER and Monk soon followed. More recently, Marcus worked on I'm Dying Up Here, Ballers and Santa Clarita Diet and freshman comedy The Kids Are Alright.    On the commercial side, Marcus has booked nearly two dozen national spots and is currently dancing his way into the hearts of America in a Xfinity campaign with company spokesperson Amy Poehler.  In all, Marcus has appeared in over 70 TV shows, films and commercials. 

 As a writer,  Marcus' romantic comedy The List was produced in 2006 and played at  numerous film festivals domestically and internationally before being nationally broadcast as an ABC Family original movie 2007.  Starring Wayne Brady, Sydney Tamiia Poitier, Flex Alexander, Ileana Douglas, Brad Dourif and Malcolm Jamal Warner,  the film went on to be nominated for three NAACP Image Awards including one for Best TV Movie.  

BOTTOM LINE...

Please remember EVERY DOLLAR COUNTS!  And even if you can't lend financial support, you can still help by sharing this campaign on your Facebook, Instagram or Twitter.  And by doing the same with the episodes when they are released.  Thanks in advance!  If you haven’t checked out Alley Way season 1 yet now is the time to binge watch (alleywayseries.com) and we’ll see you soon for the premiere of season 2.

Upon his arrival in L.A., roles on shows such as Frasier, Malcolm in the Middle, ER and Monk soon followed. More recently, Marcus worked on I'm Dying Up Here, Ballers and Santa Clarita Diet and freshman comedy The Kids Are Alright.    On the commercial side, Marcus has booked nearly two dozen national spots and is currently dancing his way into the hearts of America in a Xfinity campaign with company spokesperson Amy Poehler.  In all, Marcus has appeared in over 70 TV shows, films and commercials.  As a writer,  Marcus' romantic comedy The List was produced in 2006 and played at  numerous film festivals domestically and internationally before being nationally broadcast as an ABC Family original movie 2007.  Starring Wayne Brady, Sydney Tamiia Poitier, Flex Alexander, Ileana Douglas, Brad Dourif and Malcolm Jamal Warner,  the film went on to be nominated for three NAACP Image Awards including one for Best TV Movie.  BOTTOM LINE...Please remember EVERY DOLLAR COUNTS!  And even if you can't lend financial support, you can still help by sharing this campaign on your Facebook, Instagram or Twitter.  And by doing the same with the episodes when they are released.  Thanks in advance!  If you haven’t checked out Alley Way season 1 yet now is the time to binge watch (alleywayseries.com) and we’ll see you soon for the premiere of season 2.

story:
Hello! My name is Peter Navy Tuiasosopo. I am proud to introduce to you a new television series that my team and I working hard to develop and produce called, SOUTH PACIFIC STYLE with (myself) Peter Navy Tuiasosopo as your host.

Our plan is to take you on an adventure through the Pacific Islands which are ripe with history and bold adventure. We’ll take you from island to island, as we explore together all the magical wonders and island attractions that make these special places so pure and untouched. Imagine visiting islands like Tonga, Tahiti, Fiji, Papua New Guinea, American Samoa and New Zealand; not only to experience their gorgeous colorful reefs, turquoise lagoons, and Gin-clear water. But having an opportunity to learn and appreciate their wide range of cultures, heritages, beliefs, customs, histories, traditions, and so much more that have developed their islands into some of the most beautiful exotic places in the world.

So, in the great tradition of popular television series’ like Bizarre Foods with Andrew Zimmern, Anthony Bourdain’s: No Reservation, and Expedition Unknown with Josh Gates. We believe that South Pacific Style will bring a fresh added dimension to cultural shows.

That’s why we have come to you for help in raising the appropriate funds to cover the costs of producing the pilot episode As a thank you, we are offering some exciting perks to all our contributors, including a sneak peek at the pilot episode and South Pacific Style branded merchandise.

We don’t take this opportunity lightly at all. Every contribution counts and we are so very humbled and grateful in advance for your participation. So, I hope you will join us in this new adventure throughout the Pacific Islands with me, your host, Peter Navy Tuiasosopo. Thank you all for taking the time to watch our video, and for your participation. God bless.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are seeking 10K to assist in filming Peter interviewing on location and editing the content for the pilot as well as promoting it. The goal of the pilot is to pitch the series to potential producers and sponsors to can make South Pacific Style into a episodic TV or web series.
  • We're excited to show you the perks that we've created for you if you decide to help us with our goal. Clothing with our series logo as well as producer credits.
  • If we aren't able to reach our projected goal, the funds collected are to be used to continue our digital marketing campaign through social hubs, website and help our development team build our pilot presentation.

The Impact

  • Peter has been fortunate to pull together an amazing team that have been dedicated to serving the Pacific communities in worthy causes,  and working with organizations as businesses.
  • People only see the tourist side of many of the Pacific cultures. The purpose of this series is to provide educational content and to promote the indigenous cultures and people of Oceania.

Risks & Challenges

  • A major hurdle for this project is travel. The Pacific is vast and to send a skeleton crew to a remote location for the pilot is not cheap. With our community connections, we are looking at ways to save on getting Peter to these locations and minimizing the equipment used to film so that most of our budget is spent on editing.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are passionate on assisting us in reaching our goals but aren't able to help financially, please promote our campaign on social media and sign up for our enewsletter on our website www.southpacificstyle.com.

story:
Short Summary 

Hi! My name is Jaime Luna, and I'm the creator of Music Schitty.
What is Music Schitty?
Well, it's the amazing team of writers, actors, musicians, and people crazy enough to dedicate themselves to working on Nashville's newest sketch comedy group, "Live from Music Schitty",
 AND a podcast, "Music Schitty" 

The Podcast "Music Schitty"
Our slogan is "To Normalize the Abnormal". We want to uncover the overseen parts of the Nashville community. I'm talking from immigration, to music, to film, from old Nashville to new Nashville. There's multiple underground scenes waiting for their story to be told. 


"Live from Music Schitty"
Our goal is to revive the soul of 80's SNL, with re-occurring characters, crazy off the wall antics, and finding new local talent. Take that and mix in some of poignancy and thought-provoking elements to help show what is really going on in our world today. Who knows? Maybe throw in a couple of laughs here or there. 

What We Need & What You Get

OUR GOAL:
By early 2020, release weekly content via YouTube and our Patreon for a 14 episode season that leads up to a live sketch comedy event followed by a hand picked music show from Nashville's own talent. 

The team has been putting their blood, sweat, tears, and even some of their wallets to help fund what we've got so far, but WE NEED YOUR HELP TO MAKE THE REST HAPPEN. There's been tons of people that have helped us out for peanuts and pennies, and we are eternally grateful, but to make an entire season, we've got to feed some people, shake hands, kiss babies, and on top of all that, pay them for the hard work they've been putting in! 

Now $10,000 may sound like a lot, but with all the amazing ventures and concepts we'd like to explore, we're still going to have to pinch pennies. A lot of our staff will still have to work for free and even throw in some of their own resources, BUT we can at least pay the people that are helping our dream become a reality. 

With $10,000 we can pay for:
-Studio Time to record the Podcast
-Paying Cast and Crew for filming 
-Paying the Editing Team for the hours upon hours of content we're going to be throwing at them
-Feeding the Cast and Crew
-Merch


The Impact

The last thing I want anyone to think about our project is that it is a one-time product. Our goal is to use this crowdfunding, to make content, to get the ad revenue, to be able to make more content, and, from there, either go solo and independent or even pitch this to networks. 

I don't want to say we're a business, because that makes it sound like we don't care about the jokes we make or the stories we tell. What I do want to say is that when you donate money to this project, it is not money you're just giving to a product. It's not just money ending up in a one time campaign. It's you investing in us. Investing in us to make jobs and careers out of what we love to do. 
 

Risks & Challenges

I've been writing stories for about 11 years now, acted for about a year now, directed my first short film earlier this year, lead two writer's room, started recording a podcast, audio production for 3 years, amateur visual artist for 10 years, and I've learned one major thing:

The Entertainment business is a risky business.

That's why I can't do it alone. That's why I have spent so much time finding the right people to help me develop this concept. I've got an amazing group of friends and family that have, can, and will help me showcase all that we have to offer.  

We've been really under the radar because we don't want to start the hype without having anything to hype it up, but I assure you, we have been heavy underway in pre-production for episodes on the podcasts and scripts for sketches (we're currently at sketch #15!!!).

So what's our biggest hurdle?

Getting the money to get the production started!

Pssst.

*whispering*
hey. you. Yeah, You. This is where YOU come in.


Other Ways You Can Help

BROKE AND CAN'T HELP?!

WELL, SPREAD THE WORD!

Tell your family and friends!
Want to get involved and help with production?
Hit us up!
Want to help donate food to our starving artists?
Hit us up!
Want to help us out with whatever you got?
HIT US UP!

And that's all there is to it.
HMU @

Jaime.Luna@musicschitty.com
