story:
Here's the Deal

I’m an entrepreneur...and a mom...and a partner...and a daughter...and a friend...and a thousand other things. I’m exhilarated and exhausted in turn. And I think you might be too. So I wrote a show about it, an audio show, with episodes and everything, plus a newfangled book club to give both you and me more joy for fun, connection, and realness.

It’s called She’s Myself and I think you’re going to LOVE it. It’s about four diverse women business owners who create a cohort to advance their professions. As they confront a myriad of professional and personal challenges, they discover that Aristotle was really onto something, the whole IS greater than the sum of its parts.

It's a Show...

 

15-minutes of entertainment. Just like your favorite TV show, but less of a time commitment. The characters are real (albeit totally fictional) people. It's fun, funny, serious, really serious, damn this is serious and then fun again, just like life, your life, and mine. Available in iTuness and a dedicated website, it's easy and free for everyone!

AND... a New-Fangled Book Club

But wait, there's more. Each episode has a short video about the theme (playing small, trust issues, dreaming big, playing, figuring out who we are and what we offer to the world) and then juicy questions to talk about enhanced by a live video conversation. Jill, the Jill from the video? This is her baby, taking the ideas, playing with them and helping us put them to use. She's the star of the videos and she's running the live chat - I know! And you can take She's Myself and create your own mastermind with your peeps, win/win/win! ‘Cause you know that when we women get together, amazing shit happens.

Here's Where We Are...

We’ve got the scripts for a first season, AMAZING talent (beyond my wildest dreams talent), sound folks, a studio, post-production and we’d love for you, or your business to be involved (how cool is that?).

Here’s more to whet your appetite:

The Characters

Nicole

Nicole’s been told she’s type A, bossy, and full of alpha male energy. It’s true, how else do you become a top family law litigator? But as much as she has achieved, this 40-ish single mother of three teenagers is ready for more. She's not content in her current role. Nicole desires to be the country's preeminent prenup authority - the Suze Orman of marriage.

Nicole measures success in dollars and prestige, neither of which has been hard for her to come by thus far, but her ball-busting lawyer persona is not playing well with the starry eyed hand-holding couples she hopes to woo. Nicole needs help, and for that she turned to Tom Cooper. Tom is a branding and marketing guru who has launched the top names in a myriad of industries. Nicole wants to know what he knows and to use it for her new venture.

Nicole signed up for Tom's mastermind group and has been placed in a cohort with three other women to learn and apply his principles. She’s ready to make the personal and business changes necessary to become the Queen of Prenups. Can the cohort help her? What personal and professional changes are required? And what will the women ask in return?

Lauren

Exuding a warm calm energy Lauren reads as exactly who she is, a mother-earth spiritual guide who has been a mentor to a gaggle of women over the years. Lauren excels one-on-one, but now that her children are grown, she feels a pull toward playing on a bigger stage. What exactly that stage is and what she’d say if she was invited to grace it is unclear.

Attracted to Tom Copper’s teachings on turning a passion into a business, Lauren is in the early stages and she frets that she has nothing to offer to the mastermind. She doesn't yet realize her gift to the group is not business principles, but rather personal ones. As the sage, she pinpoints where the elusive roadblocks lie and how to navigate around them.

Lauren is ready for deeper fulfillment and the validation that comes with helping women let go of the things that bind them and access their inner wisdom and strength. Can she do the same for herself?

Kate

Who doesn’t love Kate? She’s adorable inside and out. A late 20s divorced mother of two little ones, she even has a cool career, the owner of Fowler Theatre. The truth is a bit more convoluted. As a college opera major, she sang at the theatre and did some light management until it fell on hard times. She and her then-husband, Brad, a corporate VP type, bought it. Now that they’ve divorced, she owns the theatre with her ex - yikes.

The hard times with the theatre never really ended and Kate’s been robbing Peter and borrowing from Brad to pay Paul. She’s desperate to make the theatre work but is stressed out, overwhelmed, and overworked, running from kid duty to theatre duty and back again. Musicals, workshops, choruses, acrobats, magicians - what can she bring to the stage to fill the seats and keep the lights on? It’s all very Waiting for Guffman and the glamour stops as soon as you hit backstage.

The Tom Cooper Mastermind was Brad’s suggestion. For Kate, it’s just another reminder of his continued presence in her life but this one comes with a bit of hope. Could there be success, and rest, and options in flipping the script? Can she get enough margin in her life to figure out what she really wants? She has a sneaking suspicion this might not be it.

Darla

Darla’s been underestimated her whole life and as an area manager of Travel US, a national multi-level marketing company (MLM), it continues. Despite the side eye and suspicion an MLM can bring, her company has been good to her, and she has to them. She’s passionate about the travel she sells and even more passionate about her team.

Ready to lend an ear, a hand, or even an apartment full of furniture, Darla’s kind heart is apparent. She’s a momma bear to all. Her husband, Dutch, is a nice enough guy. He's a good father, kind man, but all the hustle resides with Darla and as she strives for the very top of Travel US, she knows she needs something more than what she’s learned thus far, enter Tom Cooper.

Can Darla find the success she's looking for in her current position? What is she willing to sacrifice for success? And what old paradigms are standing in her way?

Our Talented Talent

Tricia Gilfone, Producer, Voice of Lauren

Tricia Gilfone is Chief Creative Officer and Co-CEO of JoyTri Productions. A versatile artist and performer, Tricia has over 20 years experience in the entertainment business including work in Theater, Television, Film, and Radio. A graduate of the Visual and Performing Arts High School, and New York’s American Academy of Dramatic Arts, Tricia has studied with some of the master teachers in her craft, including renowned casting director, author and teacher, Michael Shurtleff, who accepted her into his master class as the youngest attending student, and more recently, Larry Moss.

A native of St. Louis, Missouri, Tricia relocated to Los Angeles to expand her work in different areas of the business including voiceover, sketch, and puppetry. Her credits include work with: NBC, Hallmark, Lifetime, Disney Corporation, Days of our Lives, and iHeart Radio, among many others. Her latest accomplishments include associate producing Media Access Awards, dedicated to the accurate portrayal and employment of people with disabilities in all media; co-creating and producing web content for Disney Online Interactions; as well as her own scripted comedic series Assistant Living.  Keeping her skills strong, Tricia has returned to Film school to get her degree in Cinema Production / Producing. Tricia produced her latest feature film Silver Skies alongside seasoned TV/Film Director and Writer, Rosemary Rodriguez starring a veteran cast of George Hamilton, Valerie Perrine, Barbara Bain.

Kimberly Stanpill, Voice of Kate

Kimberly has embraced the world of entertainment, acting and singing in theater, TV, and film. With experience ranging from Shakespeare, Tennessee Williams, and Gilbert & Sullivan to "The OC", "Gilmore Girls," "Veronica Mars" and "Days of Our Lives," she continues to hone her skills, pushing the envelope at every opportunity. Recently, she was on Lifetime's "Twin Betrayal", "The Last Bid" with Casper Van Dien, and she'll be appearing in "Witness Protection" next year.  Recent film projects include "Locating Silver Lake" with Finn Wittrock and "Airplane Mode" with Logan Paul.  

Kimberly has lent her talents, both on-camera and voice-over, to commercial, PSA, and video game work for Gain detergent, the Avon Breast Cancer Walk, and Sony PlayStation, among many others—as well as Live-Announcing at gala fundraising events, introducing hosts such as John Lithgow, Jason Alexander, Mandy Patinkin, and the Duchess of Sussex when she was simply known as Meghan Markle.  

She's enjoyed playing Texas spitfire Margo Jones in the World Theatrical Premiere of "Kowalski," and still enjoys improvising with different groups around Los Angeles. Kimberly has been fortunate to work with producers and directors like McG, Doug Liman, and Guy Norman Bee, and train with Anthony Meindl, Kimberly Jentzen, Todd Stashwick, and Bob Bergen (the voice of Porky Pig), to name a few. At present, she's working with Governors Patrika Darbo and Bob Bergen as an Executive Committee member for the Performers Peer Group of the TV Academy.

Quinn Ljoka, Voice of Darla

Quinn Ljoka graduated from UCLA with a degree in history and a passion for children’s TV. As the production coordinator on the new Nickelodeon show “Rocko's Modern Life,” she met Doug Lawrence ( the voice of Plankton on Sponge Bob) who created a character for her called “Quinn The Judge” and her voiceover career began. Since that time she has been the voice of characters for TV shows and video games all around the world like “Jessie” for ClayKids, from Spain, “Smarta” of Smarta and her Magic Bag, from Russia, and all of the characters for the pilot episode of an Indian style “Dora The Explorer” called “Bommi and Friends.” Quinn’s TV and radio clients include Abbott Labs, AMEX, Bank Of America, Cheerios, Colace, Costco, FORD, Goodwill, Hasbro, Hatfield Meats, Intel, Marvel, Netflix, Penn Medicine, Planned Parenthood, Samsung, Tyson Chicken, Walmart, and Xfinity. Her personal projects keep life interesting. “Mary Margaret and Friends” is a series of vignettes using puppets to teach proper pronunciation at elementary school level French and Spanish. A series of stories book about my her dog called“A Dog Named Dave” and a show she created for PBS kids, called “Fuzzy E.A.R.S. ( Emergency Animal Rescue Center) about a vet and her family, and her son’s animal whisperer best friend Mary, who communicates with the injured pets, set in the Pacific Northwest.

Emily Chase Smith, Creator, Writer, Executive Producer, Voice of Nicole

Emily Chase Smith is the creator, writer, and executive producer of She’s Myself. She’s also created and written Expats, a TV show about a mother of 3 who convinces her husband to move the family to Prague where they discover the truth of the old adage, wherever you go, there you are. She’s also co-created and co-authored Prenups, a TV show about a law firm Witkin Osborn Wisse Miller, where the lawyers are in the business of relationships but have no idea how to have them--at least they’re hilarious. She’s also authored and ghostwritten 16 books published by Harvard Business Publishing, Career Press, Morgan James, and Greenleaf Publishing. She’s a licensed attorney living in Orange County, California, with her three children, dog and a garage so full of bikes, surfboards, and paddleboards that she has to park outside.

Andrew Coughlin, Videographer

The talented Andrew - "I was adopted from South Korea as a baby, grew up in Kansas City, but now live in Los Angeles. Ever since my early teens, film production has been an interest and passion of mine. I was fascinated with the entire process, especially the production phase. But, I wouldn’t really know this until a high school internship on Oscar winner Ang Lee’s film Ride With The Devil. It was at that point that I knew filmmaking was something I wanted to do, and each film I’ve made has been a learning experience, and I’m looking forward to making more."

Episode Sneak Peek...

Pilot - The Mastermind

The four women meet, but not before Kate discovers she has significant history with Nicole. Lauren mediates. Will the group carry on?

Episode 2 - Pick a Lane

Lauren wants to move from being the helpful friend to speaking on a national stage, but a topic eludes her. Will failure to decide among her myriad of interests stop her before she begins?

Episode 3 - Too Little

Kate is accustomed to working incredibly hard for peanuts, but the women aren’t having it. As she’s on the cusp of thinking and behaving differently, will a hanger-on from the past undo what she’s poised to accomplish?

Episode 4 - Dream Book

Lauren leads the women in making their own dream books to help them visualize and pursue their dreams with a touch of gratitude. Can Nicole take off her legal hat long enough to consider what’s possible?

Episode 5 - Your Game

The real mastermind is the talk between Lauren and Darla before the other two arrive. What would happen if Darla leaned into her own intense wiring instead of what her company teaches?

Episode 6 - A Night Out

Nicole’s hair is down literally and figuratively as the women get to know each other more personally over some truth-telling cocktails.

Episode 7 - Church It Up

Nicole’s masculine energy has served her well as a family law litigator,  Will what she’s done in the past take her in the direction she desires for the future?

Episode 8 - The Big Leap

The women examine what’s behind what they do, how they think, how they behave and the results they achieve. Do each of us have a Zone of Genius or is it like hunting jackalope?

Episode 9 - Degrees of Expertise

Now that Lauren’s found a topic she loves, she balks at her qualifications to deliver it despite the encouragement of the group. What makes someone an expert?

Episode 10 - Piecing Together the Whole

Kate puts together an entirely new and innovative plan for the theatre. Does she have what it takes to know her value it while dragging a concrete weight behind her?

Episode 11 - Linking Arms

Darla delves into who she is and what she has to offer and finds herself chafing against the boundaries of her parent company. Can Darla do her business her way or is it the highway?

Episode 12 - Knowing Me Knowing You

Now that Nicole’s figured out what she wants to say and who she wants to say it to, it’s time to connect with others in the field. Has she run up against the boundaries of her confidence?

Episode 13 - Elasticity for All

Lauren is accustomed to working small and lean, but an opportunity is on the table that appears to be able to dramatically expand her reach in a very short period of time. Is Lauren ready to trust her message with others?

Episode 14 - The Circus is Coming

Kate has said yes to an unprecedented event, one of her dreams, or is it her nightmare? Can she find the difference between accepting help and being dependent?

Episode 15 - Transition

The women know they’re close, just how close becomes apparent when life is turned upside down for one of them.

Episode 16 - What’s Yours is Ours

Darla finds herself pitted against her parent company, the one that made her and the one that she helped make. Is the relationship salvageable and to what extent should Darla, or does she want to, go to save it?

Episode 17 - To Bride or Not to Bride 

Nicole has exciting news, exciting to anyone who isn’t Nicole. How does she see her future, and with who?

Come Join Us

Let's make She's Myself happen for all of us!
story_txt: Here's the DealI’m an entrepreneur...and a mom...and a partner...and a daughter...and a friend...and a thousand other things. I’m exhilarated and exhausted in turn. And I think you might be too. So I wrote a show about it, an audio show, with episodes and everything, plus a newfangled book club to give both you and me more joy for fun, connection, and realness.It’s called She’s Myself and I think you’re going to LOVE it. It’s about four diverse women business owners who create a cohort to advance their professions. As they confront a myriad of professional and personal challenges, they discover that Aristotle was really onto something, the whole IS greater than the sum of its parts.It's a Show... 15-minutes of entertainment. Just like your favorite TV show, but less of a time commitment. The characters are real (albeit totally fictional) people. It's fun, funny, serious, really serious, damn this is serious and then fun again, just like life, your life, and mine. Available in iTuness and a dedicated website, it's easy and free for everyone!AND... a New-Fangled Book ClubBut wait, there's more. Each episode has a short video about the theme (playing small, trust issues, dreaming big, playing, figuring out who we are and what we offer to the world) and then juicy questions to talk about enhanced by a live video conversation. Jill, the Jill from the video? This is her baby, taking the ideas, playing with them and helping us put them to use. She's the star of the videos and she's running the live chat - I know! And you can take She's Myself and create your own mastermind with your peeps, win/win/win! ‘Cause you know that when we women get together, amazing shit happens.Here's Where We Are...We’ve got the scripts for a first season, AMAZING talent (beyond my wildest dreams talent), sound folks, a studio, post-production and we’d love for you, or your business to be involved (how cool is that?).Here’s more to whet your appetite:The CharactersNicoleNicole’s been told she’s type A, bossy, and full of alpha male energy. It’s true, how else do you become a top family law litigator? But as much as she has achieved, this 40-ish single mother of three teenagers is ready for more. She's not content in her current role. Nicole desires to be the country's preeminent prenup authority - the Suze Orman of marriage.Nicole measures success in dollars and prestige, neither of which has been hard for her to come by thus far, but her ball-busting lawyer persona is not playing well with the starry eyed hand-holding couples she hopes to woo. Nicole needs help, and for that she turned to Tom Cooper. Tom is a branding and marketing guru who has launched the top names in a myriad of industries. Nicole wants to know what he knows and to use it for her new venture.Nicole signed up for Tom's mastermind group and has been placed in a cohort with three other women to learn and apply his principles. She’s ready to make the personal and business changes necessary to become the Queen of Prenups. Can the cohort help her? What personal and professional changes are required? And what will the women ask in return?LaurenExuding a warm calm energy Lauren reads as exactly who she is, a mother-earth spiritual guide who has been a mentor to a gaggle of women over the years. Lauren excels one-on-one, but now that her children are grown, she feels a pull toward playing on a bigger stage. What exactly that stage is and what she’d say if she was invited to grace it is unclear.Attracted to Tom Copper’s teachings on turning a passion into a business, Lauren is in the early stages and she frets that she has nothing to offer to the mastermind. She doesn't yet realize her gift to the group is not business principles, but rather personal ones. As the sage, she pinpoints where the elusive roadblocks lie and how to navigate around them.Lauren is ready for deeper fulfillment and the validation that comes with helping women let go of the things that bind them and access their inner wisdom and strength. Can she do the same for herself?KateWho doesn’t love Kate? She’s adorable inside and out. A late 20s divorced mother of two little ones, she even has a cool career, the owner of Fowler Theatre. The truth is a bit more convoluted. As a college opera major, she sang at the theatre and did some light management until it fell on hard times. She and her then-husband, Brad, a corporate VP type, bought it. Now that they’ve divorced, she owns the theatre with her ex - yikes.The hard times with the theatre never really ended and Kate’s been robbing Peter and borrowing from Brad to pay Paul. She’s desperate to make the theatre work but is stressed out, overwhelmed, and overworked, running from kid duty to theatre duty and back again. Musicals, workshops, choruses, acrobats, magicians - what can she bring to the stage to fill the seats and keep the lights on? It’s all very Waiting for Guffman and the glamour stops as soon as you hit backstage.The Tom Cooper Mastermind was Brad’s suggestion. For Kate, it’s just another reminder of his continued presence in her life but this one comes with a bit of hope. Could there be success, and rest, and options in flipping the script? Can she get enough margin in her life to figure out what she really wants? She has a sneaking suspicion this might not be it.DarlaDarla’s been underestimated her whole life and as an area manager of Travel US, a national multi-level marketing company (MLM), it continues. Despite the side eye and suspicion an MLM can bring, her company has been good to her, and she has to them. She’s passionate about the travel she sells and even more passionate about her team.Ready to lend an ear, a hand, or even an apartment full of furniture, Darla’s kind heart is apparent. She’s a momma bear to all. Her husband, Dutch, is a nice enough guy. He's a good father, kind man, but all the hustle resides with Darla and as she strives for the very top of Travel US, she knows she needs something more than what she’s learned thus far, enter Tom Cooper.Can Darla find the success she's looking for in her current position? What is she willing to sacrifice for success? And what old paradigms are standing in her way?Our Talented TalentTricia Gilfone, Producer, Voice of LaurenTricia Gilfone is Chief Creative Officer and Co-CEO of JoyTri Productions. A versatile artist and performer, Tricia has over 20 years experience in the entertainment business including work in Theater, Television, Film, and Radio. A graduate of the Visual and Performing Arts High School, and New York’s American Academy of Dramatic Arts, Tricia has studied with some of the master teachers in her craft, including renowned casting director, author and teacher, Michael Shurtleff, who accepted her into his master class as the youngest attending student, and more recently, Larry Moss.A native of St. Louis, Missouri, Tricia relocated to Los Angeles to expand her work in different areas of the business including voiceover, sketch, and puppetry. Her credits include work with: NBC, Hallmark, Lifetime, Disney Corporation, Days of our Lives, and iHeart Radio, among many others. Her latest accomplishments include associate producing Media Access Awards, dedicated to the accurate portrayal and employment of people with disabilities in all media; co-creating and producing web content for Disney Online Interactions; as well as her own scripted comedic series Assistant Living.  Keeping her skills strong, Tricia has returned to Film school to get her degree in Cinema Production / Producing. Tricia produced her latest feature film Silver Skies alongside seasoned TV/Film Director and Writer, Rosemary Rodriguez starring a veteran cast of George Hamilton, Valerie Perrine, Barbara Bain.Kimberly Stanpill, Voice of KateKimberly has embraced the world of entertainment, acting and singing in theater, TV, and film. With experience ranging from Shakespeare, Tennessee Williams, and Gilbert & Sullivan to "The OC", "Gilmore Girls," "Veronica Mars" and "Days of Our Lives," she continues to hone her skills, pushing the envelope at every opportunity. Recently, she was on Lifetime's "Twin Betrayal", "The Last Bid" with Casper Van Dien, and she'll be appearing in "Witness Protection" next year.  Recent film projects include "Locating Silver Lake" with Finn Wittrock and "Airplane Mode" with Logan Paul.  Kimberly has lent her talents, both on-camera and voice-over, to commercial, PSA, and video game work for Gain detergent, the Avon Breast Cancer Walk, and Sony PlayStation, among many others—as well as Live-Announcing at gala fundraising events, introducing hosts such as John Lithgow, Jason Alexander, Mandy Patinkin, and the Duchess of Sussex when she was simply known as Meghan Markle.  She's enjoyed playing Texas spitfire Margo Jones in the World Theatrical Premiere of "Kowalski," and still enjoys improvising with different groups around Los Angeles. Kimberly has been fortunate to work with producers and directors like McG, Doug Liman, and Guy Norman Bee, and train with Anthony Meindl, Kimberly Jentzen, Todd Stashwick, and Bob Bergen (the voice of Porky Pig), to name a few. At present, she's working with Governors Patrika Darbo and Bob Bergen as an Executive Committee member for the Performers Peer Group of the TV Academy.Quinn Ljoka, Voice of DarlaQuinn Ljoka graduated from UCLA with a degree in history and a passion for children’s TV. As the production coordinator on the new Nickelodeon show “Rocko's Modern Life,” she met Doug Lawrence ( the voice of Plankton on Sponge Bob) who created a character for her called “Quinn The Judge” and her voiceover career began. Since that time she has been the voice of characters for TV shows and video games all around the world like “Jessie” for ClayKids, from Spain, “Smarta” of Smarta and her Magic Bag, from Russia, and all of the characters for the pilot episode of an Indian style “Dora The Explorer” called “Bommi and Friends.” Quinn’s TV and radio clients include Abbott Labs, AMEX, Bank Of America, Cheerios, Colace, Costco, FORD, Goodwill, Hasbro, Hatfield Meats, Intel, Marvel, Netflix, Penn Medicine, Planned Parenthood, Samsung, Tyson Chicken, Walmart, and Xfinity. Her personal projects keep life interesting. “Mary Margaret and Friends” is a series of vignettes using puppets to teach proper pronunciation at elementary school level French and Spanish. A series of stories book about my her dog called“A Dog Named Dave” and a show she created for PBS kids, called “Fuzzy E.A.R.S. ( Emergency Animal Rescue Center) about a vet and her family, and her son’s animal whisperer best friend Mary, who communicates with the injured pets, set in the Pacific Northwest.Emily Chase Smith, Creator, Writer, Executive Producer, Voice of NicoleEmily Chase Smith is the creator, writer, and executive producer of She’s Myself. She’s also created and written Expats, a TV show about a mother of 3 who convinces her husband to move the family to Prague where they discover the truth of the old adage, wherever you go, there you are. She’s also co-created and co-authored Prenups, a TV show about a law firm Witkin Osborn Wisse Miller, where the lawyers are in the business of relationships but have no idea how to have them--at least they’re hilarious. She’s also authored and ghostwritten 16 books published by Harvard Business Publishing, Career Press, Morgan James, and Greenleaf Publishing. She’s a licensed attorney living in Orange County, California, with her three children, dog and a garage so full of bikes, surfboards, and paddleboards that she has to park outside.Andrew Coughlin, VideographerThe talented Andrew - "I was adopted from South Korea as a baby, grew up in Kansas City, but now live in Los Angeles. Ever since my early teens, film production has been an interest and passion of mine. I was fascinated with the entire process, especially the production phase. But, I wouldn’t really know this until a high school internship on Oscar winner Ang Lee’s film Ride With The Devil. It was at that point that I knew filmmaking was something I wanted to do, and each film I’ve made has been a learning experience, and I’m looking forward to making more."Episode Sneak Peek...Pilot - The MastermindThe four women meet, but not before Kate discovers she has significant history with Nicole. Lauren mediates. Will the group carry on?Episode 2 - Pick a LaneLauren wants to move from being the helpful friend to speaking on a national stage, but a topic eludes her. Will failure to decide among her myriad of interests stop her before she begins?Episode 3 - Too LittleKate is accustomed to working incredibly hard for peanuts, but the women aren’t having it. As she’s on the cusp of thinking and behaving differently, will a hanger-on from the past undo what she’s poised to accomplish?Episode 4 - Dream BookLauren leads the women in making their own dream books to help them visualize and pursue their dreams with a touch of gratitude. Can Nicole take off her legal hat long enough to consider what’s possible?Episode 5 - Your GameThe real mastermind is the talk between Lauren and Darla before the other two arrive. What would happen if Darla leaned into her own intense wiring instead of what her company teaches?Episode 6 - A Night OutNicole’s hair is down literally and figuratively as the women get to know each other more personally over some truth-telling cocktails.Episode 7 - Church It UpNicole’s masculine energy has served her well as a family law litigator,  Will what she’s done in the past take her in the direction she desires for the future?Episode 8 - The Big LeapThe women examine what’s behind what they do, how they think, how they behave and the results they achieve. Do each of us have a Zone of Genius or is it like hunting jackalope?Episode 9 - Degrees of ExpertiseNow that Lauren’s found a topic she loves, she balks at her qualifications to deliver it despite the encouragement of the group. What makes someone an expert?Episode 10 - Piecing Together the WholeKate puts together an entirely new and innovative plan for the theatre. Does she have what it takes to know her value it while dragging a concrete weight behind her?Episode 11 - Linking ArmsDarla delves into who she is and what she has to offer and finds herself chafing against the boundaries of her parent company. Can Darla do her business her way or is it the highway?Episode 12 - Knowing Me Knowing YouNow that Nicole’s figured out what she wants to say and who she wants to say it to, it’s time to connect with others in the field. Has she run up against the boundaries of her confidence?Episode 13 - Elasticity for AllLauren is accustomed to working small and lean, but an opportunity is on the table that appears to be able to dramatically expand her reach in a very short period of time. Is Lauren ready to trust her message with others?Episode 14 - The Circus is ComingKate has said yes to an unprecedented event, one of her dreams, or is it her nightmare? Can she find the difference between accepting help and being dependent?Episode 15 - TransitionThe women know they’re close, just how close becomes apparent when life is turned upside down for one of them.Episode 16 - What’s Yours is OursDarla finds herself pitted against her parent company, the one that made her and the one that she helped make. Is the relationship salvageable and to what extent should Darla, or does she want to, go to save it?Episode 17 - To Bride or Not to Bride Nicole has exciting news, exciting to anyone who isn’t Nicole. How does she see her future, and with who?Come Join UsLet's make She's Myself happen for all of us!

story:
How did “City of Strangers” come to be?

from Writer & Director Kaitlin Obien

Early 2020, COVID-19 hit New York City. The quarantine felt suffocating. It was the first time that I actually sat down with my thoughts. Was I mad? Was I thankful for the time where I could be by myself and actually think? Wasn’t sure about either of these. On Easter Sunday at midnight, I decided to re-watch a showcase that I did at my conservatory. The story was centered around a girl who met a boy on the subway, losing each other, and then finding each other at the end. I always used to go into rehearsal thinking of all the stories of the people on the subway. I sat up in my apartment and thought “What better time to write this, then now?”

That night I had written the first draft of the pilot. By the end of the week, I had finished 5 episodes. The next week, I had the first draft of the entire first season. 

During this writing time, I called a bunch of my friends to just read the script outloud, to help with my writing, and it completely changed the game for me- I needed this to come to life.

This story hasn’t just been “something to do” over quarantine, but has been a sense of healing for the actors and my team. To go through quarantine and create art in a different way was a big adjustment for us. 

I wrote about underdogs, because that’s who we mostly are. Constantly trying to climb uphill. I want you to watch this and find yourself, root for yourself, feel uncomfortable and have those conversations. This story is about you. 

 

The Master Plan

This is a 30 minute drama made for a streaming platform. The Pilot is the first one that we need to get on it’s feet so we can keep going! We’re roughly looking at a week shoot for the Pilot in New York City early Spring 2021. Post production (music, editing, sound, coloring, etc.) will be done early summer 2021 and premiering Mid-Late Summer 2021.

 

Our “City of Strangers” Vision

Central park, used books, live jazz music playing so loud that it echoes through the trees, young summer lovers dancing in Bethesda terrace like no one else is there, the golden glow of the lanterns going on one by one as the sun sets… that’s the vision of this story. I want you to feel the nostalgia of young love, the busyness and also the stillness of New York City.

 

Where will your money be going?

Every dollar will go to the making of the Pilot and will faithfully be used to make this the best Pilot possible.

Talented cast and crew generally come at a price (although, our cast and crew genuinely believe in this and have kindly agreed to work for pennies on the dollar.)  However, even artists still need to eat.  Set design, audio and video equipment, transportation, office supplies, etc. all add up. 

Funds raised above and beyond our target will assist in creating more episodes- hopefully to the end of season 1 -- you really don’t want us to end mid season and you never finding out what happens! Gotta give the audience what they want!

 

THE TEAM

 

Kaitlin Obien

DIRECTOR, EXECUTIVE PRODUCER, WRITER

Kaitlin Obien is an independent writer and is making her debut as Director of “City of Strangers”. This is her first collaborative streaming series. She studied American Sign Language Interpretation and  has her Certificate to Interpret, as well as an alumni of American Musical and Dramatic Academy in the Integrated program. In her hometown of Los Angeles, California, Kaitlin has worked on NBC on Craig Robinson’s “Mr. Robinson”, voice overs for Disney, and performances for Universal Studios. 

 

Hanna Rose Hunt

EXECUTIVE PRODUCER / MARKETING MANAGER

Hanna Rose Hunt is honored to be a part of such an amazing series and to work with an incomparable cast and crew. Hanna looks forward to being able to share this story about love and resilience with the world. She graduated from Baylor University with a BFA in Theatre Performance and also studied at the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art in London, England.

 

Paula Figueroa Caunedo

CASTING DIRECTOR

Paula Figueroa Caunedo is ecstatic to be making her casting debut! Although Paula’s resume consists of actor/singer credits, she was also the assistant director of a Florida Thespian Festival mainstage production of Peter & The Starcatcher at the Straz Center for the Performing Arts. Part Boricua/Cubana, part nerd, part artist, part advocate; she loves using her creative energy to bring good ideas to light.

 

Zachary Evan Russell

SCORE

Zachary Evan Russell is absolutely thrilled to be composing the score for City of Strangers! He is a midwestern transplant, now based in Manhattan, and his background includes administration, IT and linguistics. Zachary is an accomplished musician and has been playing, performing, writing and arranging music for well over a decade. He earned his BFA in Musical Theatre and BA in Spanish from Missouri State University in Springfield, MO and his Master's in Translation Studies from Pompeu Fabra University in Barcelona, Spain.

 

Anthony Roman

PRODUCER

Anthony Roman is a young actor that recently graduated from the American Musical and Dramatic Academy NY campus. While there, he became fascinated with learning all the ins and outs that make a show beyond just what you see on screen. After graduation, he began his pursuit to gain more knowledge and know-how to the inner complexities of show business. Anthony is grateful to be apart of the City of Strangers team, and very excited to see how far this project will go!

 

Tatum Zimmerman

PRODUCER / PRODUCTION MANAGER

Tatum Zimmerman (Production Manager/Writing Team) is making her debut on the production side of the camera. This recent Musical Theatre graduate from AMDA is very excited to be working with a stellar team of very talented people. She would like to thank her friends and family for supporting her even in the midst of a pandemic.

story:
Welcome to our Project

Hello everyone and welcome in our project “Beyond All Unreasonable doubt”.

My name’s Antonio Candalice and I’m a young Italian director. I have recently created "Candalice Production", an independent production in my city, Bari. This beautiful Italian city is one of the new centres of the film production in Italy. With the team of my independent production we want to transform ideas and projects in cinematographic reality and promote new artists.

After high school diploma, I studied for two years Directing and Directing of photography at the Film Academy “Amarcord” in Bari. My teachers were Stefano Reali and Raffaele Mertes, two important Italian directors. During this period in the Academy, I produced two short films, “Soapera” (2019) and “How High The Moon” (2020). My first self-produced short film was “Just A Normal Day” (2019), based on feminine stereotypes, that reached over the 100000 views on the social platform. In 2019 I also co-produced the short film “Ci Scappa Il Morto” for a local film festival, “Tagliacorto”.

My first work realized with Candalice Production was “Bureaucardiocracy” (2020), finalist in many Italian and international Film Festival Awards and actually enrolled to the next edition of “David di Donatello”.

Actually we're working to this new project, “Beyond All Unreasonable Doubt”, that it’s going to be realized on May 2021 (if Covid gives us his consent).

The Project

 “Beyond All Unreasonable Doubt” is the pilot of a next TV-series or web series. The plot circles around Zoe Olmi, a famous woman criminologist engaged in a new complicated murder happened in Bari. On the road she meets a strange journalist, Margareth Thompson, that reveals her an uncomfortable truth: Lucusta, a serial killer that Zoe thought she captured few years ago, is still free and he’s back in action. All the Zoe’s certainties are put in crisis and they fall down when she does an incredible strike in Bari.

Why we need your help

We are all in a very difficult moment. Also the big cinematographic industry is suffering the effects of pandemic, especially little independent production that generally produce great masterpieces with small budget.

We trust public is not only a simple passive receiver of a film, but he can be an active participant of a artistic project if he decides to support it.

Your support, then, would allow this pilot to come to life, becoming co-producers. Your support would increase also the chances that this project becomes something bigger.

Budget

To make this project we need €5000, that will be used entirely for the realization of the pilot. This is the list of necessary expenses:

  • Rent for the space for casting;
  • Equipment for shooting;
  • Rent lighting system;
  • Creation of vfx (special effects);
  • Payment of artistic and technical cast;
  • Payment taxes for public areas;
  • Vehicle rental for the transport of equipments;
  • Travel expenses;
  • Security measures to prevent Covid-19;
  • Catering.

Reaching this goals means allowing Candalice Production to grow artistically and become a point of reference for many Italian and non-Italian talented artists.

If you can’t help with monetary contribution, you can support it sharing this campaign on your social account.

Thank you very much for your help.

Short Summary

When I met Clare Solly on Zoom, I knew we had to collaborate. She said, "I'm really only interested in making something about body image." As a newly out non-binary femme tomboy going through menopause, I knew the universe was talking to me through her. "Great," I said. "Perfect."

And so Assigned Female at Birth was born. I posted calls on Facebook to get volunteers for interviews. Little did I know how listening to 32 people-black, brown, trans, non-binary, disabled people, cis women, mothers, daughters, siblings-would change my life. I found out how deeply I needed to grow and how much we all have to learn from the communities whose members have been forced by discrimination to unpack their lives and relationships to their bodies in ways the rest of us haven't imagined.

I truly feel that everything I have done as an activist and an artist is being used in the making of this project. My commitment to stories as meaning, my passion for inclusion, my loneliness as a triple minority outsider, my career in devised theater--which has always involved being a conduit for lives I haven't lived as well as those I have--are all crucial to the building of this project.

And it's amazing to come to understand how a self-loving agender trans man can awaken the people around zir to profound discomfort and love. To see a black lesbian who has just lost her mother try to find a way back to the proud black trans man she loves. To hear the story of a mother raising adopted children who struggle.

And because of the pandemic, this project will be done on line, filmed on Zoom and smart phones, edited and then put up on YouTube. It is an international project to be offered free to viewers. If you want to change the world, this is the project to back. We will reach people in every country. We will say what the interviewees taught me--that our bodies are wise and valuable, wounded and healing, and that we must learn to love our own bodies if we are to love each other. We must step outside the accepted cultural tropes and claim every body as worthwhile.

What We Need & What You Get

Our commitment is to respecting artists, and to this end we offered union contracts to all the actors, which double our budget. What you contribute will go to paying union wages, as well as paying stipends to interviewees, and salaries, to tech experts, directors and crew. We have also bought equipment and sent it to people around the country. Our next biggest expense is marketing of this free series--we want to reach as many people as possible. We recognize that the communities we represent deeply need to be mirrored in order to be welcomed and seen.

The perks we've created are all about involvement. The project is about connection and creativity while we're all more isolated than we've ever been...we don't want gimmicks. We want your heart and we want to include you.

So please do give, do support, do spread the word. We can't do this without you, and we can't make art or change the world without each other.

With deepest gratitude,

Lyralen Kaye, Creator & Director

Caitlin Inglis, Co-Director & Associate Producer

Ritu Chhina, Director of Zoom Photography

Alex Alexander, Development Liaison and Actor

Clare Solly, Associate Producer and Actor

Tina D'Elia, Diversity Consultant and Actor

Nelda Quigley, Development Associate and Actor

Jude Sclarsky, Managing Director and Executive Producer, Another Country
story_txt:
Short Summary
When I met Clare Solly on Zoom, I knew we had to collaborate. She said, "I'm really only interested in making something about body image." As a newly out non-binary femme tomboy going through menopause, I knew the universe was talking to me through her. "Great," I said. "Perfect."
And so Assigned Female at Birth was born. I posted calls on Facebook to get volunteers for interviews. Little did I know how listening to 32 people-black, brown, trans, non-binary, disabled people, cis women, mothers, daughters, siblings-would change my life. I found out how deeply I needed to grow and how much we all have to learn from the communities whose members have been forced by discrimination to unpack their lives and relationships to their bodies in ways the rest of us haven't imagined.
I truly feel that everything I have done as an activist and an artist is being used in the making of this project. My commitment to stories as meaning, my passion for inclusion, my loneliness as a triple minority outsider, my career in devised theater--which has always involved being a conduit for lives I haven't lived as well as those I have--are all crucial to the building of this project.
And it's amazing to come to understand how a self-loving agender trans man can awaken the people around zir to profound discomfort and love. To see a black lesbian who has just lost her mother try to find a way back to the proud black trans man she loves. To hear the story of a mother raising adopted children who struggle.
And because of the pandemic, this project will be done on line, filmed on Zoom and smart phones, edited and then put up on YouTube. It is an international project to be offered free to viewers. If you want to change the world, this is the project to back. We will reach people in every country. We will say what the interviewees taught me--that our bodies are wise and valuable, wounded and healing, and that we must learn to love our own bodies if we are to love each other. We must step outside the accepted cultural tropes and claim every body as worthwhile.

What We Need & What You Get
Our commitment is to respecting artists, and to this end we offered union contracts to all the actors, which double our budget. What you contribute will go to paying union wages, as well as paying stipends to interviewees, and salaries, to tech experts, directors and crew. We have also bought equipment and sent it to people around the country. Our next biggest expense is marketing of this free series--we want to reach as many people as possible. We recognize that the communities we represent deeply need to be mirrored in order to be welcomed and seen.
The perks we've created are all about involvement. The project is about connection and creativity while we're all more isolated than we've ever been...we don't want gimmicks. We want your heart and we want to include you.
So please do give, do support, do spread the word. We can't do this without you, and we can't make art or change the world without each other.
With deepest gratitude,
Lyralen Kaye, Creator & Director
Caitlin Inglis, Co-Director & Associate Producer
Ritu Chhina, Director of Zoom Photography
Alex Alexander, Development Liaison and Actor
Clare Solly, Associate Producer and Actor
Tina D'Elia, Diversity Consultant and Actor
Nelda Quigley, Development Associate and Actor
Jude Sclarsky, Managing Director and Executive Producer, Another Country

story:
A Community of Models, Photographers, Make-up Artists and Designers

We're working towards building a community that connects Models, Photographers, Make-up Artists and Designers in the fashion, fitness and beauty industries. It's a community that functions through our mobile and web app- and provides support, networking, knowledge-sharing and a collaborative platform for those who are serious about building their career, discovering new opportunities and growing their contacts. 

 

 

 

 

 

What is Model Unity?

Here's a quick look at what Model Unity is and what we're working on. 

 

 

Season 1 Recap + Challenges

We self-funded Season 1 and shot across New Orleans (USA), Cape Town (South Africa) & Dubai (UAE). We worked with 10x talented models, 4x amazing make-up artists and 3x creative photographers. We need your help to greenlight Season 2 to achieve International Expansion. 

 

 

Goals & Unlockables

We've set-up 4 milestones that we're working towards to achieve our goal. Take a quick look at the video below. 

 

 

 

Perks & Rewards

We've broken down our rewards into Unlimited and Exclusive/Limited Range. From $20 to $3,000 - you always get something for your investment. Take a look at the tiers in the video below:

 
Unlimited Perks & Rewards
 

 

Limited Exclusive Perks & Rewards

 

 

E9: Destiney Mcallister & Emily Kast | New Orleans, USA (modelunity.com) 

 

E8: Nadine Bachmeir | Dubai, UAE (modelunity.com) 

 

E8: Kristina Ruger | Cape Town, South Africa (modelunity.com) 

 

E6: Jessie Crawford | Cape Town, South Africa (modelunity.com) 

 

E5: Nataliia Kushnir | Cape Town, South Africa (modelunity.com)

 

E4: Kelly Uppington | Cape Town, South Africa (modelunity.com)

 

E3: Yana Aleksandrova | Dubai, UAE (modelunity.com)

 

E2: Mahsan Kianirad (Ava) | Dubai, UAE (modelunity.com)

 

E1: Sara Schmidt | Dubai, UAE (modelunity.com)

 

 

If you liked the above videos - help us by backing this project and sharing it with your network. 

 

We can make Season 2 bigger and better - but only with your help and support!

Find out more information at www.modelunity.com 

Get in touch with us at hello@modelunity.com

story:
What is Take the Whip?

Take the Whip centers around a group of people who make the in world wide league of Roller Derby. The Story begins following two hilarious women who experience different tragedies that seem to break them. As they search to become their former selves, the are lead to the sport which helps them grow into people they only dreamed they could ever become. As the series progresses the two characters form amazing bonds and friendships, and learn that there are many avenues that lead people to participate in this sport. The show focuses not only on the past and what lead each person to the sport, but also the present and the weird and exciting, sometimes unrealistically funny events that are now shaping the characters lives.

I wanted to make a show that featured so many important stories, but also share all of my favorite memories, and highlights of roller derby.  Did I mention that all these story lines are based on real events? I want to celebrate the diversity of the sport, the people, and world we live in while paying tribute to so many people who don’t even know how much they inspired me.

IF WE REACH OUR GOAL

We are seeking funding for the pilot episode of the series, and if funding really takes off we will move forward with future episodes as well. So why are we using Indiegogo and not featuring this on a more traditional network or outlet?  Well…we are actually doing both. In order to keep the creative control of the series, and keep this show truly something made by those that have a passion for this sport and the people involved, we are seeking partial backing from amazing people like you. To tell this story right, there needs to be real world experience, from people who eat, breath, and live roller derby empowerment. This requires us to have partners if we want something more than a local TV access show featured from our mom’s basement. Networks and studios can really add a lot of value to productions, and we want that! But they can also have some complications, such as determining which guests can be on the show, altering the tone of the show, productions holds and even limiting our tattoos! And we just cant have that. We want to use real teams, we want to use real skaters. We don’t want our stories to be misrepresented. So we are trying for the best of both worlds.

And now, coming up, you will notice that there is a list of BOOTY! These treasures are yours, after donation. All the donations goes directly to the production of this series.  And if you can not make a donation, that’s ok. We still love you, and there are other ways to support the show as well. Share this page with your friends, family, coworkers, and frienemies. Use your social media to promote our social media and this fundraiser. Talk about us to everybody you see, bring back old methods of communication if you have to—morse code, interpretive dance, smoke signals, whatever your heart desires.

 

You might be asking why are we seeking so much for a pilot episode? Well, making a show cost A LOT! The average cost for an episode of a television series is about 4 Million dollars…again, that’s per episode. Our main goal is to keep it real, keep it authentic, keep it as accurate as possible, and that means not giving up creative control. So we are seeking to fund %10 of the high cost of production to make a full length episode. 

 

 

Now that you made it this far,

Hello! My name is Jacquelynn and I have had a unique experience where a tragedy lead me to meet some of the most amazing and courageous people a person could ever have the honor of meeting.  Our meetings all centered around Roller Derby! As I met more and more people, I learned their stories and what lead them to participate in this outlet.  So many stories captivated me, and those stores deserve to be told. It is an emotional roller coaster of tragedy, drama, strength and uncontrollable belly laughs.   A contribution will not only help share these stories, but it will shed light on so many topics that are often overlooked, shied away from, or misrepresented in television.  Each of these stories are more relatable than what seems to be possible, and when we relate, we connect, and when we connect we heal, grow, laugh, and make changes for the better. 

These stores have been playing in my head for the last 10 years. In 2016 I decided to write a script and was blessed enough to have interest from Amazon Prime Video, and MTV. However, their interest meant loosing creative control, and most likely having these stories be incorrectly told.  So, I sat on this project trying to figure out how to keep these stories authentic and make sure all voices are truly heard.  After writing my own script, I called in team of writers to help me polish the script,  added more personal details and began discussion again with production companies and studios. And now we have arrived! Your contribution will  go to finalizing cost to create the pilot, while allowing creative control to the writers and those who stories are being told.  For me, these are some of the most important stories being told, and I am so excited to be able to help share them with the world. 

Over 100,000 derby players world-wide, thousands and thousands or NSOs, SOs, and our friends, family, and fan. These stories being told are yours.  

 

 

Let me Introduce you to some of our actors!

story:
WHERE ARE WE? 

 

THE SKINNY

We are Studio Mudprints, and we're known around the globe for Bullet Heaven, the world's longest-running review show, all about shmups. For almost 10 years, we've been reviewing them with in-depth coverage that has no rival. Shooters for the Sega Dreamcast have always been oft-requested as the platform has quite a decent number of quality - and even legendary - titles. 

Studio Mudprints' GameQuest: The Sega Dreamquest aims to be the most concise, in-depth and definitive series dedicated to the complete library of Sega Dreamcast shmups. Combined with our lengthy expertise, Bullet Heaven and excellent production values, there will be no better resource for Sega Dreamcast shoot-em-ups, and you can be a part of it! 

WHAT'S NEEDED AND WHAT'S UP FOR GRABS

Here's what the Sega Dreamquest needs: 

  • Funding for better lighting and/or camera equipment (PRIMARY)
  • Core funding for our remaining Dreamcast library acquisition (SECONDARY)
  • Funding for high-quality reward production and title variants (STRETCH)

What do you get in return? 

  • Credit in every produced video the series will ever see. 
  • Tiered rewards. 
  • The satisfaction that you were able to help make this amazing production a reality! 
  • Better perks with full and stretch funding; If 100% of the main goal is met, the digital Dreamquest original soundtrack becomes a physical one and is rewarded to $25+ backers! A physical book can be produced at 200%+ funding. Even DVDs are a possibility... with a high enough stretch! 

But what if we don't make it the whole way to our goal? 

  • Not to worry; this flexible campaign will see 100% of the contributions received going directly into this project and nowhere else.
  • Want rewards? You'll still get them! (Keeping in mind that they will be main campaign rewards; no physical upgrades from digital.) 
  • We are ultimately dedicated to producing this series; it may take longer but it will be completed! 

THE DREAMQUEST IMPACT

The Sega Dreamquest is more than just a guy showing off a bunch games; we know there are thousands, even millions of people that make videos like that already and we're no exception; our first GameQuest chronicled PSP shooters and while we were successful, it was costlier and less structured than we would have liked. We have bigger plans for our Dreamcast library though, not to mention the Dreamcast and Shooting Game community at large!

All too often, manuals and cases are overlooked in favor of a quick blurb and a few minutes of gameplay footage.  In our case, this production will become a rare, detailed look into the finer points of physical game acquisition, including case design, manual highlights and disc labels. In the case of the Japanese shooters on Dreamcast, DVD, jewelcase and OBI spinecard translations will bring this in-depth look to fantastic new heights! 

  • The Sega Dreamquest will be the most in-depth series of its kind. 
  • Extreme production value with all-new music and visuals made specifically for this series. 
  • A lasting, complete, high-quality Dreamcast shoot-em-up chronicle that fans old and new can reference forever. 

CHALLENGES/RISKS

Of course, there are always risks and challenges, perceived or otherwise, that might cause concern to a potential backer. Will we go over budget? How long will it take to actually get started? How "Complete" are we talking here?  

The challenges: 

  1. Proving that this project is not just padding an expensive collection
  2. Keeping cost within the limits of this funding campaign
  3. Getting the best deal on missing titles and equipment for maximum production value
  4. "Complete" can mean a lot of things. 

The solutions: 

  1. Primarily, we don't actually "collect" games. We have a functional library, that is regularly accessed and exhibited whether through Bullet Heaven, livestreams or events and other productions. Titles provided for review over four years ago are still being used for new productions even today! Additionally, very little of our Dreamcast library is considered "collector grade", though they are complete with cases, manuals and, in the case of Japanese titles, are better maintained with plastic sleeves an OBI present for each. 
  2. Keeping the cost confined to this campaign is a non-issue, 
  3. Getting good deals has been an integral part in keeping Bullet Heaven going as long as it has; we have excellent connections that allow us to get substantial discounts through our years of excellent patronage, fantastic contacts and publishing partners!
  4.  We are actually trying to complete the dreamcast pantheon in three ways: Complete Japanese library, which has us feature every Japanese STG release on Dreamcast. Complete title library which could mean that if we have a Japanese version of a game, we may not need to acquire a more expensive north american version. And finally, complete Special Edition library, which has us obtain and feature every official-release Special Edition (which would not include Homebrew). However, with enough funding, we could probably still acquire all versions regardless.

The risks: 

  • There are no major risks to this project! Whether the whole cost is covered here or not, we are intent on finishing the job!

Overcoming adversity: 

  • We've already gotten a massive head start on this project and plan to finish it regardless of support. But this campaign will make it happen faster and maybe, just maybe if the funding goes into stretch, we can cover every single variant in the process and even change some digital rewards into physical ones. An epic win! 

 

ANYONE CAN HELP!

We understand that not everyone can afford to contribute in a financial sense. However, there are all kinds of things that you can do to help make this campaign a rousing success! 

  • Follow us for updates and more! 
  • Hit up social media to tell your friends about this cool new series! 
  • Share this campaign with like-minded individuals on forums and online groups! 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to make it happen!

story:
Summary

onewordnocaps is an LA-based sketch group that regularly produces creative, funny, and thought-provoking content.

As we approach our 4th season, launching in August (woohoo!), we want to continue giving life to new ideas, daring to surprise our audiences, and upping our sketch comedy game. After completing 3 seasons with over 50 videos, resulting in millions of views, funded completely out of our own pockets, we are in need of some investors. 

This is where you come in. We have big plans for 2017, and we would love for you to be a part of it!

What We Need

We want to continue on our path of increased production value to make our work look and sound even better. To do that we need better (i.e. new and fully functional) equipment.

What we need:

LED Light Panels - Because in all honesty, we are afraid of the dark. 

Wireless Lav Mics  - So we can be heard from afar.

Field Recorder - Because the sound must go...somewhere.

Director of Photography Budget - To make our stuff look gooood.

Better Shotgun Mic - We love crisp sound.

Costume Budget - Disappearing into character is always fun.

Day-of-Budget- So we may feed our crew.   

Apple Boxes - You know what they say:  an apple box a day...

Hard Drives - Soft drives just don't cut the mustard. 

At the end of the day, these items are essential to complete the vision and goals we have for our upcoming season, and beyond. All funds raised will be used towards our most needed items first. 

The Impact

Aside from creating content (because we absolutely love this process) our goal is to bring you original stories that make you laugh and maybe even get some of the feels. If we turn a not-so-great day into an amazing one with a sketch that speaks to you, we know we're doing something right. You are a huge part of why we do what we do!

Some of our past successes include Trump Card (over 1 million views on Funny or Die), Fifty Shades of Felt, and Racist Siri, which was shown on New Delhi Television in India. We are thrilled to be able to bring laughter to you all. 

Challenges

Producing anything has its own struggles. Creative projects are started every day that never reach completion. We understand how difficult the process can be as we've worked hard to create original sketches for over 3 consecutive years.  onewordnocaps comedy has grown tremendously in terms of our team and the quality of content that we produce. We are very proud of how far we've come. Our sights are set even higher for the future, and with ideas already cooking, having the capability to bring those concepts to life is our aim.

Other Ways You Can Help

No matter what you're able to give, sharing this campaign via social media would really mean a lot to us. It just takes a click of a button to help us spread the word. We greatly appreciate your support!
story_txt: Summaryonewordnocaps is an LA-based sketch group that regularly produces creative, funny, and thought-provoking content.As we approach our 4th season, launching in August (woohoo!), we want to continue giving life to new ideas, daring to surprise our audiences, and upping our sketch comedy game. After completing 3 seasons with over 50 videos, resulting in millions of views, funded completely out of our own pockets, we are in need of some investors. This is where you come in. We have big plans for 2017, and we would love for you to be a part of it!What We NeedWe want to continue on our path of increased production value to make our work look and sound even better. To do that we need better (i.e. new and fully functional) equipment.What we need:LED Light Panels - Because in all honesty, we are afraid of the dark. Wireless Lav Mics  - So we can be heard from afar.Field Recorder - Because the sound must go...somewhere.Director of Photography Budget - To make our stuff look gooood.Better Shotgun Mic - We love crisp sound.Costume Budget - Disappearing into character is always fun.Day-of-Budget- So we may feed our crew.   Apple Boxes - You know what they say:  an apple box a day...Hard Drives - Soft drives just don't cut the mustard. At the end of the day, these items are essential to complete the vision and goals we have for our upcoming season, and beyond. All funds raised will be used towards our most needed items first. The ImpactAside from creating content (because we absolutely love this process) our goal is to bring you original stories that make you laugh and maybe even get some of the feels. If we turn a not-so-great day into an amazing one with a sketch that speaks to you, we know we're doing something right. You are a huge part of why we do what we do!Some of our past successes include Trump Card (over 1 million views on Funny or Die), Fifty Shades of Felt, and Racist Siri, which was shown on New Delhi Television in India. We are thrilled to be able to bring laughter to you all. ChallengesProducing anything has its own struggles. story:
Science With Sophie

Science comedy for girls and everyone.

 

Why this show? Why now?

Science With Sophie uses comedy to close the gender gap in STEM. Women make up half of the world’s population, yet only 30% of US STEM careers are held by women, with only 12% held by women of color. Why does it happen? A major driving force in a child’s self-identity is presence - or lack - of role models. It’s a simple, scary idea: if you can’t see it, you can’t be it.

Science With Sophie is a free, interactive series that engages kids, parents, teachers and anyone who loves life, bringing all ages and backgrounds together to spark conversation, scientific debate, and joyful inquiry about the world around us. By connecting viewers worldwide with female STEM role models, we can create change that lasts for decades as we inspire the next generation of young scientists. The show is just the beginning.

 

What we’ve accomplished so far:

  • 150,000+ YouTube views
  • 100,000+ Facebook views
  • 10+ Keynote and School Events with students, teachers and caregivers across the country
  • 15+ Media Appearances
  • 1 Science With Sophie Themed Birthday Party in Minnesota (!)

AND WE’RE JUST GETTING STARTED.

With your help, Season 2 will be bigger (more episodes!), sillier (more gum to step in!), braver (more experiments!) and science-ier (more people doing STEM!) than ever.

What’s in store for Season 2:

More Episodes

  • DOUBLE the number of Season 1 episodes - FREE as always!
  • More topics, genres, characters, STEM experts, and experiments
  • More writers, editors, marketing, and production needs

The all-female SWS writing team dreaming big for Season 2.

More Classroom Visits

  • Encourage thousands of students to pursue STEM careers
  • Exchange ideas with other young female entrepreneurs
  • Lead workshops for teachers about inclusivity & the Next Generation Science Standards (NGSS)
  • ...and more!

Sophie visiting some young scientists.

Interactive Website for Kids, Caregivers and Teachers

  • For Kids: Experiments with easy-to-find materials
  • For Caregivers: Ideas and instructions for your family to find science every day
  • For Teachers: Lesson plans, teachable activities, and science standards connections

Sophie and comedian Shantira Jackson explore gelotogy: the science of laughter!

 

WHY ARE YOU ASKING FOR LESS IF YOU’RE MAKING MORE EPISODES?

Great question, scientist. We have some exciting announcements about match programs coming soon, so keep an eye out for those.

 

ANY COOL SWAG?

HECK YEAH. Be the first fan to snag a SWS mug, notebook, tote, poster, or all of the above as a thank-you for your generous support!

STEM Sidebar: can you guess the science behind our perk levels?

 

WHY SCIENCE WITH SOPHIE MATTERS

"I Love Science With Sophie!"

- Nirali's World, YouTube

"My students loved watching at school this year and I can't wait to start showing my new class in August!"

- Haley, Facebook

"My 5th graders watched episode one on Monday and loved it. We're also doing the experiment to show how water expands when it freezes"

- Jeff, Facebook

"Love Love Love! Get this girl on Netflix!"

- Chrissy, YouTube

"Sophie is making science fun! This is one to share and watch again!﻿

- Lisa, YouTube

"I want to be like you when I grow up."

- Charity, Facebook

"My 7 year old LOVES IT!!!! This is FANTASTIC!!!!"

- Kathryn, Facebook

"My 7 year old talked back to you quite a bit. She loved it, and had literally just the day before asked me about the cracks in our sidewalk, which I tried to explain to her, but your illustration worked much more thoroughly!"

- David, Facebook

"I just watched this last night with my 4 girls (11, 9, 7, and 4). After it, my 4 year old turned to me and said "I be scientist." Yes, yes you can. So excited for this show. My girls are in love with it already."

- Rebekah, Facebook

"This is awesome, I was always told when i was a young girl, you can't your just not smart enough. I do electrical engineering now....wonder what I would have accomplished if somebody told me I can do it!"

- Erika, Facebook

"I'm watching this video with a 4 yo girl I nanny and she won't stop watching. We're on our 6th viewing."

- Katie, Facebook

"I love this! I wish I would have had something like this when I was growing up! "

- Krystal, Facebook

SCIENCE WITH SOPHIE IN THE PRESS

Funders & Features

National Geographic Kids Science With Sophie YouTube Playlist

Girls Who Code "Brave Not Perfect" Podcast

La Petite Ecoliere Role Model Blog

Camelback Ventures 2018 Fellowship

Noteworthy News

GOLDIEBLOX

DOSE

NORTHEASTERN UNIVERSITY

The Jam! Morning Show

Brit+Co

Crastina

Inverse

Young scientists line up to say hello after a speaking event. 

College students talk STEM equity and being an entrepreneur.

 

QUESTIONS? OBSERVATIONS? WANT TO SAY HELLO SCIENTIST?

Drop me a line at hello@sciencewithsophie.com!

story:
Short Summary

The company producing the project is tello Films and we have been producing and distributing innovative, high-quality web series for 10 years. We love strong women and don’t feel that there are enough stories about us.  It is our mission and passion to produce content the includes the wonderful spectrum of strong women that is lacking in mainstream media. 

The story of Riley Parra

Detective Riley Parra grew up in the bad part of town, crime-ridden No Man’s Land.  Now, as a cop in a corrupt department, she strives to make sure the rough streets she left behind aren’t forgotten. She takes the cases that would otherwise be ignored or left unsolved because
no one cared enough to dig deeper.  In season 1, a case leads her to the discovery that No Man’s Land is a battleground between angels and demons, a supernatural war that’s been waged for centuries.  Thrown into a world she never believed could exist, Riley chooses to accept the title of Champion for Good.  Demons are real and Riley Parra plans to give them hell.  In season 2 we continue to look at the relationship between Riley and Gillian and meet Riley's new partner Caitlin Priest. 

Season 1 was tello's first foray into producing a sci-fi/fantasy/thriller and this genre is one of Director Christin Baker's favorite, and so we want to do it the right way.  That means that we have to go a little bit out of our budget range.  We actually didn't have quite enough funds to do the special effects.  We feel our story, acting and lighting are AMAZING but we don't have the funds for great special effects.  That's why our goal is higher and we have even more awesome Guest Stars! 

Last year we raised $14,000 from generous backers and this year we would like $20,000 (stretch goal is $30,000).  These funds will be used for sets, to hire our awesome stunt coordinator and post-production special effects.

We are so lucky to have the wonderful support of our Riley (Marem Hassler) and other leads including Liz Vassey, Maeve Quinlan, and Karl E. Landler and they have offered to do some really wonderful perks for those supporting this series.   We also have Tony Amendola (Stargate, Once Upon a Time) and Marina Sirtis (Deanna Troi from Star Trek: TNG) coming for Season 2! 

The producers and director on this project are women and the lead is a woman and we like to add to the great storytelling landscape supporting women filmmakers.  Your contribution will help elevate their work and passion.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Please help us get the word out and make some noise about Riley Para.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the love!

story:
Short Summary

Here's the deal.  When I was a teenager, I knew EXACTLY what my future work life would be.  I was going to write, direct, and star in movies.  I knew it.  Knew it in the same way that I knew how to breathe.  And by the time I was in my 20s, I was already off the path.  My diversion started with doing theater (which is great and wonderful and all that, but not my fate or my passion).  I wandered aimlessly through this and that--I've had over 50 jobs in my life--until I wound up 35 years later working as an admin at a college.  Which is a long way from being the next Orson Welles.  Or even the next Jules White, the director of most of the Three  Stooges' estimable body of work.

But now I'm over that.  I'm back to the path.  Writing, directing, and starring in cinematic projects.  Okay, web series instead of feature films, but the same skill set.  And the things that we used to quaintly call "TV shows" are etched even deeper in my DNA than movies are.  And it is all the same process, the same aesthetic, the same art.

I did make a couple of very brief films six or seven years ago, The Afternoon Game and Wendell, Friday Evening, which are the two most successful independent projects I've done.  (I've also written and published a novel, Michael Drayton, Detective Guy, and the book and audioplay versions of Looking for Christmas.) . Now, the time has come to pursue the real thing.

I am looking to fund two projects.  "Commercial Films" is a four part mini web series destined for YouTube.  Each episode will comprise two parody commercials, one featuring a longstanding character of mine, Rudy Value, and a second parody of commercials for things ranging from pharmaceuticals to jewelry stores.  "Looking for Christmas"  will come out as a five-episode series, also on YouTube.   It is a set of tales concerning three 20-somethings who drive around looking at Christmas displays that also tells stories that occur inside the places they encounter along their journey.  

What We Need & What You Get

It's much easier now than ever before to make something good as an independent, but let me tell you, money helps!

We need props, costumes, locations, and meals for cast and crew.  Being able to buy quality wireless mic packs would be invaluable.  And being able give the participants a stipend for their hard work wouldn't be a bad thing either.  (And let me be clear, when it comes to getting a stipend or salary, I am last on the list.  In fact, I'm so far down the list that I'm not actually on it at all.)  Every cent raised--whether we reach our goal or not--will go to making the production of these two projects a reality and will enable us to create the best shows possible.  We can also, then, afford entry fees for films festivals (many of which now feature web series categories).

Besides the satisfactions and warm feelings that come from being a patron of the arts, we are also offering a slate of premiums.  These include:

  • All contributors, at any amount, will receive a credit at the end of each episode of both series.  You can show it to your friends, pause it on the title card featuring you, and point to it, just like you were one of the Rockefellers or somebody who gets their name on the outside of a hospital.
  • Contributors of $10 or more will receive a handwritten, individualized thank you note written on official Next in the Series stationery, even if I have to scan it and email it to you.
  • For $25, contributors will receive the above premiums as well as a still from the production taken by an actual professional photographer.
  • Those who give at least $50, get the credit, the thank you note, and a production still autographed by me, Len Cassamas, and any other cast members who are shown  in the still.
  • $75 contributions earn all of the above and will receive a pair of matching Christmas ornaments straight from the sets of both "Looking for Christmas" and episode 3 of "Commercial Films."
  • Anyone who contributes at least $100 will get all of the above and the chance to submit a photo of themselves or a loved one (sorry, no photos of famous or controversial figures allowed) to be placed on the set of an episode of "Looking for Christmas."
  • Anyone who gives $500 or more will get a credit on each episode of both productions as a producer, as well as all of the premiums described above.

Risks & Challenges

Now, we may not make our goals, but the show will go on.  We already have a quality SLR camera (Canon EOS 70D) and some lighting equipment, as well as professional quality audio equipment and audio and video editing software.  We have the support of talented actors who have already agreed to participate.  We can do this.  Funding will make it easier for us to produce a quality product, but we will come out with two professional-quality web series regardless.

Other Ways You Can Help

There's more to life than money, of course, and you can help us by getting the word out, keeping an eye on our progress, and sending us all the best vibes you can, even if you have to look in the back of a closet or in the pantry next to the wax beans in order to find them.  And, frankly, I will take the help of any person with a flair for PR with or without a contribution.  And if you have your own ideas for how you can pitch in, please let me know!  We need you!
