story:
About Soully For You

Soully For You is a short film series that encompasses a group of individuals discussing topics such as love, music, career, family, traveling and more. The series originated with a group of young women in their 20’s crying at a lounge at the 2018 Sundance Film Festival. The idea sparked from our heartfelt conversation about friendship and judgment. A nearby listener encouraged us to make a film, behold Soully For You was born. This film series has the potential to change the industry of film and art. We haven’t seen many (if any at all) films that encompass authentic conversations, original music, and the lost art of poetry. 

Soully For You is a brand that represents the authentic life of a person and their version of figuring life out, no matter the obstacle. 

By supporting our project, you're giving our viewers a chance to express who they truly are! 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's a detailed breakdown of what your contributions cover:

The Perks

In exchange for your contributions we're offering amazing perks!

The Visonary

Imani Powell, Creator

Imani is a proud Jersey girl currently living her dream as an artist in Utah. She graduated from Virginia Commonwealth University with a degree in Forensic Science and currently works as a Chemist. Her love for science has always been strong, but her passion for the arts was ingrained in her as a youngin. She's a poet, filmmaker, and singer who hopes to touch at least one person's life. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Unable to donate at the moment? We understand. Our campaign will run for 31 days so come back if you can! Here are other ways you can help:

  • Like us on Facebook: Soully For You
  • Follow us on Instagram: @Soully_For_You
  • Follow us on Twitter: @Soully_For_You
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about our campaign

About Soully For You

Soully For You is a short film series that encompasses a group of individuals discussing topics such as love, music, career, family, traveling and more. The series originated with a group of young women in their 20’s crying at a lounge at the 2018 Sundance Film Festival. The idea sparked from our heartfelt conversation about friendship and judgment. A nearby listener encouraged us to make a film, behold Soully For You was born. This film series has the potential to change the industry of film and art. We haven’t seen many (if any at all) films that encompass authentic conversations, original music, and the lost art of poetry. 
Soully For You is a brand that represents the authentic life of a person and their version of figuring life out, no matter the obstacle. 
By supporting our project, you're giving our viewers a chance to express who they truly are! 

What We Need & What You Get
Here's a detailed breakdown of what your contributions cover:


The Perks
In exchange for your contributions we're offering amazing perks!


The Visonary
Imani Powell, Creator
Imani is a proud Jersey girl currently living her dream as an artist in Utah. She graduated from Virginia Commonwealth University with a degree in Forensic Science and currently works as a Chemist. Her love for science has always been strong, but her passion for the arts was ingrained in her as a youngin. She's a poet, filmmaker, and singer who hopes to touch at least one person's life. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Unable to donate at the moment? We understand. Our campaign will run for 31 days so come back if you can! Here are other ways you can help:

Like us on Facebook: Soully For You
Follow us on Instagram: @Soully_For_You
Follow us on Twitter: @Soully_For_You
Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about our campaign

story:
My Story

I've been a game show nut my whole life. Back in the 80's, the best part of being sick on a school day (other than missing school) was getting to watch "$25,000 Pyramid," "Scrabble," and "The Price Is Right."  I dreamed of winning cash, fabulous prizes, and even lovely parting gifts.

When I moved to California in my early 20s, I found my way onto "The Dating Game." The young lady wisely chose Bachelor #2 over me, but my life changed that day. I was pretty good at this game show thing, and I would be back on another show. Here we are years and years later, and I've been a game show contestant 16 times! 

I won money, I won trips. I shook Chuck Woolery's hand.

Somewhere along the way, I realized that as much as I love being a contestant on game shows, the place where I really belong is behind the podium, asking the questions.

Neither Pat Sajak nor Alex Trebek returned my voicemails asking for their jobs, so I knew I had to create my own show. I combined my love for trivia with my tolerance for pain, and the idea that was born was Slapca$h - the only game show where you can slap the host, and take his cash!

Any size contribution you can swing will make a huge difference. You will be helping me achieve my dream, and you will also be spreading laughter. Because while I can't guarantee this show will be intelligent or artistic, I promise you it will be funny.

How Your Funds Will Help

Here's where your support of Slapca$h will come in:

Theater rental

Camera rentals

Lighting Equipment rental

Sound equipment rental

Set design

Craft Services

Camera operators

Lighting technicians

Set decorator

Contestant coordinator

Warm-up comedian

Judge/scorekeeper

Editor

Miscellaneous production and post-production expenses

Other Ways To Help

Sometimes money's tight. We've all been there. Not everyone has extra cash to throw at a face-slapping game show project. But if you can't pitch in, would you please consider:

  • Sharing the Slapca$h campaign on social media through the Indiegogo share tools?
  • Forwarding the finished product to anyone who likes game shows or laughing?
  • Liking my post on Facebook so all my Facebook friends have a better chance of seeing it?

 

Thanks for reading about "Slapca$h." I look forward to making it for you!

story:
Think The Magic School Bus on LSD 

A 6 Episode Web Series about fixing sh*tty behavior. Each episode features a different guest star in need of an Epiphany.

Created by Blake Harrison and Garrett Mendez, better known as the comedy duo and truth sayers BiG Expression, this show combines legitimate life lessons with rambunctious high energy mind games.

Teaching The World How to Adult Better and Suck Less

Spoiler alert: We're not setting our world up for success. Everyone needs to learn that ALL actions have COSMIC CONSEQUENCES. With this web series, we're setting the alarm to wake everyone up. From start to finish, each episode follows the journey of an individual coming to terms with the reality of their mistakes.

Focusing on terrible habits like:

Using People

Living Unrealistic Lifestyles

Being Selfish and Greedy

and more!!!

 

Everyone has bills and taking off a month to film for free is just...hard. We value our team and the time they're spending away from their family and jobs to turn this vision into a reality. We would love our gratitude to be backed with a paycheck; plus locations and transforming blank studio space into the inside of people's minds is costly. 

With $22,222 as our budget, we will be able to complete the scripted Season 1 as planned. Our goal is to make each episode aesthetically unique, exploring different FX techniques and editing styles with each Epiphany. Since we're inside a different person's head each episode, every set is designed to be as complex and intricate as the inner workings of their mind.

Ultimately our goal is to not have to compromise our clear vision due to a lack of budget

To show our gratitude for ya'll contributing to MindBlown, we've designed a variety of very special rewards for you, such as:

Just like life, everything can go wrong.

Lights can break, locations can fall through, footage can get erased and then everyone turns into a monster.

That is why our proposed budget includes a $555 buffer for any incidentals. 

$30,000

1 More Episode! Better FX budget.

Festival Submissions. Bigger Named Actors. Cooler Set Builds.

40,000

All of the above + 2 More Episodes!

We've got tons of more content and minds to blow...this sets us up with exactly what we need.

Our goal is to release an episode Monday-Friday for one week, which pairs perfectly with your morning mimosa and xanax.

Ultimate Goal: Entire season on Amazon Prime.

Ballin' on a budget and struggling to eat?
We feel you. NO WORRIES!
Here's all the other ways you can contribute (for free):

Like us on FACEBOOK
Like us on INSTAGRAM
Like us on TWITTER

Saving the world is a full time gig with no salary...
But we're crazy enough to do it.
So, are you IN? Or are you IIIIIIIIIN?

story:
Last year we raised $600 to produce 2 episodes, Private Dicks Exposed and Private Dicks In Deep. This year, with shorter, more youtube-friendly episode lengths of 10minutes, we aim to bring you an action packed conclusion to the story we began telling now almost 4 years ago.

We have put so much thought and effort into developing a satisfying series finale for our fans, and what we've written is really gonna take the show up a notch. Great pacing, lots of action, emotion, shocks, and twists await as the plot thickens with each episode. It's mob vs mob as Pierce & Pritchett try to expose and bring down Vincent Malikaros, ruthless underworld boss, and chaos erupts all around them.

Our funding challenges this year circle around locations, equipment (props/costumes), and transportation, and that is where we ask you, our fans and supporters, to help us, even just a little bit. We've got some sweet swag and posters up for grabs, and credit options towards the series, for anyone who is interested in helping us bring you our A-game this year and enjoy a series finale that actually delivers (like Breaking Bad. Not like GoT, here's looking at you)

Shooting thru August to November, we aim to release a new episode every 6 weeks beginning in December 2019. You may expect your purchases by December as well. For those living in Calgary and area, personal delivery is available instead of shipping. Otherwise, please contact Justin Hodge at rockymountainmotionpicture@outlook.com for a shipping quote.

Can't wait to bring you our very best out of our last ten episodes! Thanks for reading and for your support! It would be awesome if you'd give us a share, too, of course :)

story:
Short Summary

Hi there, this is Ben and Andrew, best friends of thirteen years, and the creators of "Who The Eff Are These Guys?"
We met in 7th grade, and became best friends quickly. Then in 9th grade, Ben came out as gay, and Andrew was the first person he told. Years later, Andrew returned the favor and came out as bisexual.

We have always wanted to work together, and love performing - but we felt that queer characters in general tend to fall into cliches and stereotypes. We wanted a show that represented US, and one that could come to represent all of the LGBT+ community.

"Who The Eff Are These Guys?" is just an episode at this point. It features versions of ourselves, dialed up to 11. However, we see so much potential for this show with your help. We want to bring in more characters that represent more people: queer people of color, trans individuals, non-binary people, drag queens/kings, and all the other amazing folk who make up the LGBT+ community. 

With your donations, we can reach out to those creators, writers, directors, performers, etc - and get their assistance in telling the stories they deserve to tell. This community deserves better characters that represent all our stories and tell them well.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $3000 to fund our 10-episode season (9 remaining) that will begin debuting at the start of 2018.
Here is what this money can help us accomplish (see detailed visual breakdown below):

  • Better equipment:
    • Cameras
    • Microphones
    • Editing software
    • Etc.
  • Props/Costumes/Sounds: 
    • Props/Set Decoration: Approx. $100 per episode ($1000 total)
    • Costumes: Approx. $150 for whole season
    • Sounds: Approx. $50 for whole season
  • ​Stipends for guest artists:
    • Writers
    • Directors
    • Editors
    • Actors
    • Etc.
  • Storage Space
    • Hard Drives: videos are large files, and having them transportable is key.

If we don't reach our goal of $3000, we will still be making as many episodes as we can with the funds we do receive, and may try to raise more money again in future. We believe in this project, and want to deliver as much content as we can.

 

 

If you DO donate to us, there will be some REWARDS for you!

  • Exclusive Donor Tees!
  • Posters!
  • Hang-Out Sessions with the Cast!
  • Calendars!
  • Personalized videos!
  • And MORE!

The Impact

We believe that "Who The Eff Are These Guys?" will offer a relatable, unabashedly queer, lighthearted comedy series about two friends getting into crazy situations, and showcasing their support group and their community - made up of largely queer people and characters, written and represented truthfully by those can accurately portray them.
We believe this show can offer opportunities to creators and performers who may not have many opportunities available for them, or may want to defy stereotypes and un-limit themselves.
We believe that this show can be filled with queer jokes and references, and still be enjoyable and relatable for those who are not members of that community.
Most of all, we believe that "Who The Eff Are These Guys?" is fun, and that hopefully - we can make some people laugh.
If we can achieve that, we'd be very pleased with the project.

Risks & Challenges

We encountered many challenges with our pilot, and these are things we want to get better at and fix in a full season. A lot of this comes from the fact that we are new to film work - and have never really been behind the camera before. We really struggled with continuity, and sound editing in particular. This is one of the reasons we want to reach out to other creators who have the skills to elevate this content. We'll be reaching out to local film students for their assistance in future too.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate money, THAT'S OKAY! Even though the smallest monetary amount helps, there are a variety of other ways you can help us out:

  • Volunteer - we love assistants during shoots, and can always use people to help out in creating the project.
  • Offer your Artistry - If you're a writer/director/camera op/sound guy/performer, and you would like to be involved or offer something unique, reach out! We'd love to hear from you.
  • Spread the word! Just share this link, and direct people to "Who The Eff Are These Guys?" That's a guaranteed way for you to get more content without paying yourself.
  • Tell us how much you loved the pilot! We love to hear your feedback :)

story:
AMAZON TOP SHOW

The Other F Word Season One is an Amazon Video top web series for the third month in a row.  It’s been viewed significantly every single day since its launch five months ago.  The show has reached over half a million people domestically which is mind blowing.  We’ve defied the odds  and am overwhelmed by our success,  I am grateful to all who have watched and help to spread the word.

If you haven't, visit our site www.theotherfwordseries.com to link to the show as well as read all the amazing pull quotes and reviews. 

GOOD NEWS/BAD NEWS

While we've proven that there is large audience for this show, sadly, due to the show's primary demographic - women over 40- I could not find a digital company to finance Season Two. I am reaching out for your support  to keep these stories going.  

HELP US SHOW MID-LIFE MATTERS

We look to raise at least $30,000 to fund the production through personal donations and/or corporate sponsors.   Your contribution can be 100% tax deductible as The Other F Word is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization.  Contributions for the charitable purposes of The Other F Word must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

It goes without saying, any way that you can help is greatly appreciated - even if it's just helping to spread the word of the show and our campaign.

WHO RUNS THE WORLD?

Through our intensive grass roots efforts I have had the honor and pleasure to connect with so many amazing women who have made my life richer and helped to inform my writing.

My goal for Season Two is to make the world bigger and better both on screen and behind the scenes by creating a larger vibrant community of women who like myself are midlife re-starters or are young women we can mentor.   

The Team

We have an outstanding crew of talented individuals on Season 2, including talents of Emmy award winning tv writer Judy Rothman Rofé & the award winning playwriting team Pamela Weiler Grayson and Alice Jankell.  In addition Eileen Katz, a former SVP at Comedy Central/ MTV has come on board as an Executive Producer.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you enjoyed Season 1 and want to support the series, but are not in a position to donate to the campaign yourself, please consider helping us spread the word by passing the link along to other people you know, or by sharing on platforms like Facebook and Twitter. We really appreciate any and all help you can give us, and we eagerly look forward to showing Season 2 of 'The Other F Word' to you later this year!

FEARLESSLY DREAM BIG

Lastly, I hope to be able to continue to help empower and enable all of my friends who dream big. 

 

Best

Caytha Jentis

 

The Other F Word is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non­profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of The Other F Word must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only. Any contribution above the value of the goods and services received by the donor is tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
Good Vibes Only is a situational comedy that follows two girls, Lynn and Kitty, as they spend their youthful days going on hasty, and often, illegal adventures. 

The pilot of Good Vibes Only is currently being produced by a group of fourth year students in RTA Media Production, at X University students. We must complete a final practicum project to complete our degree. 

We have worked together for all of 2021, putting in that elbow grease in constructing a bible, perfecting the script, finding resources, and allocating a budget for each part of the production. We begin filming Fall 2021 and we intend to release in March 2022. 

We officially begin production in October 2021 and plan to release the comedy in March 2022. We are so proud of how far we've come already, but this is only the beginning. We would love it if you took part in our journey and help make our vision a true reality.


 

In this pilot episode, the girls raise the necessary funds for Lynn’s new phone. Things go awry when Lynn and Kitty’s scheme consists of selling a bag of fraudulent coke. Will they survive to tell the tale?

Good Vibes Only explores what it means to be a young person of colour (BIPOC) determined to carve your own path. For  many of us, children of first-generation descent, were not given established paths by our ancestral ties. Once adulthood comes, we must build an entire infrastructure for ourselves and future bloodline. 

Lynn and Kitty are perfect illustrations of young POC in the modern age. Lynn and Kitty come to know who they are and grow up. Like many young adults, navigating the transition from childhood to adulthood , they face many trials and tribulations, but at least they have each other.

Good Vibes Only is unlike any show as the leads’ race does not define or limit them, rather it is just one aspect of their multifaceted identities. For our audience, it is normal for people to be of multicultural backgrounds. So, their favorite media should be no different.

Good Vibes Only arose when creator, writer and director, Minhaj Monnan wanted to create a comedy that would be hilarious and meaningful to his community. While writing, it was natural that the characters would be BIPOC and reflect the world around him.

 







 

Our goal with this campaign is to raise $7500.  The donations we receive through this Indiegogo Campaign will contribute to assisting with expenses such as:
- Equipment (outsourcing)
- Post-Production
- Location & Set Design
- PPE (Personal Protective Equipment such as Masks, Hand sanitizers, etc.)
- Catering & Craft Services 
- Promotion & Distribution (Marketing Deliverables) 
- Transportation



 



Despite the challenges and restrictions of COVID-19, our  team has prepared thoughtfully to bring the stories of Good Vibes Only to life. We will be filming while following provincial and federal guidelines during the production and post-production processes of our show. We are committed to creating the best show possible while still maintaining the health and safety of others.



 

You can donate to our IndieGoGo campaign page. Any amount will help! If we exceed our goal, the rest will be going towards BIPOC-focused charities. Sharing our IndieGoGo page, our promo video and even our socials will help us out a whole lot! Please don’t hesitate to spread the word as well! Tell your friends, family and even your neighbours about this amazing project!
story_txt: Good Vibes Only is a situational comedy that follows two girls, Lynn and Kitty, as they spend their youthful days going on hasty, and often, illegal adventures. The pilot of Good Vibes Only is currently being produced by a group of fourth year students in RTA Media Production, at X University students. We must complete a final practicum project to complete our degree. We have worked together for all of 2021, putting in that elbow grease in constructing a bible, perfecting the script, finding resources, and allocating a budget for each part of the production. We begin filming Fall 2021 and we intend to release in March 2022. We officially begin production in October 2021 and plan to release the comedy in March 2022. We are so proud of how far we've come already, but this is only the beginning. We would love it if you took part in our journey and help make our vision a true reality. In this pilot episode, the girls raise the necessary funds for Lynn’s new phone. Things go awry when Lynn and Kitty’s scheme consists of selling a bag of fraudulent coke. Will they survive to tell the tale?Good Vibes Only explores what it means to be a young person of colour (BIPOC) determined to carve your own path. For  many of us, children of first-generation descent, were not given established paths by our ancestral ties. Once adulthood comes, we must build an entire infrastructure for ourselves and future bloodline. Lynn and Kitty are perfect illustrations of young POC in the modern age. Lynn and Kitty come to know who they are and grow up. Like many young adults, navigating the transition from childhood to adulthood , they face many trials and tribulations, but at least they have each other.Good Vibes Only is unlike any show as the leads’ race does not define or limit them, rather it is just one aspect of their multifaceted identities. For our audience, it is normal for people to be of multicultural backgrounds. So, their favorite media should be no different.Good Vibes Only arose when creator, writer and director, Minhaj Monnan wanted to create a comedy that would be hilarious and meaningful to his community. While writing, it was natural that the characters would be BIPOC and reflect the world around him.  Our goal with this campaign is to raise $7500.  The donations we receive through this Indiegogo Campaign will contribute to assisting with expenses such as:- Equipment (outsourcing)- Post-Production- Location & Set Design- PPE (Personal Protective Equipment such as Masks, Hand sanitizers, etc.)- Catering & Craft Services - Promotion & Distribution (Marketing Deliverables) - Transportation Despite the challenges and restrictions of COVID-19, our  team has prepared thoughtfully to bring the stories of Good Vibes Only to life. We will be filming while following provincial and federal guidelines during the production and post-production processes of our show. We are committed to creating the best show possible while still maintaining the health and safety of others. You can donate to our IndieGoGo campaign page. Any amount will help! If we exceed our goal, the rest will be going towards BIPOC-focused charities. Sharing our IndieGoGo page, our promo video and even our socials will help us out a whole lot! Please don’t hesitate to spread the word as well! Tell your friends, family and even your neighbours about this amazing project!

story:
The David Project Overview

We, the members of Screenland Entertainment Productions, are excited to invite you to join in our endeavor to bring one of the most compelling stories in the Bible to the screen.  We’re giving the story of David a bold, contemporary urban spin, lacing it with original music and spoken word in homage to the Psalms of the Old Testament, while putting together a diverse cast and crew of talented individuals who love God and want to honor Him with our variety of gifts.  Our goal is simple – to create a piece of art that will open another door to understanding God’s love (through his relationship with David) and inspire others to look deeper into God’s Word.  

Meet the cast of The David Project 

The Screenland Mission (Mark 16:15)

Our mission is to glorify God by creating opportunities for God-fearing men and women to express our love for Him through arts, media, and entertainment. We achieve this by using our collective talents to produce spiritual content and experiences.      

We’re very passionate about creating content that 1) edifies and brings glory to God, 2) doesn't compromise our relationship with God, and 3) viewers can watch without fear or concern of inappropriate material while being entertained.

All of our content, including The David Project, will be created to uplift and edify our audience. 

Your Donation Impact (Matthew 21:22)

Your donation will allow Screenland Entertainment Productions the opportunity to share new ways of presenting Christ to the world. We'll be able to minister to the audience through our art while bringing more Godly and relevant stories to the entertainment world rather than worldly or “religious” stories.

More specifically, your donation will be used to fund the first two episodes of a 3 Season, 21-Episode Web Series (equipment rentals, location reservations, production design, casting services, production supplies, props, wardrobe, hair and makeup, food and craft services, crew, visual effects, film festival submission, etc.)

The closer we get to our donation goal, the higher our production value will be. 

What We Need & What You Get (Proverbs 30:7-9)

Our donation goal is $20k. This will completely fund 3 months of pre-production, 4 days of principal photography (actual filming with actors), and 2 months of post-production (editing, scoring, and visual effects). 

We have a production crew of 25 and 12 actors, all currently working as volunteers. 

If we do not reach our goal, a minimum total of $10K would fund our pilot episode (but with reduced production value).

Check out the perks on the right side to see what return you'll receive for your donation amount. 

Our Desired Impact (Matthew 18:12-14)

With this dramatic web series, we want to preach!  We want to use the medium of film as a way to change hearts and change the world – one episode at a time. If only one person is impacted by our efforts, we believe it will all be well worth it.

Our Recent Project (Psalm 8:3-9)

Through all the challenges of COVID and quarantine, we have successfully completed a 20-minute short film called Clemency. Our film was nominated for Best Narrative Short in the Faith in Film Short Film Festival. We are currently waiting to hear back from other film festivals. 

Clemency spins a modern twist on the biblical story of Barabbas. Hours away from death, an inmate must grapple with the life choices that got him there and whether his life is worth saving over that of another inmate.

Risk & Challenges (Matthew 19:26)

We have experienced industry professionals involved in this project (i.e. actors, editors, producers, marketers, set design, etc.). We also have a network of “human” resources to call upon for help overcoming any obstacles. 

Other Ways You Can Help (2 Corinthians 9:7)

If you want to help but cannot provide a monetary contribution, please help us get the word out. Share this campaign with your friends, family, and coworkers. Share it on your social media. And most importantly, PRAY!

You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Edited by: Craig A. Ruark

Divorce Diaries follows Michele Traina’s post-divorce journey. An energetic, optimistic, and some say crazy (she says passionate) single mom resetting her life after divorce. Once an actor, now teacher and comic, Michele sets out to fulfill her artistic dreams from which marriage veered her away. 

The Plot

Faced with no other options, Michele moves back home with her Italian parents and grandmother, who is the epitome of a Depends wearing Maleficent. Michele’s life becomes a torturous existence of teaching, competing with the perfect moms, and dating men from the Island of Misfits while trying to raise a young, energetic child. Early in the series, Michele finally earns enough money from teaching to rent an apartment and move out of her parent’s place, but not away from her parents' opinions. She reaches for the stars while hitting a few asteroids along the way.

Amidst late mornings, failed dates, PTA meetings, and parenting challenges, Michele is determined to overcome the tragedy of divorce by finding humor in her social mishaps. She embarks on a second career as a stand-up comic. Perhaps, through her humor, she can also find the love of her life—one that is not technically married.

In Real Life

Michele’s Divorce Diaries stand-up comedy is unique, and bookings were starting to build until the COVID-19 pandemic. As she developed her act, Michele had the idea to create a television show about a working-class divorcee and her quest to get her life back on track. Each episode will show Michele as a fiery Italian with drive and hustle in pursuit of a dream. She is successfully raising her young daughter, despite dealing with her ex-husband and catty school moms, which cause her to lose her cool, occasionally trusting the wrong people, and her inability to quit dating unavailable men.

Michele has self-funded this project, using a small crew and her smartphone. She has teamed with her best friend, Doug Bass a bicoastal, dog walking comedian, and film director, to develop this program. The guy, according to her father, “is the one she should have married.”

Donations toward this project will fund the proof of concept of the show. Any size contribution will count toward the end goal. We hope that Divorce Diaries will be a comedy success and provide a positive social commentary on the lives of single mothers like Michele and their struggle to achieve their dreams.

The video clips on this page show Michele's Divorce Diaries through her social media lens; take a look and laugh with her as she talks about dating as a single parent.

story:
BLACKWATER BLUES, a Murder/Mystery Series

Corin Nemec is an Emmy nominated actor, writer, producer, and director with more than 100 projects under his belt across his 35 years in the Film and Television business. Corin has teamed up with long time friend and actor Jason London, also with more than 100 Film and Television credits to his name. Together, they have created this wonderful, fictional account of the sordid and criminal underworkings in a Gulf Coast town called Blackwater, not far from Biloxi, Mississippi, a town well known for gambling, big money, and short tempers.

Corin Nemec and Jason London are Pollux and Castor Bennington, two ex-cons who grew up around biker gangs and the notorious Gulf Coast Mafia. They are left with a series of cryptic clues as a final parting gift when their grandfather, Poppy Bennington, dies of old age. Upon finding this map to their mother, they set off on a twisted, and sometimes amusing investigation which opens up old wounds and reveals new mysteries. 

In pre-production for the past three months, the team has been perfecting the script, hiring cast and crew, including Trent Dickens, a wonder Director who lives in the town of Ocean Springs, Mississippi. A small, upscale coastal community snuggled between the ocean and the bayous, the real town of Ocean Springs becomes the fictional town of Blackwater, Mississippi, a town with deep secrets that stretch back decades.

Nemec and London are both strongly in support of the independent TV industry. BLACKWATER BLUES has not only received personal financing, but has the full support of the local community. They have successfully brought together an incredible group of talented local Mississippi filmmakers and actors. Full enthusiasm comes from the many local shop owners volunteering their storefronts, the Mayor of Ocean Springs himself, and the incredible support of the Mississippi Film Commission.

Unfortunately, a portion of funding fell through just ahead of the scheduled principle photography start date of November 16. Now, with large personal investments already at stake, the Production team consisting of Benjamin Easterday (EV Productions, Los Angeles) as well as local co-producer Brad Jay, must seek rapid solutions. 

With numerous funding opportunities waiting in the wings to see this dark thriller come to life, the team will develop a short introductory version consisting of key moments from the Pilot script and future episodes. This will continue the consistent momentum, and push the project over the edge into full production.

Shooting the Pilot Presentation is a proven model for success. Corin Nemec experienced this when he and actor David Faustino, along with Seinfeld writer/producer Sam Kass, put up their own money to shoot a presentation for a comedy series titled "STAR-VING.” The series successfully and quickly sold to SONY TV which produced 12 episodes right away. 

With your help, this can again be the case, delivering a proof-of-concept that is undeniable. With the full first season, as well as a five-season arc laid out, there is stellar crew ready to go, a town in full support, two known actors with decades of experience, and a storyline that will keep your head spinning from beginning to end. 

With the incredible combined years of experience among those leveraged deeply in the project, there is a high level of certainty of the outcome of this Pilot Presentation. All that is now lacking is the final funding to provide quality production to move forward independently. It will give you, the audience, a true keyhole view into the deadly, mysterious, and often strange world of BLACKWATER BLUES.

The goal of this fundraiser is to allow the production and success of this short version, offering the introduction of characters, setting, cinematic style, and story in a way that will preview the series as a whole. Taking advantage of all the work that has already gone into the full project, this backing will also ensure production, on a smaller scale, within the original time frame. 

When it comes to television and film financing and support, proof of concept is most important. Not being able to show what is hidden in the 2D pages of a screenplay adds a huge level of complexity to bringing a TV show to air. In a few short minutes, you can experience on film what to expect from the entire series; a show that will keep you guessing at every turn and have you certain that you have solved the crime when only the writers and creators know the nearly impossible to guess truth. 

The Production Team has worked tirelessly, contributing not only personal finances, but extremely valuable time and energy. This is a chance, with your help, to help push BLACKWATER BLUES over the finish line and to fruition. It is not every day you can  tell a friend or neighbor you were instrumental in getting a television series off the ground!

To finance the introductory segment, with a potential running time of 10 minutes, requirements are firm. In addition to pre- and post-production days, the team anticipates a three-day shoot to include the Director, camera team, and all other filming crew. Considering editing, sound design, and SFX, a goal of $15,000 dollars is set. 

With your support, production can continue and remain on track to deliver a condensed, introductory video (sizzle reel) shot as any professional TV show would be, helping realize full production of BLACKWATER BLUES before the end of 2020. 

Although it would serve as a setback not taking advantage of the current enthusiasm for the project, the team is fully prepared to shoot a simpler version in the event the projected goal is not met. This shorter, more commercial style teaser will serve to introduce as many of the primary characters and locations as possible. Regardless of fundraising outcome, no amount will go to waste.

There will be perks for investors! These rewards will be scaled according to the level of support to include such experiences as; walk on parts, Producer credits, set visits, and/or social dinner with Jason London & Corin Nemec. Other items such as autographed scripts, headshots, and TV posters will also be set aside as thank you gifts for supporters at various levels.

If you are not able to help with a donation, we welcome you to join the support team by helping get the word out. Share this campaign with those you think would be interested, follow and amplify the official BLACKWATER BLUES social media sites, and be part of the community that will grow out of this! Indiegogo offers convenient sharing tools here to make every click count.

That said, with your support, the team here at BLACKWATER BLUES will help introduce the world to the ever mysterious, endlessly dangerous, and darkly secretive town of Blackwater, Mississippi. A place where two brothers (Jason London, Corin Nemec) will stop at nothing to solve the murder/disappearance of their beloved mother, and in so doing, reveal a web of corruption so deep in could go all the way to Washington, D.C.

Thank you all for your interest and your time! Much love, and God bless!

 

Sincerely,

The production team of BLACKWATER BLUES

story:
About Meggie Gates and Laura Petro

"See You In Hell" is a short comedic webseries written by Meggie Gates and Laura Petro. The two started writing the series around the time they met and loosely based the episodes on their own real life experiences in the Summer of 2016. 

Since then the two have put on four original sketch revues at The Second City, bopped around the United States performing sketch at various festivals. Meggie was a Writer and Co-creator of Chicago-based webseries "Life of Harold." Laura was the Producer/Creative Producer of sitcom-style-webseries "I Swear It's Not Boring." 

The two live down the hall from each other, they cannot explain enough how excited they are to get this project off the ground. 

What We Need & What You Get

This are the main three things we need:

  • We need to feed our insanely talented crew! (Read more about some of them below)

  • We need to buy some fancy props 
  • We need to get this series into and through post-production so you can see it.

You can read more about perks to the side! We think they are fun perks and we hope you like them too. 

Our Team

Justin Bailey (Director)

Justin Bailey is a Chicago-based director and a very good and talented one at that. He recently graduated from DePaul University with his Master's Degree in Film. Other credits of his include writing and directing the short films "Waves" and "Speechless." He is finishing up his feature directorial debut, "Phil" and he likes professional wrestling. 

Ryan Croft (Director of Photography)

Ryan Croft is an accomplished cinematographer. He has shot a variety of short films, music videos and feature films. He's also an alumnus of DePaul University's Digital Cinema Program. He's focused in more ways than one. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends! Give us a like on Facebook or Instagram! We appreciate your time in reading this, we appreciate your existence in this world!

We need to feed our insanely talented crew! (Read more about some of them below)
We need to buy some fancy props 
We need to get this series into and through post-production so you can see it.

You can read more about perks to the side! We think they are fun perks and we hope you like them too. 

Our Team
Justin Bailey (Director)

Justin Bailey is a Chicago-based director and a very good and talented one at that. He recently graduated from DePaul University with his Master's Degree in Film. Other credits of his include writing and directing the short films "Waves" and "Speechless." He is finishing up his feature directorial debut, "Phil" and he likes professional wrestling. 
Ryan Croft (Director of Photography)

Ryan Croft is an accomplished cinematographer. He has shot a variety of short films, music videos and feature films. He's also an alumnus of DePaul University's Digital Cinema Program. He's focused in more ways than one. 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Tell your friends! Give us a like on Facebook or Instagram! We appreciate your time in reading this, we appreciate your existence in this world!

story:
Who We Are

Rio Helmi and I are passionate visual communicators and passionate about Indonesia. Rio's a well known Indonesian cultural and social photographer, I'm a filmmaker, producer/director, and cameraman and we've come together for a project that we hope will inspire people across Indonesia and around the world. I've provided a bit more about us at the bottom and you can find out more about what we've done at www.swadayafilm.com.

And if you have any questions at all, please feel free to contact us at swadayafilm@gmail.com and one of the team will get back to you.

Swadaya - Our Project and Pitch

Swadaya is a 13 x 30min cultural adventure television series that will give Indonesians, and people around the world, an opportunity to explore and experience the best of Indonesia and her inspiring people, and to remember how culture and society shape the Indonesian experience.

Swadaya, in Indonesian, means self-empowered. Indonesia is at a cross-roads culturally and politically and as her people look for ways forward, we hope Swadaya will help light the way...

For decades many outlying areas of Indonesia have been left behind in the development boom. Even on Java, Indonesia's 'central' and most populous island, local communities often struggle to make ends meet. Sometimes government programs falter for a number of reasons then disillusionment takes root, leading to a plethora of social problems.

Yet there is a special spirit that sometimes shows itself within these underprivileged communities: one of resilience, caring, initiative, creativity, and communal solidarity. A spirit that drives people to create long term programs that benefit their communities in positive ways within the means at their disposal.

And as Indonesians at all levels look towards the future, Swadaya will highlight people and their projects as an inspiration to everyone, at the grass roots level and beyond.

Reaching the Grass Roots

There are amazing stories of Swadaya all across Indonesia (check out our recap below) but to be effective, people everywhere have to see them right? Fortunately, Indonesia's media landscape has a secret weapon... Local TV. BumiHijau Media has been working with Indonesian local television stations for years and, having already distributed over 30,000 programs on environment, health, science and wildlife, has already built a massive audience of tens of millions of viewers for Swadaya, allowing us to launch this series to the exact audience that will get the most out of it and to inspire the very people who will make a difference to the nation.

Our first broadcast of Swadaya will take place on no less than 50 local television stations across the Indonesian archipelago from Aceh in the west to Papua in the east. Here's a map of the stations that we work with:

Your contribution will help us reach that audience, helping to inspire people to have confidence in their own ability to improve their own lot. It will also give Indonesians of all walks of life a better understanding of their hugely diverse country - contributing to greater harmony through greater appreciation of their fellow countrymen.

What We Need & What You Get

Producing any television series is a huge endeavour and Swadaya will explore inspirational projects across Indonesia. The entire series will cost $980,000 US dollars for 13 full episodes including all production, post-production and distribution costs. Individual episodes costs vary but the average, all in, is about $76,000. We're looking for these funds in a variety of places but what we hope to do with you is jump start the process and produce the first 3 episodes. So in order to do that, we're hoping to raise $228,000 through this campaign.

We've got some really cool perks to offer you for partnering with us including:

- Signed custom Rio Helmi prints and customised copies of the Swadaya series

- Executive Producer credits and Thank-You credits in the series

- An opportunity to join us during the production

- Swadaya T-Shirts, Custom Engraved Glasses, and Stickers

- VIP screening passes and dinners with the producers

- And the possibility for equity partnerships

We've laid out the incentives on the perks column on the right but, the most important component in all this is you! We want you to be a part of this series and this project. We want you to be part of the inspiration. We want you to help light the way forward bringing Swadaya to Indonesia and the world.

And if we don't get the funds we need?

That's an important question. Look, we're super motivated to make this series. As soon as we have the funding to complete the first episode, we'll start working. For those of you who have known us a long time, you know how hard we work. And we wouldn't go down this road and be seeking your support if we weren't 120% motivated to make Swadaya a reality. We've opted to keep this campaign going once we've reached our initial goal so that you can continue be a part of the entire process with us.

The Stories

Rio and I are all about story telling. And here's a short list of inspirational Swadaya stories that we want to bring to the screen:

Bamboo Heroes of Bali:

On the slopes of the Kintamani Volcano, a Balinese entrepreneur inspires villages to plant, harvest and sell bamboo - building their livelihoods and preserving their soil.

Motorcycle Gangs and Midwives of Flores:

A family crisis in a remote village motivates a motorcycle gang leader to organise transport for midwives and to teach appropriate technology high in the rugged mountains of Flores.

The Whale Shark Whisperer of Papua:

On a remote coast in West Papua, the people rally around a whale shark whisperer and build fish and lobster aquaculture farms to support their village.

A School for a Village Time Forgot in Lombok:

In a steep valley in Lombok a woman, for whom education was never possible, pulls her village together to build a school so their brightest girls and boys have a chance to succeed.

Small Scale Palm Oil Champions of Riau:

Surrounded by massive commercial palm oil plantations, a group of farmers come together to train as sustainable small-scale growers benefiting their families are preserving their lands.

An Eco-Education School in West Papua:

Far from any public services the tiny village of Malagufuk rallies together and shifts from hunting to eco-tourism bringing international visitors, health care and education.

The Forest Keepers of West Kalimantan:

In West Kalimantan a group of Dayak hunters serve as the guardians of the forest, preserving their way of life and the plants and animals that make up the landscape.

Goat Milk Entrepreneurs of East Java:

The son of an indentured labourer goes to university but, rather than follow his peers into the city, he returns home and develops a small business that inspires and empowers his village.

The Farmer SMS Network of East Kalimantan:

Lack of communications has led to rampant destruction in East Kalimantan but a new SMS network has led to fair trade, regular flow of news, and protection of traditional lands.

The Fisherman and the Tree Farm in East Java:

An outsider rallies fellow fishermen to plant pine trees along the coast preserving fish hatcheries and preventing erosion with the unplanned benefit of developing local tourism.

Making it Green in Aceh:

A former rebel rises and falls to get back up again and stake his entire career on making one of Indonesia’s most militant provinces an example for green economy.

Local Cocoa Farmers to the World in Sulawesi:

Cocoa farmers who’s crops have been ravaged by disease come together and rehabilitate their farms and build a network of direct links to market at the same time.

An Island of Appropriate Technology

The people of Kai have lived on the edge for centuries. But now a women’s co-op sources appropriate technologies bringing their village to the 20th century and benefiting their lives.

 

The Impact

As you look over the stories above, you can imagine how people all across Indonesia, and everywhere, would be touched and inspired by people doing great things under challenging conditions. We, as humans, support each other, inspire each other, and all hope for a better life for our children and their children. And that's what Swadaya is all about. And getting Swadaya out first through Local TV and online, will give the maximum amount of people the opportunity to see it and be inspired themselves.

Moving Forward

Rio has been photographing and writing stories across Indonesia for over 30 years. And my company and I have worked on scores of international and domestic documentary film and television projects over the past few decades. Together, our 50+ years of experience in our creative works and in Indonesia are what's going to make Swadaya a series we can all be proud of and rally around.

I'll be in charge of managing the productions and I've got the awesome team at Jungle Run backing me up. I'll also be responsible for getting Swadaya broadcast through BumiHijau Media's Local TV Partner Network and our team in Jakarta. Rio has been following many of these stories for years and, like you'll see in some of the clips below, has an amazing rapport with the people which will bring Swadaya to life.

Let's Make Noise!!!

This project could never happen without you. So please help us to get the word out far and wide! Together we have an opportunity to help people across Indonesia while producing a series that people everywhere will enjoy. 

Indiegogo can help as well, check out their share tools!

Thank you thank you!!!

Joe & Rio

 

Short Bios:

RIO HELMI:

Rio was born in Switzerland in 1954 to an Indonesian father who was the Indonesian Ambassador to Switzerland and the Vatican, and a Turkish mother. Rio has been capturing images of Asia and writing articles since 1978. His work can be seen in magazines, documentaries and more than 20 large format photographic books.  Solo exhibitions of Rio’s still photography have been held in Bali, Jakarta, Madrid, Miyazaki, Palo Alto, San Francisco, and Sydney, and his works are held in private collections around the world including in Boston, Hong Kong, Jakarta, London, Los Angeles, Rome,  San Francisco, Sydney, Tokyo and Washington.

JOE YAGGI 

Joe's an award winning producer/director who's been based in Indonesia since 1993. Over the past two decades, he’s taken his company from it’s early days in extreme sports into conservation, social communications, and international broadcast television production and support. On the international front he and his team at Jungle Run work with National Geographic, BBC, Discovery Channel and many others. At home they produce documentaries, web series, iterative community and training films that have been seen across the country. Looking to increase the quality and quantity of factual programming available in Indonesia, they started BumiHijau Media and have since distributed over 30,000 programs covering environment, social, health, science and wildlife to Indonesia's local television stations to date. Since then the project has evolved into one of the largest advertising buying and placement networks for Local TV in the country. Joe was born in California, has a degree in anthropology, and has worked around the world.

story:
Wicked Workout is a state-of-the-art  gym where all shapes, sizes, and personalities compete against their exhausted reflection, predicted to accept defeat and return again tomorrow. Tracy Blue, an overly positive exercise nut, manages a staff of four Bostonians, a co-ed pair of personal trainers whose opposite personalities of people pleasing and sarcasm never mix, an immature complainer, and a high-strung know-it-all, along with some eccentric members who frequent the gym including a gorilla chested, weight smashing psycho and an unmotivated husband whose wife forcibly makes him show up. The half-hour sitcom mockumentary pilot shows a typical Friday at Wicked Workout until the crew is asked to decide between themselves who will work the Saturday shift. This new series journey’s through these Bostonian’s workouts where only a select few know what they are doing, and a more select few who even want to be there. Some workout, some work off last night’s beer and Fenway Frank, but they all share an accent and a common drive to leave Wicked Workout feeling better than when they entered.

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • We are hoping to fulfill our quote to acquire new equipment and extend the range of our cast to propel this project to success.
  • We are renting advanced cameras, support rigs, lenses and more.
  • On the character side, we need to extend our cast, for several days of shooting, which can be expensive with talented people. This show thrives on good comedy, and we want to acquire those who can give us just that.
  • We also need to plan, set up, and decorate our set to create this new world that is gonna make you laugh, with posters, stickers, signs, paint, people and a lot of work, we can do it with a little help.

The Impact

 

  • This is our final shot to make something that could really have an impact on the world, shows like The Office reach global audiences and create laughs and smiles daily, this is our main goal.
  • We want to have this show on your home tv, laptop, phone ect. and we believe it will be there in no time with your help.
  • This is not our first film, and you can check out more of our content and past films through Youtube and Vimeo. We have an experienced crew and a common drive to make this project a success in our final semester at URI.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't afford to donate, we get it, that's why we're here. Please share this link like wild fire and spread the word that a new show is on the horizon and it's ready for success.
  • Utilize the share tools on this page!

story:
Overview

“Cyber Cadets” is the passion project of creators Tamera Davis and Tatiana Youpa, who aimed to create a pilot that would push the boundaries of what audiences have come to expect from a children’s show by combining sensitive storytelling with exciting, sci-fi visuals.

Principal photography wrapped in 2018, and now we need your help to finish post-production and get “Cyber Cadets” on screens in front of viewers around the world!

 

Short Summary

“Cyber Cadets” is a pilot for a half-hour sci-fi series aimed at tweens. It tells the story of three 6th graders from unique backgrounds who find themselves stuck together at an after-school computer club. When their instructor, the elusive and scatterbrained campus IT technician, fails to show up, their curiosity gets the best of them and they discover a secret laboratory hidden in an old room at the back of the classroom. One thing leads to another and they suddenly find themselves transported to a virtual world on the verge of a meltdown. With the help of their instructor, they must learn to work together to stop the system from crashing and get back home before they’re stuck in a computer forever. Oh, and there’s a big scary monster that won’t leave them alone.

 

Who We Are

Tamera Davis - Writer/Executive ProducerTamera is currently a creative assistant at Netflix in the Original Series Drama development team. Before graduating from New York University, Gallatin School of Individualized Study, she co-wrote Cyber Cadets and was the co-showrunner and executive producer of the TV pilot. She is also a television writer and aspires to tell diverse young adult/teen stories.

 

Tatiana Youpa - Writer/Executive Producer/DirectorTatiana grew up in a small town on the Northern California coast before her passion for children’s media drew her to NYC to study at NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts. She graduated in 2018 with a BA in Cinema Studies and a BFA in Film & TV Production. She currently resides in Brooklyn and works as a Design Coordinator on Nick Jr.’s hit show “Blaze and the Monster Machines”. When she isn’t designing tricked out monster trucks, she volunteers for North Brooklyn Mutual Aid, a local community-driven organization, and stays up to date on all the latest and greatest animated films from around the world.

 

Gabriella Salemi - Director

Gabriella is a graduate of NYU Tisch where she majored in Film and TV production. She strives to create content that is unique and entertaining, in addition to having high artistic value. She one day hopes to own her own production company to foster female artists.

 

Where Your Money Goes

POST-PRODUCTION AND BEYOND!

Given the nature of producing a live-action sci-fi, “Cyber Cadets” requires extensive visual effects work to fully achieve our vision. With your help, we will be able to complete the following:

  • Locked Picture Edit
  • Sound Design / Mixing
  • Finalized VFX and Compositing
  • Full Archiving / Backup of project and generated media files

 

Any leftover funds will be used to submit “Cyber Cadets” to TV Pilot festivals around the world.

 

Why This Matters

“As a child, children’s television had a huge impact on how I viewed the world and myself in it. Since late middle school, I struggled opening up to others and finding a place where I belonged. That’s also when my anxiety began. I know I would have loved and appreciated seeing a kid on screen who was going through my struggles and still succeeding, so that I knew everything was going to be okay. The protagonist of Cyber Cadets, Rosa, has anxiety and the two other cadets have their own challenges, which never make them weak, just unique. They see the world differently, which makes them the best superheroes of all. Growing up, kids on children's TV shows were just too perfect. Kids need Cyber Cadets because it will show them that their “imperfections” are not only their strengths, but their superpowers.” - Tamera Davis, writer, executive producer

 

“Cyber Cadets is a project that I’m very proud to have been a part of since its original conception in our Writing for Children’s TV class in the fall of 2017. While the script has evolved in innumerable ways over the course of 6 months, the central theme of our project has remained the same: to tell a story that shows how the things that make us different can also be our strengths. As someone passionate about intelligent and creative children’s media, I am excited to work with a great team of talented men and women to create a television pilot for a show we believe in.” -Tatiana Youpa, writer, executive producer, director

 

“The thing that’s unique about Cyber Cadets is the kids. In a lot of the children’s TV we see today, the tweens seem to be very ‘cookie-cutter’ we wanted to show kids that face real struggles and react to them in a human way. Whether they’re saving the universe or finding a table at lunch, these kids experience the same emotions as any middle schooler would. Growing up is hard enough and we want our viewers to relate and resonate with what they see on the screen. If we can inspire someone with our work, then we’ve done our job. I want Cyber Cadets to get kids excited while also showing them that each of us has something special to offer.” -Gabriella Salemi, director

 

Risks & Challenges

Post-production on “Cyber Cadets” was abruptly put on hold in early 2020 when Tatiana’s father, Daniel Youpa, suffered a sudden and massive ischemic stroke. As one of the most active champions and funders of this project, it was a massive blow not only to the Youpa family but to the “Cyber Cadets” team as well. 

Despite this, we have persevered towards our goal of sharing “Cyber Cadets” with the world and making our cheerleaders proud. We've put our heart and soul into this project, and we're so excited to finally have a finished product.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word! Share our campaign on social media. Tell your friends, family, neighbors, the milkman, the mail-woman, your babysitter. Plus, the kids! This project is for the kids, so help us get them excited for this project.

We genuinely appreciate your help. This show means a lot to our team, so thanks for coming on this journey with us.

 

Sincerely,

Cyber Cadets Team
story_txt:
Overview
“Cyber Cadets” is the passion project of creators Tamera Davis and Tatiana Youpa, who aimed to create a pilot that would push the boundaries of what audiences have come to expect from a children’s show by combining sensitive storytelling with exciting, sci-fi visuals.
Principal photography wrapped in 2018, and now we need your help to finish post-production and get “Cyber Cadets” on screens in front of viewers around the world!
 
Short Summary
“Cyber Cadets” is a pilot for a half-hour sci-fi series aimed at tweens. It tells the story of three 6th graders from unique backgrounds who find themselves stuck together at an after-school computer club. When their instructor, the elusive and scatterbrained campus IT technician, fails to show up, their curiosity gets the best of them and they discover a secret laboratory hidden in an old room at the back of the classroom. One thing leads to another and they suddenly find themselves transported to a virtual world on the verge of a meltdown. With the help of their instructor, they must learn to work together to stop the system from crashing and get back home before they’re stuck in a computer forever. Oh, and there’s a big scary monster that won’t leave them alone.
 
Who We Are
Tamera Davis - Writer/Executive ProducerTamera is currently a creative assistant at Netflix in the Original Series Drama development team. Before graduating from New York University, Gallatin School of Individualized Study, she co-wrote Cyber Cadets and was the co-showrunner and executive producer of the TV pilot. She is also a television writer and aspires to tell diverse young adult/teen stories.
 
Tatiana Youpa - Writer/Executive Producer/DirectorTatiana grew up in a small town on the Northern California coast before her passion for children’s media drew her to NYC to study at NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts. She graduated in 2018 with a BA in Cinema Studies and a BFA in Film & TV Production. She currently resides in Brooklyn and works as a Design Coordinator on Nick Jr.’s hit show “Blaze and the Monster Machines”. When she isn’t designing tricked out monster trucks, she volunteers for North Brooklyn Mutual Aid, a local community-driven organization, and stays up to date on all the latest and greatest animated films from around the world.
 
Gabriella Salemi - Director

Gabriella is a graduate of NYU Tisch where she majored in Film and TV production. She strives to create content that is unique and entertaining, in addition to having high artistic value. She one day hopes to own her own production company to foster female artists.
 

Where Your Money Goes
POST-PRODUCTION AND BEYOND!
Given the nature of producing a live-action sci-fi, “Cyber Cadets” requires extensive visual effects work to fully achieve our vision. With your help, we will be able to complete the following:

Locked Picture Edit
Sound Design / Mixing
Finalized VFX and Compositing
Full Archiving / Backup of project and generated media files


 
Any leftover funds will be used to submit “Cyber Cadets” to TV Pilot festivals around the world.
 
Why This Matters
“As a child, children’s television had a huge impact on how I viewed the world and myself in it. Since late middle school, I struggled opening up to others and finding a place where I belonged. That’s also when my anxiety began. I know I would have loved and appreciated seeing a kid on screen who was going through my struggles and still succeeding, so that I knew everything was going to be okay. The protagonist of Cyber Cadets, Rosa, has anxiety and the two other cadets have their own challenges, which never make them weak, just unique. They see the world differently, which makes them the best superheroes of all. Growing up, kids on children's TV shows were just too perfect. Kids need Cyber Cadets because it will show them that their “imperfections” are not only their strengths, but their superpowers.” - Tamera Davis, writer, executive producer “Cyber Cadets is a project that I’m very proud to have been a part of since its original conception in our Writing for Children’s TV class in the fall of 2017. While the script has evolved in innumerable ways over the course of 6 months, the central theme of our project has remained the same: to tell a story that shows how the things that make us different can also be our strengths. As someone passionate about intelligent and creative children’s media, I am excited to work with a great team of talented men and women to create a television pilot for a show we believe in.” -Tatiana Youpa, writer, executive producer, director
 
“The thing that’s unique about Cyber Cadets is the kids. In a lot of the children’s TV we see today, the tweens seem to be very ‘cookie-cutter’ we wanted to show kids that face real struggles and react to them in a human way. Whether they’re saving the universe or finding a table at lunch, these kids experience the same emotions as any middle schooler would. Growing up is hard enough and we want our viewers to relate and resonate with what they see on the screen. If we can inspire someone with our work, then we’ve done our job. I want Cyber Cadets to get kids excited while also showing them that each of us has something special to offer.” -Gabriella Salemi, director

 
Risks & Challenges
Post-production on “Cyber Cadets” was abruptly put on hold in early 2020 when Tatiana’s father, Daniel Youpa, suffered a sudden and massive ischemic stroke. As one of the most active champions and funders of this project, it was a massive blow not only to the Youpa family but to the “Cyber Cadets” team as well. 
Despite this, we have persevered towards our goal of sharing “Cyber Cadets” with the world and making our cheerleaders proud. We've put our heart and soul into this project, and we're so excited to finally have a finished product.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Please spread the word! Share our campaign on social media. Tell your friends, family, neighbors, the milkman, the mail-woman, your babysitter. Plus, the kids! This project is for the kids, so help us get them excited for this project.
We genuinely appreciate your help. This show means a lot to our team, so thanks for coming on this journey with us.
 
Sincerely,
Cyber Cadets Team

story:
What's This Show About?

Failing Upward is a slice-of-life story about two very different best friends who are far apart, but stuck together.

Cody Palmer is a nerdy, naive slacker who's getting used to living on his own in the city for the first time and JC Burton is a diligent, cynical musician who's been forced to move back in with her family. After a chance meeting, the two formed an unlikely friendship and now rely on each other to stay sane as they transition into adulthood. The show revolves around phone calls between the two, as they talk about their lives and misadventures, and are peppered with surreal flashbacks and fantasies. Whether it's finding jobs, dealing with oddball friends, debating horribly obscure pop-culture and bands, or grappling with the impending responsibility that keeps them up at night, Cody and JC will always have something to chat about.

We really wanted to make a cartoon that captured the essence of shows we loved growing up, while telling a story that people could relate to. There's always been something magic about chatting on the phone with a friend and using your mind to fill in the blanks as the person on the other end talks about their day. Combining the crushing reality of adulthood with wild imagination has always been the standout quality of this project and we know we've got a great story to tell here.

If you're a fan of stuff like Scott Pilgrim, Daria, or cult cartoons like Mission Hill or MTV's Downtown, Failing Upward will be a new favorite!

Interested? Of course you are! Check out the pilot here!

The Team 

The team for Failing Upward consists of a variety of different skills and styles. Together, we want to hone our talents and create new feel and look for the show. 

Gary Trimarchi (Writer/Creator) 

Gary is young screenwriter and graduate of NYU with a strong love for animation. He recently curated and hosted the first annual TromAnimation Film Festival. He is also a re-occurring guest on Pizza Party Podcast. Gary wrote both the original 30 minute and web pilot for Failing Upward and will continue to write the series. 

Jack "HiJackFB" Bowdler (Co-Lead Animator) 

Jack is an up and coming award nominated animator. His mixed-media short, Garden Stroll, displayed a strong command over combining visuals with music that fit the show perfectly. Jack will be in charge of the main phone segments where Cody and JC talk.

Jaime "JaimeR" Rodriguez (Co-Lead Animator)

If you're into offbeat animation, Jaime's name will ring more than a bell. His most popular short, A Prank Time, has been highly regarded  in the indie animation community. Recently, he has worked with Brian Wysol and Justin Roiland on the Adult Swim pilot Hot Streets. Jaime's work on the show will be to bring Cody and JC's bizarre fantasies to life.

Natalie "MissButler" Butler (Character Design & Backgrounds)

No stranger to slice of life stories, Natalie Butler is a popular webcomic artist who's series, Too Much Caffeine, has amassed a strong fan base and has been collected into a published book. Her role in the show's development will be to come up with new designs for characters and backgrounds to build the world Cody and JC live in.

Wesley "Skrib" Enns (Storyboards)

Wes has been collecting a strong portfolio of original and  commissioned animation, over the last two years. The latter of which has been for well-known Youtube personalities like Steven Suptic and VineSauce. Wes' position will have him working from our scripts to plan out our storyboards. 

Matthew Pop (Music)

Brooklyn indie label Drink More Records, run by singer/songwriter Matthew Pop (who provided our theme song), has agreed to let us use their growing library of artists in the show. Matt himself has had his music featured on hit shows like The Real World and Skins. 

Benefits And Our Mission

*No major studio involvement, quicker turn-around from production to completion.

*A highly collaborative environment where everyone's ideas are taken into consideration.

*Very close engagement with fans, as well as opportunity for critical feedback to make the show stronger.

*Freedom to be experimental with format, storytelling, tone, and music.

The team for Failing Upward consists of a group of hardworking independent artists who want to bring the best show possible to it's fans. So much so that we funded the initial pilot, out of pocket, to show you how dedicated we are to making a quality cartoon. Being a series of short, three minute episodes, Failing Upward would have a hard time finding a place on television, making Youtube a perfect platform. Not only will this allow us to work without studio mandates, but it'll let us experiment and tweak the show, as we make it, to make sure it's great. Fans will also be able to follow us on our journey! Through streams and updates, you can get a glimpse of our process. 

Testimonials

In addition to the amazing fans who've get kept this project alive over several years, here's a short video of some super cool (and very talented) people who want Failing Upward to happen.

 
The Future
 
We want Failing Upward to become a full fledged series! Of course, more episodes means more money. We set out for five episodes, because we felt that would be the most efficient way to see these characters in a serialized format, get an idea of how the show flows, and hopefully get you excited for more. 
 
Currently, we're planning a series of stretch goals that will allow for more episodes, if this campaign does well. 
 

 

One of the biggest things we wanted to do with this project was give our team a fair salary for their work. Before we launched the campaign, we discussed payments and hours with them and agreed on individual contracts for everyone involved, based on what they'd be doing. The majority of the budget is going to their efforts to ensure that this show looks and feels awesome. 

The rest of the funds will go to rewards, shipping, and other crowdfunding fees. 

Timeline

The overall production should take around a year, and should arrive in late-March/early-April. Episodes will be released once a week, for five weeks. The timeline itself is as follows:

April 2017: Script polishing, initial voice work

May 2017: Background design, Additional character design 

June 2017: Storyboarding/Animatics

July 2017 - February 2018: Animation, editing, and additional ADR. During this time perks will also be ordered and shipped

March 2017 - April 2018: One episode released per week, for five weeks

We've got a bunch of amazing rewards to give for those generous enough to donate! All non-exclusive perks bundle as you go up, but higher tier, limited rewards are all bundled with everything 100 and under. Please note that not all perk art is 100% final and that this page will be updated when possible! If you have any inquieries about any perk, please send us a message!

$35: A set of postcards with and a super cool sticker and pin set by Jack Bowdler!

$50: An exclusive poster with art by Natalie Butler!

 
$80: A super cool, campaign exclusive cassette tape of bonus audio content from Cody and JC's answering machine and a comic book detailing Cody and JC's origins! 
 
 
$100: You can snag some stuff from JC and Cody's room! This includes a mixtape from JC and an RPG sheet stylized as a parchment from Cody! 
$200: Get this limited edition line-art t-shirt of Cody and JC by Jack Bowdler! 
 
 
$300: A set of limited edition figurines of Cody and JC! This is the only time we'll ever produce these figurines in this style. These will be approximately 5in and hand painted! Actual prototypes to be uploaded soon!
 
 

Failing Upward consists of some amazing up and coming talents, but this is an independently run show with a small crew. As such, life events, as well as unforeseen circumstances might interrupt the workflow. While we don't expect this to be a major issue, certain aspects of the production may get delayed.

Keeping viewers engaged and interested in our production will also be a hurdle. We're well aware that publicity for an up and coming show can be challenging out of the gate. 

Special Thanks

Without the support of fans over the years, this campaign would not be possible. By following our Facebook page and sharing the pilot, you've helped us immensely! Thank you!

The making of this IndieGoGo page was aided by many generous artists...

Ahmad Alami (Header Art, Writing Assistance)

Jack Bowdler (Display Art, Header Art, Perk Art)

Natalie Butler (Header Art, Perk Art)

Colin Drum (Perk Video Green Screen)

Wesley Enns (Perk Art, Header Art)

Iris Amelia Febres (Header Designer) 

Bridgette O. (Perk Art, 3D Models)

Thania Rios (Writing Assistance)

Jaime Rodriguez (Header Art)

story:
Everything I Wish I Didn’t Know is a Quibi-style family comedy (ten episodes, each ten minutes in length) about a driven West Nashville family that lost its connections to other in the daily grind of life. When the Covid quarantine hits Nashville in March 2020, Sarah and Lee lock down at home with their youngest daughter, Ash, and her girlfriend, Kerri, while their oldest daughter, Jess, joins them remotely from Los Angeles, where she’s working to restart her career as a television writer. 

Through Twilight marathons and brutal games of Monopoly, they quickly learn that they still love each other, quirks and all, but there’s a problem: Sarah and Lee have both been carrying on romantic relationships at work, relationships they maintain remotely during quarantine. 

Everything I Wish I Didn’t Know explores the themes of familial and romantic love, loyalty, and how people relate to one another. If relationships are messy, then family is bedlam.
