story_txt:
FIND THE LATEST NEWS ON MOOMINVALLEY'S OFFICIAL SOCIAL MEDIA PAGES:Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/MoominvalleyTV/Twitter: https://twitter.com/moominvalleytvInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/moominvalleytv/The Indiegogo updates are no longer in use. 日本語バージョンはここをクリックしてください。Tove Jansson published her first Moomin book in 1945. This was the beginning of the legendary Moomin characters that later evolved into dozens of books, toys, tv series, films and even theme parks that have been adored by millions of fans all over the world. Now we are bringing MOOMIN back as an innovative new television animation, which will help bring Moomin to a new generation – and to our screens in a way never seen before. The series will be made using state-of-the-art CGI technology combined with more traditional hand-drawn techniques. Each episode is based on an original storyline or incident from the novels and comic strips. The new series will premiere in 2019, starting with 13 episodes.We want this to be the most faithful version of Tove Jansson’s stories yet committed to screen so for the first time ever, we are inviting YOU, our faithful fans, to become part of the production process and to create the best Moomin series yet! See concept art images below.  See concept art images below.  In 1945 ‘The Moomins and the Great Flood‘ was published in Finland by the Finnish writer and illustrator Tove Jansson. Inspired by the fantastical adventures she read as a child, by the likes of Jules Verne, it first introduced the world to the Moomins – a curious, friendly type of troll. Their ancestors supposedly lived behind the round, tall ceramic stoves typical in the Nordic countries. The Moomin family settles in an idyllic valley – a magical and exciting place, it is their whole world. Eight further Moomin novels were to follow, along with four picture books and a long-running comic strip. In the decades since, the growing worldwide popularity of the Moomins has spawned plays, theme parks, merchandise, TV series and films. Today the Moomins are more popular than ever, and their core values of courage, respect for nature, good humour and tolerance have never been more vital. The main character in the series is Moomintroll, who is curious, kind, sensitive and idealistic. His is a typical coming-of-age story, as he tackles the puzzle of growing up in his own unique way, while remaining a beloved part of the family.     Calm and collected, Moominmamma is the reassuring foundation of the Moomin family. Moominmamma runs her household with unflappable ease, ensuring that her family is happy and that any guest who sets foot over the threshold is made to feel welcome and wanted.  Self-confidence has never been a problem for the charismatic Moominpappa. Childish and anarchic, he does not believe in making plans but lives for the moment and for the thrill of adventure.    Snufkin spends half the year wandering the woods and mountains ‘alone’, as this carefree vagabond usually likes it. Self-sufficient and independent, Snufkin is an expert outdoorsman who is at home in the wilderness and has no need for material things.   Mischievous, blunt and just a bit bossy, Little My is a tiny bundle of energy. Adopted by the Moomin family, she lives in the Moominhouse variously in balls of yarn, kitchen drawers, and even people’s pockets.   Happy and energetic, the Snorkmaiden is Moomintroll's friend, playmate, and companion. She's playful and fun, if rather vain, and more than happy to be swept up in his make-believe world of romantic quests. Next to Snufkin, Sniff is Moomintroll’s best friend and they spend a lot of time together. Sniff is scared of the sea, storms, hard work and much more. The only thing that will encourage him to take risks is the prospect of riches.To learn more about Moomin, visit www.moomin.comWe want to produce MOOMIN with YOUR HELP! We came to Indiegogo to give thousands of Moomin fans across the world the opportunity to become part of the production, get their hands on some exclusive merchandise and once-in- a lifetime experiences. All the money raised through our Indiegogo campaign will go towards our visual development costs that consist of different (but equally important) sections, such as creating a unique 2D/3D-animation technique, character design, and character rigging. With your help, we will be able to develop a new animation technique which combines the best qualities of 2D and 3D. This new technique will ensure that the series stays loyal to the graphic, minimalist world of Tove’s illustrations, whilst bringing the Moominvalley to life with all its wonderful colours and details.We've calculated that we need a minimum of $200,000 for the visual development. If we go over that amount, we will be able to expand into other areas of development at an early stage and be able to release more material for you to see and to release more exclusive perks.  Our core creative team consists of award-winning professionals from both Finland and the UK. All those involved have a strong lifelong connection to the Moomins. The show is directed by Oscar®-winning director Steve Box, who is best known for WALLACE & GROMIT: THE CURSE OF THE WERE-RABBIT. The series is produced by Gutsy Animations, a production company based in Tove Jansson’s home city of Helsinki, in Finland. The award-winning creative team has experience ranging from animation to feature films, and commercials to television.Marika Makaroff is the executive producer and creative director of the series. She is the creative force behind award-winning drama and entertainment series like The Apprentice and Got Talent. John Woolley is a BAFTA®-winning producer, with great experience in animation from a variety of 2D/3D/Stop frame-productions, including many years at the prestigious Aardman Studio in Bristol. Nick Ostler and Mark Huckerby are Emmy®-winning and BAFTA®-nominated writing partners, who are co-head writing the series together with Steve Box. They are best known for writing animation shows including Peter Rabbit, Danger Mouse, and Shaun the Sheep. Pekka Kuusisto and Samuli Kosminen are the composers responsible for making the valley sound the way it should: filled with adventure and fantasy, through the changing seasons, with Woodies, Niblings and other creatures hiding in its nooks and crannies.Animation studio Piñata is a world-class animation and illustration studio based in Helsinki, Finland. Their exceptional team consists of illustrators, animators, and VFX professionals, that will be the muscle behind the visual development process.We know how much our fans love Moomin so we wanted to create a wide range of amazing perks that we know you will enjoy. All the perks you find on our Indiegogo page are carefully handpicked and exclusively designed to our backers. The merchandise will mainly be designed using the imaginary of the new MOOMIN series.      Note that the Snufkin Inspired Backpack is a model product and there might be some slight modifications and colours changes to the backpack. Find more info on the Moomin Experience in the FAQ section and more perks from the right side of our Indiegogo page. You can find more images of the perks in the Image Gallery below the video player.   Thank you for supporting!Share your own personal Indiegogo link on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or anywhere on the web. If your friends end up contributing to the campaign, for every dollar they contribute we’ll match their contribution amount with the equal amount of Moomin Points. Here’s how it works:1) Login to Indiegogo.2) Create your personal share link by clicking on the “Link” icon button or click on one of the social media buttons. Copy and share your unique link with all your friends on social media, email etc.3) You can keep track of your referral progress by clicking on the "Referrals" in your Indiegogo “My Profile" page.The referral campaign will run until the end of the campaign.One of the main challenges will be that the release date of the series could be delayed due to unforeseen circumstances. Another challenge worth mentioning is that budgets tend to change. Fortunately, we have drafted a very precise budget for the visual development of the upcoming MOOMIN series to prevent any big changes from happening. If there are any significant changes in the plans, we will keep you updated! One way to be involved in our campaign is to purchase our exclusive perks, available only during this Indiegogo-campaign or by donating money by clicking the pink “back it” button next to our pitch video. However, if you wish to help us but cannot support our project financially, there are a lot of things you can do!  LIKE Moomin on FacebookFOLLOW Moomin on Twitter and InstagramREFER YOUR FRIENDS, FAMILY & FELLOW MOOMIN FANS by sharing our campaign link by email or on Social Media by using the Indiegogo share tools or by sharing this short link: www.igg.me/at/moominWRITE A BLOGGET CREATIVE Do you have another idea? Go for it!SIGN UP to Moomin newsletter for the latest news by visiting our official MOOMIN TV series website at: www.moomin.comThe official hashtag for this campaign is #MoominGoGo      Click here for MOOMIN Media KitFor media inquiries please contact: caitlin@riotcommunications.comCaitlin Allen | Publicist I Riot Communications What does a fixed goal mean?If the minimum funding goal of $200,000 isn’t met, all backers will be reimbursed. This means we only get to keep the amount of money raised if we reach 100% of our funding goal. It also means there is no risk for you, it's all or nothing ;)When will I get my perks (general)?You will find the estimated shipping date attached to each perk. Some of the perks will be sent out before the premiere of the series. We will inform the backers if there are any changes to the shipping dates.  When will I receive my clips of animatic?You will receive your clips of animatic in March 2019. Please note that the clips of animatic has not been counted in when drafting the shipping time for each perk.For what age are the Moomin books suitable? The Moomin books are suitable for all ages – whether you want to read them to your toddler or for your own amusement! These books can be read when in primary school but they are vastly popular among adults as well. In other words, the Moomin books have something to give for every age range :)When should I send you my painting or an idea for the perk ”See Your Art in the Series”? You should send your painting or an idea to us by the end of July 2017. We will contact you about this closer to the date we will need your work/idea by.Am I going to be able to buy these perk items after the campaign has ended / anywhere else?Apart from a few items (release of the tv series and books mainly) the perks chosen and created for this campaign will NOT be available after the campaign is over and they are not sold anywhere else.Can I buy two or more perks at the same time?Unfortunately, Indiegogo does not have a shopping cart to buy many items at the same time. This is why we have created some bundles, which is an easy way for you to get all the essential items at one go.Where can I find information on the perks, campaign, the show etc. after the campaign? Make sure to bookmark our Indiegogo page as we will use it to keep posting updates about our campaign and perks. You can follow Moomin on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram and make sure to sign up for Moomin.com’s newsletter to ensure you will get the latest information on the upcoming MOOMIN series. Keep in contact by e-mailing us: tv@moomin.com.When will the series be released? What is the current state of the series?The first 13 episodes of the series will be released in 2019, the next 13 will be released in early 2020. Right now, the first 13 scripts are ready and concept art is being made whilst we plan the creation of the CGI-Moomintroll and his family.When and where will the voice roles be recorded?The voice acting is scheduled to take place in October 2018 either in Bristol or London. We will keep you updated on the exact date and time.What is the Moomin experience?We want to invite you for a once in a lifetime trip to Finland, the land of Tove Jansson and Moomins. The trip takes place in the coldest season of them all - winter. Be prepared to spend the best five days of your life in chilly temperatures following Tove Jansson’s footsteps visiting the must-see places for all Moomin fans. The preliminary plans is that we will take you to the Moomin museum, Moominworld and Tove Jansson’s atelier to name a few. We will provide you this all-inclusive trip with high-quality accommodation and flights to and from Finland.You will get the opportunity to enjoy some Finnish activities such as, going to a sauna and swimming in a frozen lake. Or perhaps you’d like to try ice-fishing and cross-country skiing? To top your trip, you will get the exceptional opportunity to spend some time with members of the production team and meet Sophia Jansson, the niece of Tove Jansson.What does the goodie bag include?A hand-picked selection of the most exclusive items. If you have special requests, please let us know at tv@moomin.com.Who is running the Indiegogo campaign?The Indiegogo campaign is run by Gutsy Animations and the MOOMIN TV series production team members in collaboration with Spaceboy Crowdfunding Agency. 
Please contact this address if you have more questions: tv@moomin.com    
Japanese version: トーベ・ヤンソンはムーミンの第一作を1945年に発表しました。これが、後に世界中の数百万のファンに愛されている数多くの本、おもちゃ、テレビシリーズ、映画そしてテーマパークにまで発展する、ムーミンの伝説的なキャラクターたちの始まりでした。 そしていま、私たちは再びムーミンを革新的な新しいテレビアニメーションの場に登場させ、ムーミンを新しい世代に紹介し、いまだかつて見たことのないスクリーンに連れ出すサポートをします。本シリーズは、最新のCGI技術を、従来の手書き技術と組み合わせて使用し、製作が進められる予定です。各エピソードはオリジナルストーリーか、小説やコミックシリーズからのエピソードをベースにします。新シリーズは2019年にプレミア予定で、13エピソードで開始されます。私たちとしては本シリーズを最もトーベ・ヤンソンの原作に忠実なものにしたいと思っていますが、かつてない新鮮なものをスクリーンに映し出したいとも思っています。そこで大ファンである皆様に本製作プロセスと、史上最高のムーミンシリーズの作成に参加していただきたいと思っています!   1945年に、フィンランドで、フィンランド人の小説家でありイラストレーターでもあるトーベ・ヤンソンが『小さなトロールと大きな洪水』を出版しました。作者が子供のころに読んだジュール・ヴェルヌのようなファンタスティック・アドベンチャーにインスピレーションを受けたこの本は、好奇心旺盛な、フレンドリーなトロール、ムーミンを世界に紹介しました。 ムーミンたちの祖先は、北欧国家でよく見られる、丸くて大きなセラミック製のストーブの裏で生活しているとされていました。ムーミン一家は田園風景の広がる、魔法のようなエキサイティングな場所に住んでいて、そこが彼らの全世界です。第一作以外に次いで小説が八作品出版された後、絵本を四本そして、長いコミックシリーズも出版されました。その時から数十年にわたり、世界中でムーミンの人気は高まり続け、劇、テーマパーク、グッズ、テレビシリーズや映画を生み出しました。現在ムーミンの人気はかつてないほど高まり、勇気、自然への畏敬、優れたユーモアそして包容力といったキャラクターの持つ核心部分は今までになく重要視されています。 シリーズのメインキャラクターはムーミントロールです。彼は好奇心が旺盛で、人当たりが良く、ちょっと神経質で、理想主義的なところがあります。ストーリーは典型的な成長物語で、彼は成長に伴う問題にユニークな方法で挑んで行きますが、同時に彼は愛する家族の一員でもあり続けています。  落ち着いていて、しっかり者のムーミンママはムーミン一家が安心して暮らせるように気を回しています。ムーミンママはいつも冷静に家族を導きます。家族が常に幸せで、ムーミン屋敷がいつも家族や友だち、お客さまにとって、安全で、愛に満ちあふれた場所であるのは、このムーミンママのおかげです。 カリスマ性のあるムーミンパパは、自分自身に誇りを持っています。好奇心旺盛で、冒険を好み、予定を立てることはしません。また一瞬一瞬を楽しみ、冒険のスリルに目がありません。 スナフキンは「一人きり」で森や山で半年ほど過ごします。この気軽な、さすらいの旅人はいつもこんな感じです。ひとりが好きで、独立したスナフキンは野外で過ごすプロであり、荒れ地に家を持っていて、生活に必要なものは最小限です。  バタバタしていて、ちょっと怒りんぼ、でも面倒見のいいちびのミイはエネルギーの塊です。ムーミン一家とともに生活しているミイはムーミン屋敷の毛糸の玉の中、キッチンの戸棚、誰かのポケットの中など様々な場所に隠れることができます。  いつもハッピーで元気なスノークのお嬢さんは、ムーミントロールの友人でもあり、ガールフレンドでもあります。おじょうさんは楽しいキャラクターですが、少々空想家でロマンチックな空想で満ちた妄想の世界を漂うのが大好きです。 スナフキンの次に、スニフはムーミントロールの親友であり、よく一緒に過ごしています。スニフは海、嵐、大変な仕事などが苦手です。宝物を守るときだけは、勇気を出して挑んでいきます。ムーミンに関する詳細は www.moomin.comを参照してください。皆さんのサポートでムーミンを製作したいと思っています。 私たちはIndiegogoを通じて、世界中に何千といるムーミンファンに製作に参加し、限定のグッズを手に入れ、一生に一度きりの経験に参加する機会を提供しています。 本 Indiegogo キャンペーンを通じてファンドライズされた全額は、独自の2D/3Dアニメーション技術の製作、キャラクターデザイン、キャラクターリギングといった様々な（そしてどれも同様に重要な）セクションで構成されるビジュアル開発費用として使用されます。皆さんからのサポートで、最高レベルの2Dと3Dを併せ持つ新しいアニメーション技術の開発が可能になります。 新しい技術により、シリーズはグラフィック、トーベのイラストレーションのミニマルな世界観に対し忠実に製作でき、ムーミン谷を美しい色やデティールで生き生きと描き出すことができます。ビジュアル開発のために最低でも$200,000が必要であると算出しました。目標金額を上回った場合、初期的段階において金額をそのほかの開発分野に発展させることが可能になり、より一層のマテリアルを解放し、皆様に見ていただいたり、より多くの限定特典の提供ができるようになります。私たちのクリエイティブチームには、フィンランドおよびイギリスに拠点を持つ、受賞歴を持つプロがいます。チームメンバーは皆、ムーミンとの一生にわたる長期間の繋がりを持っています。番組はオスカー®受賞歴のある監督 Steve Box（代表作、ウォレスとグルミット: 野菜畑で大ピンチ )により監督されます。本シリーズは、トーベ・ヤンソンの故郷、フィンランド、ヘルシンキに拠点を置くプロダクション会社、Gutsy Animations社により製作されます。受賞歴のある本クリエイティブチームはアニメーションから、長編映画、テレビ向けのコマーシャルまで幅広い経験を持ちます。Marika Makaroffはシリーズのエグゼクティブプロデューサーおよびクリエイティブディレクターです。彼女はThe ApprenticeやGot Talentといった受賞歴のあるドラマやバラエティ番組シリーズを支える、クリエイティブな推進力です。 John Woolleyは BAFTA®受賞プロデューサーで、ブリストルの有名なAardman Studioでの数年間の経験も含む、様々な 2D/3D/ストップモーションのプロダクションといったアニメーションでの経験を有しています。  Nick Ostler と Mark Huckerby はエミー賞®受賞およびBAFTA®にノミネートされた脚本パートナーで、Steve Boxと共にシリーズの脚本も書いています。ピーターラビット、デンジャーマウスおよび羊のショーン などのアニメーションでも知られています。 Pekka KuusistoおよびSamuli Kosminenはムーミン村の音の製作を担当しているコンポーザーです。彼らは、ムーミン村が厳しい季節を通じて冒険やファンタジーに満ち溢れ、ウッディ、ニブリングそして遠くに隠れているその他の生物たちもいるように音を製作します。Animation studio Piñata は、フィンランドのヘルシンキに拠点を置く、ワールドクラスのアニメーションおよびイラストレーションスタジオです。たぐいまれなる才能を持つチームには、イラストレーター、アニメーター、VFXの専門家が在籍していて、ビジュアル開発プロセスの屋台骨となります。私たちはムーミンのファンがどれだけムーミンを愛しているか理解しています。そこで皆様に喜んでいただける、様々な素晴らしい特典を製作したいと思い立ちました。私たちのIndiegogoページで確認できる全特典は、慎重に選ばれ、後援者の方々のためだけにデザインされたものです。グッズは新しいムーミンシリーズのイメージを主に使用してデザインされる予定です。 詳細はFAQセクションにあるムーミンエクスペリエンスを、そのほかの特典はIndiegogoページの右手をご参照ください。その他の特典のイメージは、ビデオプレーヤーの下部にあるイメージギャラリーにて閲覧できます。   皆様からの応援ありがとうございます! 主な課題の一つとして、予測できない状況によるシリーズのリリース期日の遅れが挙げられます。また、よりお伝えしにくいことですが、予算が変更されそうな状態にあります。幸いなことに、新しいムーミンシリーズのビジュアル開発のために、大変正確な予算を立てていたため、初期的段階からの大きな変更を防ぐことができています。計画に大幅な変更がある場合は、皆様にお知らせいたします! キャンペーンに参加する方法の一つとしては、この Indiegogoキャンペーン期間中のみ販売される、限定特典の購入が挙げられます。しかし、応援はしたいものの、金銭面においてサポートができない場合でも、していただけることはたくさんあります。 Facebook でムーミンにいいねするムーミンを Twitter と InstagramでフォローするIndiegogoのシェアツールを使用するか、ショートリンク: www.igg.me/at/moomin をシェアして、本キャンペーンのリンクをメールやソーシャルメディアを通じて共有し、お友達や家族、同僚などに口コミをシェアするブログに書くクリエイティビティを生かしましょう ほかにアイディアは有りますか？ やってみましょう！ムーミンテレビシリーズのオフィシャルウェブサイト: www.moomin.comを訪問して、ムーミンニ...本キャンペーンのオフィシャルハッシュタグは#MoominGoGoです  ムーミンメディアキットはこちらをクリックしてくださいメディア問い合わせ窓口はこちらにご連絡ください: caitlin@riotcommunications.comCaitlin Allen | 広報 I Riot Communications  固定された目標金額にはどういった意味がありますか？最低ファンドライズ額の$200,000が達成されない場合、全後援者に返金されます。つまりファンドライズの目標金額に100％達した場合のみ、必要額が得られることを意味します。つまり、応援してくださる方にはリスクがなく、乗るか、そるかのみです ;)いつ特典がもらえますか（一般的に）？各特典にはおおよその発送日が添付されているのが確認できるかと思います。一部の特典はシリーズのプレミア前に発送されます。発送日に変更がある場合は、後援者にお知らせいたします。 アニマティックのクリップはいつ受け取ることができますか？アニマティックのクリップは2019年の3月に受け取ることができます。アニマティックのクリップは、各特典の発送予定のドラフトに算入されていません。ご注意ください。 特典「シリーズの中であなたの作品を展示」のための作品やアイディアはいつまでに送付すればよいですか？作品もしくはアイディアは2017年8月までに当方に送付してください。作品/アイディアの提出が必要な期日が近づきましたらご連絡させていただきます。このキャンペーンが終了した後/ほかの場所でこれらの特典アイテムは購入できるようになりますか？一部のアイテム（主にテレビシリーズや本のリリース）を除いて、本キャンペーンのために選択し、製作された特典は、本キャンペーン終了後は購入できず、その他の場所でも販売されません。一度に二つ以上の特典を購入できますか？申し訳ありませんが、Indiegogoに複数アイテムを同時購入するためのショッピングカート機能が有りません。そのため、全ての必要なアイテムが一気に購入できる簡単な方法として、セットをいくつかご用意いたしました。キャンペーン終了後、特典、キャンペーン、ショーの情報はどこで確認できますか？ Indiegogoのページをブックマークするようにしてください。キャンペーンや得点に関する情報の更新を投稿するために、こちらを使用し続ける予定です。ムーミンをFacebook、Twitter および Instagramでフォローして、Moomin.comのニュースレターにサインアップし、新しいムーミンシリーズの最新情報を受け取ってください。 メールアドレス: tv@moomin.comにご連絡ください。新しいシリーズはいつリリースされますか？ シリーズの現在の状況はどうなっていますか？シリーズの最初の13エピソードは2019年にリリース予定で、その次の13エピソードは2020年前半リリースを予定しています。現在最初の13エピソードのスクリプトの準備は整い、コンセプトアートは製作されています。同時に、CGIによるムーミントロールとムーミンファミリーの製作を計画しています。ムーミンエクスペリエンスとは何ですか？私たちは皆さんを、トーベ・ヤンソンとムーミンの土地であるフィンランドへの、生涯に一度きりの旅にご招待したいと思っています。旅行は季節の中でも最も寒い時期である冬に実施されます。凍えるような気温の中で、トーベ・ヤンソンの足跡をたどり、全ムーミンファンが訪れるべき場所を訪問します。人生でも最高の四日間を過ごす準備をしましょう。お連れする場所の例としてムーミンミュージアム、ムーミンワールドそしてトーベ・ヤンソンのアトリエが挙げられます。高級宿泊施設、フィンランドへの往復フライトチケットもついている、このパッケージツアーを提供いたします。サウナに行ったり、凍った湖でのスイミングといったフィンランドらしいアクティビティを楽しんだりする機会も得られます。もしくはアイスフィッシングやクロスカントリー・スキーにチャレンジしてみたいですか？ 旅行の始めに、プロダクションチームのメンバーと過ごし、トーベ・ヤンソンの姪であるSophia Jansson（ソフィア・ヤンソン）に合う特別な時間も用意しています。グッズバッグには何が入っていますか？限定アイテムの中から厳選されたアイテムセレクションが入っています。特別なリクエストがある場合は、tv@moomin.comまでご連絡ください。Indiegogoキャンペーンは誰が運営していますか?IndiegogoキャンペーンはGutsy Animations およびムーミンテレビシリーズプロダクションチームメンバーがSpaceboy Crowdfunding Agencyと協力して運営しています。その他の質問はメールアドレス: tv@moomin.comまでご連絡ください。 PERKS: $5 USDムーミン谷へようこそどんな些細なことでも大助かりです！ + 宿泊費フィンランドでのムーミンエクスペリエンス限定プロダクションアクセス最大5パック2018年1月予定

story:
A contemporary drama about mental health, education, law enforcement and sexuality, set within Bristol’s left-wing activist scene

 

Justin Adams is a student in Bristol, apparently with everything going for him. Previously shy and insecure, he has decided to change his life by throwing himself into the left-wing activism scene. Adored by his friend Colin, respected by fellow activist Trixie and holding down a difficult relationship with girlfriend Chelsea, Justin embarks on an illicit affair with his lecturer Simon. But life as a left-wing activist in the 21st century is shaky and unpredictable. Will Justin’s sanity survive his own recklessness, or will tragedy await?

This is a pilot episode, with the intention of being commissioned to make Square into a six-episode series. The pilot sets up the characters and most of the storylines, which we have plans to develop and expand upon in subsequent episodes.

 

We are Owen B Lewis and George Harold Millman, a writing partnership (and an actual partnership!) with two creative degrees behind us and lots of experience of writing for stage and screen. We have been writing Square for more than two years now – the scripts have gone through numerous edits, and we’re really confident with where it’s going. We know the characters inside out and exactly what will happen to them in the next couple of years.

The beauty of Square is that it deals with underrepresented voices, in a believable, honest and genuine way. There is such emphasis in television at the moment to raise the voices of certain oppressed demographics; however, the mistake that is easily fallen into is that these characters are often quite two-dimensional, existing as nothing but a role model, a caricature – which in its turn precipitates the original problem. Square has none of this; all of our characters feel like real people, with their own desires and their own flaws. It’s about the single mother next door to you who’s struggling to make ends meet; that guy you know at Uni whose opinions you would agree with, but who expresses them so strongly that you feel stupid; the person who always sits in the corner quietly, who you’d love to get to know but there just never seems a convenient way of starting a conversation.

We don’t see drama as a way to preach, but as a way to show the characters’ intentions, especially characters that we might struggle to warm to. It is a means of coming to understand one another, and a way for people to think differently about their own actions and their consequences. It’s about starting a discussion. It’s about growing up. It’s about humans.

 

We know that our drama would have an audience. We have asked TV companies and members of the public what they want the next big thing to be, and what we tend to get is some variation on ‘something contemporary, with topical storylines and interesting characters.’ And every time, we think, ‘That’s Square!’ We have shown our promo video to so many people, who have nearly always loved it. It’s a show for right now, a time of critical changes in society and in politics, when so many are anxious about the future and the way the world is going. As relatively new writers, it’s really hard to get anything commissioned, no matter how strong it is – but we are not going to give up on this project, we just need the money to continue! Our aim is to create a really amazing pilot episode, get everyone watching it and loving it, really build up some momentum behind this, so that production companies and broadcasters will see how strong the market is for this format.

We already have the cast and crew committed to making this, assuming we get the money to pay them. Our financial breakdown is as follows:

£4,000 - includes cast fees

£3000 - includes crew (Project Manager, Cinematographer, Intimacy Coach etc)

£1000 - includes anything else such as hiring venue, locations, props etc

story:
‘Silvertusk Mountain’ is a 10 min short film written and directed by Noah Christensen in his last year at Capilano University’s Motion Picture Arts Program.

Written as a concept piece,

 

'Silvertusk Mountain' is a workplace comedy following Blake, a socially awkward new hire, in a coming of age experience, as he juggles between building his confidence and the unique character relationships of his co-workers.

 

 The team’s ultimate goal with ‘Silvertusk Mountain’ is to pitch a workplace comedy series based on ‘Silvertusk Mountain’ to a network sometime in the future, using the 10 min short film as proof of concept. 

The Director (Noah) has taken the unique experiences he has gained working at a ski hill, plus other tourism jobs, and squished it all into a script. 

Of course, before any future dream the short film has to be filmed. We are going to need all the help we can get to make it as best as we can, and that’s where you come in!

 


 

Writer / Director 

 

Producer

 

 

We are seeking $4,500 to make this production a reality. 

 

Thankfully by being 4th year Motion Picture Arts students, Capilano University provides us with equipment rentals and studio space, so we are already saving thousands of dollars! 

 

However filmmaking isn't cheap and there are tons more costs that go into making a film. The money we are asking for will go for things Capilano University is unable to provide to us such as:

  • Making the Set (Set construction, Paint, Props, Furniture for dressing the set, etc) 
  • Costumes for the Actors (Wardrobe, Makeup, etc)
  • Location Fees and Permits (Portable Potties, Rain Gear, Safety Procedures, etc)
  • PLUS most importantly FEEDING the cast & crew! 

Although this may seem like a lot, we are super close, and with your help we can easily reach our goal! 

So check out some of the awesome perks:

$1 -  Feeling generous... but not too generous eh! NO PROBLEM! Every little bit helps.

$5 - YOU will have the personal satisfaction of knowing that the ENTIRE CAST & CREW thought about YOU for 5 seconds. 

$10 - YOU will receive a DIGITAL DOWNLOAD of the final product!

$25 - All of the above - PLUS You will also receive your own COPY OF THE SCRIPT & to sweeten the deal.. The director will personally follow you on INSTAGRAM & he might even like a photo (wink wink)! 

$50 - All of the above - PLUS You will also receive EXCLUSIVE behind the scenes access & be entered to win a MYSTERY BOX from the crew!

$75 - All of the above - + YOU be listed as an “Indiegogo Funder” in the credits &  a very snazzy T-SHIRT SIGNED by the Cast & Crew. 

$200 - All of the above - PLUS BECOME FAMOUS! We will sneak a picture of YOU onto the actual set, so your face will be captured in the background of all the exciting action! 

$500 - All of the above - PLUS an option between: A) SNOW DATE! Enjoy a fun afternoon snowboarding with the director and selected crew. - OR - B) DINNER DATE! You and a friend can enjoy a fabulous dinner with the Director at his favourite TIKI BAR. Plus he will even pay for his half of the check! 

$1000 - All of the above - PLUS The Director (who is an experienced tour guide) will personally show you (& a friend) around the beautiful city of VANCOUVER! With admission to amazing sites like the Vancouver Lookout, Stanley Park, & Capilano Suspension Bridge included!!!

 

One of our biggest challenges is the fact that the story takes place on a ski hill.

Since we are still a student production and not a high budget production, we won't be able to go up to the ski hill with our entire cast and crew. This means that the majority of the sets will have to be recreated in a studio. Thankfully, Capilano University graciously provided us with a studio, now we just need a set to go in it!

The money from the campaign will mainly go into making building the sets and making them as realistic as possible without going on the ski hill.

Of course there are some things that cannot be recreated in studio. For those shots, a very small second unit crew will be capturing B-Roll - as we do not want to interrupt daily operations.

Additionally, any other exterior scenes will be filmed at a local parks in North Vancouver.

We are proud to say that this production will be environmentally sustainable! That's right folks - time to get GREEN!

 

What does sustainable production even mean?

 

The process of making a film or television show requires an incredible amount of materials and resources. There is a huge amount of paper and plastics consumed and wasted on movies and television shows everyday. Everything from the costumes, props, and sets you see on the screen to feeding staff, transportation, lighting, and power has an impact on the environment. 

Industry analysts say that Film and TV productions, on average, produce around 500 metric tonnes of CO2 per production, or the equivalent of 108 cars on the road for a year. Shows reported using 251 cases of paper in 6 months - that's 1,255,000 pieces of paper in less than a year. This costs productions thousands of dollars, while the cost to the environment is immeasurable.

In 2018 our class at Capilano University, took on a sustainable goal of going paperless and reducing plastic on our yearly productions. Our ways of achieving that goal is by asking crew to bring their own Tupperware, cutlery, and reusable mugs/water bottles to set as well as using our electronic devices for production meetings and during filming instead of printing documents that will be discarded after a single use.

That year we saved on approximately 350 plates and cutlery that would have otherwise gone to landfills and over 3,000 sheets of paper PER PRODUCTION. Together, all this would have consumed 1.5 trees. Now that doesn't seem like a lot - but we are one small student production. Think about all the features and TV shows in production/prep in the world - working on a way bigger scale. We're looking at forests.

We hope to continue this initiative this year starting with this production of ‘Silvertusk Mountain’. 

Already, a majority of the set construction from our production will be recycled from short film to short film, thanks to the rental works facility at the BOSA Centre for Film and Animation. On set, all of the cast and crew will be required to bring their own reusable water bottles. As well as their own Tupperware containers to use as plates for snacks and meals. We will refrain from printing any production documents and script revisions throughout the whole production.

AND of course, all waste from pre-production, production, and post-production will be sorted and properly recycled accordingly.

 

 

Don't worry, there are other ways you can help!

Even if you can’t donate, there are still plenty of ways you can be part of the production! Aside from budgetary donations, any sort of food donations are always welcome. It's very important to keep the cast and crew happy and the best way to do that is to make sure they have full bellies! 

If there is any other way you would like to help us out or ways you would like to get involved, feel free to reach out to the producer, Ronny Kurland at ronnykurland@my.capilanou.ca. 

And of course, please share this campaign with friends and family!

story:
#ACTORS TV PILOT

Hello folks! 

Firstly, what is it? #ACTORS is a snarky and irreverent mockumentary series (with a pinch of the dark side) that follows a group of out-of-work actors who are trying to make it, NOT fake it.

Secondly, who are we? We are Francesca Kingdon and Luca Moore; two actors who understand only too well the trials and tribulations of being in and out of work. The endless anxiety, the relentless self-promotion, the knockbacks- Oh, the knockbacks. It's a jungle out there and we want this to not only show the often bizarre and bonkers side of being an actor but also the more poignant, heartfelt moments too.

Thirdly, what do you want from me? We would love your help in funding this exciting new project which is already attracting some well-known talent like the esteemed director of smash horror feature Matriarch, Scott Vickers. Below is an interview Scott had recently with the CEO of Filmocracy in the USA talking about his experiences as a film-maker and #ACTORS gets a mention at 41 mins 10secs!

We've also managed to snare ex-Hollyoaks/Emmerdale heart-throb Rob Norbury (he's tied up in the basement) and BBC Scotland's River City regular Cameron Fulton who have both agreed to come on board to help get #ACTORS out there. Below is Cameron's audition;

In fact our teamsheet is full to the brim of talented, dedicated humans.
See below:
Executive Producer: Suzanna Dhawan of SD Talent Management
Casting Director: Evelynne Ralph-Larner of ER Casting
Director Of Photography: Ian Livesey
 

So, fourthly, why should I care? COVID has had an enormous affect on independent film-making and decimated the lives of many of our beloved freelancers in The Arts. Not only do we want to make an entertaining comedy series, we would love to create paid work in our industry. 

FUNDING BREAKDOWN

Ideally we need £5 million. 

Failing that we would also be able to manage with £6000. This goes towards all the standard costs of a shoot; paying cast and crew, catering, locations, equipment. There's a heck of a lot of outgoings and variables.

It's worth mentioning at this point that if we don't reach our goal, we will go ahead with the shoot but on a tighter budget - but if we can avoid this eventuality, we will!

HOW CAN YOU GET INVOLVED AS A BUSINESS OR INDIVIDUAL?

We are offering BRAMHALL businesses first dibs on getting involved. If you want to discuss product placement, have your shop front seen or incorporate your logo into the pilot- we have limited spaces. Please email: hello@sdtalent.co.uk and request more info! 

If you would like to experience being an actor for the day and be on a LIVE location set with our cast, we are asking for a donation of £50. If you can push it to £100, you'll get a TV credit AND an invite to the after party! Again, please just email hello@sdtalent.co.uk once you have made your donation on here!

RISKS&CHALLENGES

There are risks and challenges with every shoot; any film-maker will roll their eyes and tell you that. We are lucky to have Scott Vickers among our army - he has vast experience in shooting professionally on a small-scale budget - and for his expertise, we are grateful. Feel free to look up Scott's film Matriarch - the journey it went on is inspiring!

Also,  the key to any creative endeavour - BELIEF IN THE SCRIPT AND STORY. Even Brad Pitt will work for free if he loves the script. Sadly, he was busy but our actors and crew so far are SO enthusiastic and ready for the graft needed to make this a success that we are confident the risks are few and the rewards are many. As we stated above, our main aim is to provide PAID work for our industry peers. Failing that though, we go ahead and call on everyone's belief in the art. 

LASTLY

We get it. Now's not a good time. Anything you can give is hugely appreciated make no mistake! But if you can't give at this time; any emails forwarded, any shout outs on socials, any ways you can create a buzz or lend a hand is welcome. We are forever grateful. Thank you.
story_txt:
#ACTORS TV PILOT
Hello folks! 
Firstly, what is it? #ACTORS is a snarky and irreverent mockumentary series (with a pinch of the dark side) that follows a group of out-of-work actors who are trying to make it, NOT fake it.
Secondly, who are we? We are Francesca Kingdon and Luca Moore; two actors who understand only too well the trials and tribulations of being in and out of work. The endless anxiety, the relentless self-promotion, the knockbacks- Oh, the knockbacks. It's a jungle out there and we want this to not only show the often bizarre and bonkers side of being an actor but also the more poignant, heartfelt moments too.

Thirdly, what do you want from me? We would love your help in funding this exciting new project which is already attracting some well-known talent like the esteemed director of smash horror feature Matriarch, Scott Vickers. There are risks and challenges with every shoot; any film-maker will roll their eyes and tell you that. We are lucky to have Scott Vickers among our army - he has vast experience in shooting professionally on a small-scale budget - and for his expertise, we are grateful. Feel free to look up Scott's film Matriarch - the journey it went on is inspiring!
Also,  the key to any creative endeavour - BELIEF IN THE SCRIPT AND STORY. Even Brad Pitt will work for free if he loves the script. Sadly, he was busy but our actors and crew so far are SO enthusiastic and ready for the graft needed to make this a success that we are confident the risks are few and the rewards are many. As we stated above, our main aim is to provide PAID work for our industry peers. Failing that though, we go ahead and call on everyone's belief in the art. 
LASTLY
We get it. Now's not a good time. Anything you can give is hugely appreciated make no mistake! But if you can't give at this time; any emails forwarded, any shout outs on socials, any ways you can create a buzz or lend a hand is welcome. We are forever grateful. Thank you.

story:
What is The Uncanny Upshurs?

Season 1 of The Uncanny Upshurs followed Agatha and Wally Upshur as they discovered that life is a bit more magical than they thought.  Now, the twins must take charge of their newfound powers and learn to survive in a world they're only just starting to learn about. 

Shot in both London and New York City, The Uncanny Upshurs is a complex production, and with season 2, we want to be even more ambitious.  We can only do that if we have more funds.  That's where the IndieGogo comes in!

With The Uncanny Upshurs, we are dedicated to bringing diversity and fun to the fantasy genre.  We want to show that everyone, no matter who they are, has a little bit of magic in them, and season 1 was just the beginning.

What happened to the Id?  Are Agatha and Gemma dating?  What's up with the dragon?  Let's find out.

Where does the money go?

We broke down the basics!

This is the bare minimum we can ask for.  Anything we raise beyond this will go to paying the cast and crew for their work!

story:
Short Summary…

Welcome! Thanks so much for taking the time out to learn more about our new digital series, “HeadSpace”. This show is about two young African American male psychotherapists and their journey through opening a new therapy practice in the heart of a Black neighborhood. These two childhood friends will struggle through the day-to-day challenges of starting a new practice, balance their polar opposite styles, and deal with their own personal demons while working to gain the trust of their community and encourage them to utilize mental health services.

A Little Background…

Have you ever gone to therapy?  A recent University of Phoenix study found that nearly one-third (32%) of Americans have sought professional counseling for mental health issues. At the very least, you probably have a friend or family member who has seen a therapist and is open about it.  Seeing a therapist is much less of a taboo than it was decades ago but it remains heavily stigmatized among people of color, including African Americans.  African Americans are 20% more likely to report having serious psychological distress than their white counterparts, but less likely to seek mental health treatment.  We hope to open up a dialogue about mental health issues and the benefits of therapy with this show. And we’re using comedy to explore this subject since humor often helps people open up to challenging subjects. 

 

 

The Impact...

The main area where this show makes an impact is through exploring the attitudes and beliefs about therapy. There are a lot of reasons why people of color are less likely to seek mental health counseling - some reasons are rooted in financial and social issues.  For some, it is seen as a sign of weakness or a lack of faith in God. And there are others who don’t feel that they’d find a therapist they could relate to.  With this show, we will help change the narrative on mental health and therapy in the Black community.  We also plan to shift conventional thinking about therapy by having two young Black men as the experts helping others with their challenges, which is something that is rarely seen onscreen.  Comedy is a great medium to explore tough issues, and this show will have many laughs along with very poignant moments that will all further the discussion of this topic.

This show also makes an impact through the diversity in front of the camera and behind the scenes. We will have a predominantly Black cast, but it will include other people of color to explore the beliefs held by different communities.  And behind the scenes, the show is being helmed by African American producers and directors.

What We Need & What You Get…

We need your help to bring this important project to life! We need to raise $25,000 to shoot this series. This would cover shooting 7 episodes for the first season of this show. The funds raised will go directly to physical production and post-production, which includes equipment rentals (cameras, lights, lenses), location fees, props, wardrobe, cast and crew fees, and editing.

 

Thank you so much for taking time out to learn about this new series and our funding campaign!

About the Cast & Producers...

LEAD CAST / PRODUCERS

Dior Allen is an actor, comedic character performer and improviser from New York City.  He will play the role of Dior Davenport and is a producer of this series.

Dior studied at HB Studios in New York, trains at Upright Citizens Brigade and is currently attending Playhouse West. He is a recipient of the 2014-2017 UCB Diversity Scholarship. Dior's previous roles include “NCIS: Los Angeles”, All Eyez On Me, the Curtis “50 Cent” Jackson movie Before I Self Destruct, Nickelodeon’s "Game Shakers", and the BET series "The Comedy Get Down". He is the face of an online Kia Motors campaign, Honda, Capital One and McDonald's. Dior keeps his comedy chops sharp by performing improv and sketches around the country. He also is the creator and co-writer of the sold-out comedy show “90’s Sitcom Live on Stage: The Woke Version”, currently touring the west coast.

Darryl Blalock is an actor and writer from Hattiesburg, Mississippi. He will play the role of C.J. Jackson and is also a producer of this series.

Darryl studied with the renowned coach Aaron Speiser for over three years. He is most known for his role as “Darryl” on the popular Black & Sexy TV series  “Sexless” and “Chef Julian”.  His work on both shows has brought him a large fan base within the United States and abroad. He also appears in the new digital series “Broke Brie”. Darryl’s previous work includes the film A Christmas Wedding featuring Miguel Nunez, Jr. and Vivica A. Fox, Beyond the Shield with Omar Gooding, Undercover Princesses, “Definitely Not the One”, and the series “That Guy”. He also performs stand-up comedy around Los Angeles.  

PRODUCERS

Sade Oyinade is a writer, producer and director with a background in reality television, documentaries, and film. She will direct the pilot episode of “HeadSpace”. Sade wrote and directed the 2017 short film Yemi's Dilemma, a featured selection of the 26th Annual Pan African Film Festival.  She co-produced the film as well. A few years earlier, she produced and directed the HIV/AIDS short Who Do You Know?  

Most recently, Sade was Co-Executive Producer of the award-winning docu-series "Unsung" and "Unsung Hollywood".  She produced over two-dozen episodes including profiles on artists like Rick James, Billy Dee Williams, Xscape and Charlie Murphy.  Sade's credits also include the hit BET docu-series "American Gangster", "Celebrity Crime Files" and NBC's "Starting Over". Sade is from Silver Spring, MD and is based in Los Angeles.

 

Deshawn Plair is an actress, producer and director with experience in television, film and digital media.  In 2018, she joined forces with Nate Parker as one of the producers of his new digital series, “Baselines”. She was also a technical producer for the live production of the 2018 African American Film Critics Association Awards.  In 2017, she co-produced the short film Yemi's Dilemma, featured selection of the 26th Annual Pan African Film Festival. Previously, Deshawn served as the Production Supervisor on the award-winning TV-One docu-series "Unsung" and "Unsung Hollywood", contributing to profiles on artists like Hill Harper, Marvin Sapp and Charlie Murphy.

Deshawn's previous credits include "Shaunie's Home Court" for VH1, BET’s docu-series “Inside the Label” and the TV One docu-series "Celebrity Crime Files". Deshawn hails from Kalamazoo, MI and is based in Los Angeles.

story:
Only in New York is about two young women who move from the rural Midwest to reinvent themselves from the restrictive lifestyle they come from. From day one Grace and Sabrina find that New York is not a small town full of friendly strangers, it's a zany chaotic mess ready to eat your money and ruin your day. Luckily on their side is the gay couple next door who always stand in their truth, Dante and Harris. And of course, Grace and Sabrina always have each other. Being roommates with a best friend never changes the relationship.... right?

Follow these dynamic young women as they change the course of their lives changes and learn what is means to be true New Yorkers. 

Originally a short film idea created by writer, producer, and director Andy Jean Louis, the series came to life from motivation from producer Drew Robinson. Only in New York is a heartfelt story about coming of age, finding a family in strange places, and taking a chance on love. 

 

 

CAST

LISA JANAE (Grace) is a director, producer and actress originally from Los Angeles.  She was most recently seen as Nora in the sci-fi series film, Annulus. Currently, Lisa is excited to play the role of Grace in the upcoming comedic LGBT web-series, Only in New York where she’ll finally have an opportunity to play a naively optimistic Midwesterner moving to the Big Apple for the first time.
 

DAWN ANEADA (Sabrina) is an actress, writer, director , and producer originally from Upper Marlboro, MD located right outside of Washington, DC. After acquiring a Bachelors in Sport Management, Dawn went on to obtain her second degree in Film & Television Acting from The New York Conservatory from Dramatic Arts on Merit Scholarship.

Dawn took New York City by storm by appearing in Season 2 of ABC’s hit show Quantico, 5 Indie Web Series, 2 Indie Short films, 2 Indie Feature Film, and also managed to write, produce, and star in her own Web Series, Millennial Dating: FML! Currently will be playing Sabrina in Only in New York!

 

DAMIAN THOMPSON (Dante) can be seen in one of Bollywood's biggest blockbuster hits English Vinglish, staring the late Sridevi. He is a 2018 NAACP award winner for his performance in Fly at the Pasadena Playhouse.

Mr. Thompson is a veteran of the stage, having performed numerous off-broadway and regional shows at theatres including The Ford’s Theatre (where he performed for the Obamas), Hartford Stage with the Tony award winning director Darko Tresnjak, and Baltimore Center Stage with acclaimed director Kwame.

 

MATTHEW MENENDEZ (Harris) is a New York trained actor, from the Conservatory of Dramatic Arts, hailing from St. Louis. Matthew got his start on stage in productions “Empress of Sex” and “Pageant Tales and Beauty Fails” and has starred in indie films such as “Strapped for Danger” and Canvas of Death, and in web series “Long Island Lights” and “The Uncanny Upshurs”.

 

JONATHAN LEE (Derek) was born and raised in New York. He is an actor, dancer, and fitness enthusiast. I'll be playing the role of Derek. What gets him excited about the role is that he's never played the role of a homeless man before! - but more than that, he's excited to be working with other hungry, hardworking, and upcoming actors and production team. He loves what he does, and loves working with great people. He can't wait to start working on this project, and hopefully many more to come. 

 

 

CORINNE BRITTI (Sarah) is an actor, improviser, and writer who is very psyched for her very small role in realizing the (spectacularly gay) dreams of someone who (she hopes) considers her a friend. You might know her from her most recent film, Route 80, or from longingly pressing her face into the storefront glass of the Humane Society.

 

RUTH BARRIE (Sarah's Grandma) has been working in Film, TV and making commercials for the past 17/18 years. She is still waiting for her "big break". This project just might be the "one" that takes her there. She loved reading for this role - the script was so funny and heartwarming all at the same time. So happy to be working (for the day) with these youngsters.  I know this project will do really well.

 

SHIRO KIHAGI (Master Q) is a passionate actress who sees herself as lucky to do what she loves and be of service. Always eager to learn she is a forever student at the Susan Batson Studio. While not acting she enjoys cooking and playing her guitar. Getting to play a seldom seen role such as Master Q is an exciting experience and I hope to do her justice. A gay female rapper with something to hide, I mean, who doesn’t love such complexity!

 

LISA MCGURN (Karen) is that quirky, offbeat, sarcastic best friend you've been looking for. She is passionate about comedy and loves finding it in the darkest places. She co-created the award winning web series, In Your Dreams where she received Outstanding Lead Actor in a Comedy from the LA Web Fest. She is continuing to develop new content as we speak. Lisa is playing the role of Karen in OINY. She is pumped to be able to let loose, get feisty, and play with the everyone!

CREW

 

ANDY JEAN LOUIS (Creator) is a producer/director/writer who loves working with all different viewpoints to tell a diverse story. Currently the last web series he worked on "BREAK Web series" is currently available on the JiveWired App on Apple TV.

 

DREW ROBINSON (Co-Producer) is a post-production editor who traveled all the way from the shores of the Ohio River to make his big gay artsy dreams come true in NYC. He graduated from a film program at DeSales University in 2013 and has been holding down very normal day jobs in film by day and working on very strange art by night. His latest project (beyond the magnificent undertaking that is Only in New York) is writing and visual design for the hugely popular internet parody, Rapal Dark Res (currently at 100,000 views!). 

 

RYANN NELSON (Assistant Director) Originally from South Carolina, she is a senior at NYU with a double major in Film/Television and Cinema Studies. She has worked on numerous projects at NYU, primarily as assistant director. She hopes to write for television in the future. Ryann is most excited to watch the relationship between Grace and Sabrina develop throughout the series!

 

CHRIS LUNDY (Director of Photography) is a DP, Video Editor, and Independent filmmaker specializing in cinematography and story development. He is currently the Director of Photography and Post-production at the Hoboken based production company, Macallan Productions.

Chris is immensely passionate about conveying thought-provoking narratives through the visual language of film and video. Working closely with colleague and fellow filmmaker Ryan Laux, the two have garnered national recognition for their work on films such as Paramnesia (’15) and Arke (’17) and have continued to produce short films together. Chris is looking forward to working with the tremendously talented cast and crew of Only In New York and will be bringing a unique cinematic flare to the creative visions of Director Andy Jean Louis.

 

RYAN LAUX (Assistant Camera) is filmmaker, motion designer, animator, and visual effects artist with a passion for storytelling through visual imagery. He is currently a video producer and animator at MWWPR in NYC, & previously held an internship at DreamWorks Animation in CA.

Ryan has been producing and creating multimedia content since he was young, and consistently strives to improve his skill and expertise with a wide variety of projects. Along with Chris Lundy, he has gained national recognition for visual effects in multiple short films, including Arke (’17) featuring Andy Jean Louis. He is very excited to once again be collaborating with Andy & the entire cast and crew of Only In New York.

 

JENNY CHAN (Gaffer) is most excited about seeing the journey of two characters adjusting to adulthood in a new city. As someone coming out of college, this very city she was born in feels completely new now that I have to deal with the uncertainty of the road ahead of her. She cannot wait to see this project come to fruition, and to work with such a talented cast and crew.

SARA DAVIS (Sound Mixer) is excited to be on the project of ONLY IN NEW YORK! She is a recent graduate of TCNJ. She love the world of sound and has a passion for sound editing.

 



Here's the breakdown of what we need to make ONLY IN NEW YORK a success. This is the bare bones to pay our actors and crew.  They'll be eating a lot of $1 slice pizzas but art is made of love and no-toppings cheese pizza.

 

 

    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Risks and Challenges

There are always risks when working on set and on a micro budget, luckily we have an awesome production team willing to take on those challenges. Our main risk is a change to our production schedule. We plan to shoot in September but that could change based on actor availability or any unforeseen problems.

Only in New York is a heartfelt story about coming of age, finding a family in strange places, and taking a chance on love.   CAST
LISA JANAE (Grace) is a director, producer and actress originally from Los Angeles.  She was most recently seen as Nora in the sci-fi series film, Annulus. Currently, Lisa is excited to play the role of Grace in the upcoming comedic LGBT web-series, Only in New York where she’ll finally have an opportunity to play a naively optimistic Midwesterner moving to the Big Apple for the first time. 
DAWN ANEADA (Sabrina) is an actress, writer, director , and producer originally from Upper Marlboro, MD located right outside of Washington, DC. After acquiring a Bachelors in Sport Management, Dawn went on to obtain her second degree in Film & Television Acting from The New York Conservatory from Dramatic Arts on Merit Scholarship.
Dawn took New York City by storm by appearing in Season 2 of ABC’s hit show Quantico, 5 Indie Web Series, 2 Indie Short films, 2 Indie Feature Film, and also managed to write, produce, and star in her own Web Series, Millennial Dating: FML! Currently will be playing Sabrina in Only in New York!
 

DAMIAN THOMPSON (Dante) can be seen in one of Bollywood's biggest blockbuster hits English Vinglish, staring the late Sridevi. He is a 2018 NAACP award winner for his performance in Fly at the Pasadena Playhouse.
Mr. Thompson is a veteran of the stage, having performed numerous off-broadway and regional shows at theatres including The Ford’s Theatre (where he performed for the Obamas), Hartford Stage with the Tony award winning director Darko Tresnjak, and Baltimore Center Stage with acclaimed director Kwame.
 

MATTHEW MENENDEZ (Harris) is a New York trained actor, from the Conservatory of Dramatic Arts, hailing from St. Louis. Matthew got his start on stage in productions “Empress of Sex” and “Pageant Tales and Beauty Fails” and has starred in indie films such as “Strapped for Danger” and Canvas of Death, and in web series “Long Island Lights” and “The Uncanny Upshurs”.
 

JONATHAN LEE (Derek) was born and raised in New York. He is an actor, dancer, and fitness enthusiast. I'll be playing the role of Derek. What gets him excited about the role is that he's never played the role of a homeless man before! - but more than that, he's excited to be working with other hungry, hardworking, and upcoming actors and production team. He loves what he does, and loves working with great people. He can't wait to start working on this project, and hopefully many more to come. 
 
 

CORINNE BRITTI (Sarah) is an actor, improviser, and writer who is very psyched for her very small role in realizing the (spectacularly gay) dreams of someone who (she hopes) considers her a friend. You might know her from her most recent film, Route 80, or from longingly pressing her face into the storefront glass of the Humane Society.
 

RUTH BARRIE (Sarah's Grandma) has been working in Film, TV and making commercials for the past 17/18 years. She is still waiting for her "big break". This project just might be the "one" that takes her there. She loved reading for this role - the script was so funny and heartwarming all at the same time. So happy to be working (for the day) with these youngsters.  I know this project will do really well.
 

SHIRO KIHAGI (Master Q) is a passionate actress who sees herself as lucky to do what she loves and be of service. Always eager to learn she is a forever student at the Susan Batson Studio. While not acting she enjoys cooking and playing her guitar. Getting to play a seldom seen role such as Master Q is an exciting experience and I hope to do her justice. A gay female rapper with something to hide, I mean, who doesn’t love such complexity!
 

LISA MCGURN (Karen) is that quirky, offbeat, sarcastic best friend you've been looking for. She is passionate about comedy and loves finding it in the darkest places. She co-created the award winning web series, In Your Dreams where she received Outstanding Lead Actor in a Comedy from the LA Web Fest. She is continuing to develop new content as we speak. Lisa is playing the role of Karen in OINY. She is pumped to be able to let loose, get feisty, and play with the everyone!
CREW
 

ANDY JEAN LOUIS (Creator) is a producer/director/writer who loves working with all different viewpoints to tell a diverse story. Currently the last web series he worked on "BREAK Web series" is currently available on the JiveWired App on Apple TV.
 

DREW ROBINSON (Co-Producer) is a post-production editor who traveled all the way from the shores of the Ohio River to make his big gay artsy dreams come true in NYC. He graduated from a film program at DeSales University in 2013 and has been holding down very normal day jobs in film by day and working on very strange art by night. His latest project (beyond the magnificent undertaking that is Only in New York) is writing and visual design for the hugely popular internet parody, Rapal Dark Res (currently at 100,000 views!). 
 

RYANN NELSON (Assistant Director) Originally from South Carolina, she is a senior at NYU with a double major in Film/Television and Cinema Studies. She has worked on numerous projects at NYU, primarily as assistant director. She hopes to write for television in the future. Ryann is most excited to watch the relationship between Grace and Sabrina develop throughout the series!
 

CHRIS LUNDY (Director of Photography) is a DP, Video Editor, and Independent filmmaker specializing in cinematography and story development. He is currently the Director of Photography and Post-production at the Hoboken based production company, Macallan Productions.
Chris is immensely passionate about conveying thought-provoking narratives through the visual language of film and video. Working closely with colleague and fellow filmmaker Ryan Laux, the two have garnered national recognition for their work on films such as Paramnesia (’15) and Arke (’17) and have continued to produce short films together. Chris is looking forward to working with the tremendously talented cast and crew of Only In New York and will be bringing a unique cinematic flare to the creative visions of Director Andy Jean Louis.
 

RYAN LAUX (Assistant Camera) is filmmaker, motion designer, animator, and visual effects artist with a passion for storytelling through visual imagery. He is currently a video producer and animator at MWWPR in NYC, & previously held an internship at DreamWorks Animation in CA.
Ryan has been producing and creating multimedia content since he was young, and consistently strives to improve his skill and expertise with a wide variety of projects. Along with Chris Lundy, he has gained national recognition for visual effects in multiple short films, including Arke (’17) featuring Andy Jean Louis. He is very excited to once again be collaborating with Andy & the entire cast and crew of Only In New York.
 

JENNY CHAN (Gaffer) is most excited about seeing the journey of two characters adjusting to adulthood in a new city. As someone coming out of college, this very city she was born in feels completely new now that I have to deal with the uncertainty of the road ahead of her. She cannot wait to see this project come to fruition, and to work with such a talented cast and crew.

SARA DAVIS (Sound Mixer) is excited to be on the project of ONLY IN NEW YORK! She is a recent graduate of TCNJ. She love the world of sound and has a passion for sound editing.
 
Here's the breakdown of what we need to make ONLY IN NEW YORK a success. This is the bare bones to pay our actors and crew.  They'll be eating a lot of $1 slice pizzas but art is made of love and no-toppings cheese pizza.
 

 

    
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Risks and Challenges
There are always risks when working on set and on a micro budget, luckily we have an awesome production team willing to take on those challenges. Our main risk is a change to our production schedule. We plan to shoot in September but that could change based on actor availability or any unforeseen problems.
